The fog hides everything, even the stars. Feels like were cut off from the world.
Every now and then, the fog clears just enough to tease you. Then it swallows you again.
The way the fog clings to everything it feels wrong, unnatural.
This fog doesnt feel like weather. It feels like a warning.
Ive heard stories of stalkers vanishing in fog like this. Makes you wonder where they went.
The fog muffles every sound, except the ones you dont want to hear.
Its hard to tell if the fog is hiding me from danger, or if its hiding danger from me.
Every rustle in the fog feels amplified, like the whole worlds watching.
Some say the fogs a side effect of the Zones experiments. If thats true, what else is out here?
Even with company, this fog makes you feel completely alone.
Ive been walking for hours, but in this fog, it feels like I havent moved at all.
The fog has a way of playing tricks on your mind. Stay sharp, stay sane.
In the fog, every shadow becomes a monster. Most of them arent real. Most.
The fog hides a lot of things. I just hope its not hiding what I think it is.
This fog feels heavier than usual. Almost like its alive.
The fogs bad enough, but the silence is what really gets to you.
They say fog like this brings out the worst the Zone has to offer. Lets hope theyre wrong.
In the fog, every path feels the same. Just keep moving and hope for the best.
The fogs so thick, its like walking through a wall. Makes you wonder whats waiting on the other side.
This fog isnt natural. Its too still, too quiet. Be ready for anything.
We fought in the fog; I could barely see my own hand. Bullets flying blind, but somehow we made it.
Mutants came out of nowhere in the fog. By the time we realized, it was already too late for half the group.
The fog swallowed us whole, but I swear I saw figures moving out there. They didnt look human.
A gunfight broke out in the fog. Couldn't see a damn thing, just flashes and screams.
The fog saved us. The mercs couldnt find our camp, but we could hear them cursing nearby.
I aimed at the sound, not the sight. In this fog, you pray your target isnt a friend.
We heard growls, then shots, and then silence. Whatever was in that fog, I hope its gone now.
Ambushed in the fog. They had the upper hand, but luck was on our side. Barely made it out.
The fog was so thick, I ended up fighting a bush for five minutes before realizing my mistake.
Someone fired a shot in the fog, and chaos erupted. Nobody knew who to trust or where to aim.
We ran into another group in the fog. No one said a word, but the tension was unbearable. Guns ready, but no shots fired.
Fighting a Bloodsucker in the fog? Its like trying to punch a shadow. Pray you survive long enough to see it run.
My knife saved me. In the fog, firearms are just noise and missed opportunities.
We heard footsteps circling us in the fog. Turned out it was just the wind or was it?
Outnumbered in the fog, but they didnt count on us knowing the terrain better. Turned their ambush against them.
Fog turned the battlefield into a nightmare. By the end, we didnt even know how many were left standing.
Someone screamed in the fog, and everything stopped. Friend or foe, Ill never know.
The fog turned our fight into chaos. By the time it cleared, I wasnt sure who we were shooting at anymore.
We waited silently in the fog, listening to the mercs argue just a few meters away. Timing was everything.
A chimera attacked us in the fog. We didnt see it coming until it was on top of us.
The fog is a cruel ally. It hid us from the mutants but also hid them from us.
We used the fog to escape. They didnt follow, but I could feel their eyes on us the whole time.
Every shot echoed endlessly in the fog. It felt like we were surrounded by ghosts.
We fought something in the fog, but when it cleared, there was no sign of a body. Not even blood.
The fog made us desperate. We attacked a shadow, only to realize it was one of our own.
The bandits thought they had us cornered, but the fog gave us the cover we needed to turn the tide.
Someone shouted a warning in the fog, and then the screaming started. I didnt stick around to find out why.
The fog made it impossible to see, but you could feel the tension in the air. One wrong move, and it wouldve been over.
We heard gunshots in the fog. Never found out who fired them, or why.
The fog split us up. By the time it cleared, half of us were gone.
They thought they were safe in the fog. We proved them wrong.
A firefight in the fog feels like a game of chance. You shoot and pray you hit the right target.
Fogs so thick, I nearly shook hands with a Pseudodog. Thankfully, it didnt take offense.
Got lost in the fog and ended up at the same campfire twice. I think the Zones messing with me.
Heard footsteps in the fog. Turns out it was just Ivan looking for his lunch.
Fogs so thick, I thought I spotted a mutant. Nope, just my reflection in a puddle.
Tripped on a branch in the fog. Mutants probably heard me, but at least no one saw that embarrassment.
Shot at a shadow in the fog. Congratulations to the tree for surviving my assault.
Fogs a double-edged sword: hides me from the mutants, but also hides the mutants from me. Great.
I swear I saw a stalker wave at me in the fog. Turned out to be a very enthusiastic tree.
Someone yelled my name in the fog. I yelled back. Now were both lost.
The fogs so bad, I thought I was walking forward. Turns out, I was walking in place for five minutes.
Stepped in a puddle so deep I thought I found a new anomaly. Nope, just bad luck.
Saw a shadow move in the fog. Prepared to fight... then realized it was just my own paranoia.
The fog hides everything, including my sense of direction. Might be time for a map.
Fogs so thick, I apologized to a bush. Thought it was a bandit.
I love fogmakes it easy to sneak. Until you trip over a Flesh and ruin the whole plan.
Fogs hiding something out there. Probably my dignity after I fell into a ditch.
It's raining, boys.
You know what I really need in this rain? A cigarette. Who got some for me?
Let the rain wash your sins away.
I feel like staying inside today.
No thanks, I don't want to get wet today.
I can feel my ass getting wet... Should've bought a better outfit.
You guys think mutants hide during the rain?
The rain is getting inside my mask...
The rain's pouring, and so is my patience.
Great, just what I needed. More rain.
The storms getting louder. Guess thats just the Zone being the Zone.
The rains relentless today. Feels like its trying to drown the whole world.
Cant hear anything over the damn rain. Its all just noise now.
Great, now well be soaking wet and surrounded by mutants. Whats next?
Feels like the sky itself is angry today.
Shit, I can barely see through the downpour. Keep your guard up.
Cant trust anyone in this weather. Not even the rain.
If this rain keeps up, well be stuck here for days.
Every drop of rain feels like a reminder: the Zone never stops.
Hoping this rain clears up soon. I dont want to be stuck out here when night falls.
My boots are soaked, and I feel like I'm walking through a damn swamp.
Its hard to tell if its the rain or my paranoia kicking in.
The rain doesnt care about us. It never does.
Nothing worse than trying to stay dry in the Zone. Its like fighting the air itself.
The rains not letting up. Lets hope the mutants are taking the day off.
The storms pushing us deeper into the Zone. Cant see the path anymore.
The rains got a way of turning everything into mud and misery.
In this rain, everything's a shadow. Stay sharp, friends.
Can't trust the weather in the Zone. One minute it's clear, the next it's a downpour.
Every damn time it rains, the Zone feels even more hostile.
The rains getting heavier. Could be a bad omen.
The rains washing away the footprints, but it wont hide the danger.
In this downpour, the Zones secrets seem to hide better.
Its like the Zone itself is trying to drown everything, including us.
Rains making everything more slippery, but I can still hear something moving out there.
If we dont find cover soon, this rain's going to turn into a damn flood.
The rains relentless. Makes it harder to track anything, human or mutant.
Can't tell if it's the rain or the radiation that's messing with my senses today.
The rains cold, but its better than the heat of the midday sun in the Zone.
The wet grounds making it hard to move silently. Gotta watch my step.
Every drop of rain feels like a countdown, like something bads about to happen.
The rains not just water, its like the Zones trying to wash away the past.
Hope the rain doesnt bring any new surprises today. The last time it did, we lost good men.
This rain is making everything feel... heavier. Like the Zone itself is mourning something.
Can't shake the feeling that something's lurking out there in the rain... and its waiting for us.
The rains blocking my vision. Ill have to rely on my ears more.
It's the kind of rain that feels like its been falling for a hundred years.
The rain's not the worst part. It's what comes after that worries me.
Rain's coming down like a curtain. Feels like somethings hiding just behind it.
This rain's got a rhythm, like footsteps in the distance. Makes me uneasy.
The ground's turning to mud. Perfect for slowing us down, but not them.
Rains making the air feel thicker, harder to breathe. Or maybe its just fear.
It's quiet except for the rain. Too quiet. I don't trust it.
Last time it rained like this, we got ambushed. Lets not repeat that mistake.
The rains washing away tracks, but its also masking sounds. A hunters weather.
Rain's messing with my scope. If something comes, I'll have to get up close and personal.
Water dripping everywhere, but its the silence between drops thats got me on edge.
The rain might clean the air, but it muddies the ground. One slip could mean the end out here.
Every time it rains like this, I feel like Im walking through someones memory.
The rains falling hard, and so is morale. We need to find shelter soon.
The sound of rain on metal is almost comforting, but not enough to lower my guard.
With this rain, even the mutants are probably hunkered down. Doesnt mean were safe, though.
Rain makes everything harder. But at least its hiding my scent from the Bloodsuckers.
The rains relentless. Its like the Zones trying to drown out the world.
Rain always brings back memories. Not all of them good.
The sound of the rains almost hypnotic. Dangerous to let your guard down, though.
Rains making the anomalies harder to spot. Gotta tread carefully.
Rain like this makes the Zone feel even lonelier.
Visibilitys shot in this rain. Hope we dont stumble into something we cant handle.
The rains got a strange smell to it. Cant tell if its the Zone or just my imagination.
Heavy rain, heavy thoughts. This place does that to you.
With rain like this, every step feels like dragging a thousand pounds. Keep moving.
The rains cold, but its better than the silence. At least this feels normal.
Rains washing away the tracks, but not the memories.
Even the rain cant drown out the whispers of this place. Or maybe its just in my head.
The rains heavy, but the weight on my shoulders feels heavier.
The rains falling harder now. Feels like the Zones trying to push us back.
The rain turns everything into a blur. Easy to get lost if youre not careful.
The rains masking the sound of footsteps. Could be good, could be bad. Stay alert.
Rains a blessing and a curse out here. Keeps us hidden, but blinds us too.
Slipped on some wet rocks and nearly broke my damn leg. Watch your step out there.
The rains coming down so hard its drowning out my radio. If I go silent, dont assume Im fine.
Just saw something move through the rain. Couldve been a Snork or worse.
Tripped into a puddle, and now my PDAs glitching. Great, just what I needed.
Rains making the ground slick, nearly slid straight into an anomaly. Lucky, this time.
A Bloodsucker attacked us in the raindamn thing was almost invisible. Barely made it out.
My rifle jammed because of this rain. If something comes at me now, Im screwed.
Lightning lit up the sky, and I swear I saw a pack of mutants heading our way.
Rains filling up the cracks in my boots. Feels like Im walking with bricks tied to my feet.
The rains hiding the sound of growls. Whatevers out there is getting closer, I can feel it.
Had to ditch some geartoo waterlogged to carry anymore. Hope I dont regret it.
The rain turned the campfire into a pit of mud. Guess were eating cold rations tonight.
A Chimera came out of nowhere in the downpour. We barely scared it off with a flare.
Rain shorted out my headlamp. If something comes at me now, Ill never see it.
Stepped in a puddle deeper than it lookedlost a boot and nearly fell in completely.
This downpour is like a curtain. A Stalker could be five feet away, and I wouldnt even know it.
Rain started a landslide near our path. Had to find another way around. Cost us hours.
Rains turning our ammo stash into a soggy mess. Hope it still fires when we need it.
Waters seeping into everything. Even my maps are falling apart. Gonna have to rely on memory now.
Rains heavy enough to knock down branches. One nearly hit me on the head.
Got separated from the group in the rain. Cant hear a damn thing over this downpour.
Lightning struck nearby and scared off a pack of dogs. For once, Im grateful for the storm.
Lost sight of the anomaly field with all this rain. Hope we dont stumble into it by accident.
Fell into a ditch filled with rainwater. Now Im soaked and freezing. Great.
The rains making it impossible to see the horizon. Could walk right into trouble without even realizing it.
A mutant ambush in this rain would be a nightmare. Hope theyre hiding from it too.
The rain turned the trail into a river. Had to cross it and nearly got swept away.
Rains making every shadow look like a threat. Cant tell whats real anymore.
Rain got in my gun sight. If something attacks, Ill be aiming blind.
The rains so loud, I didnt hear the anomaly until it was right next to me. Close call.
Got caught in an electrical storm during the rain. Barely found cover in time.
Tripped on a hidden root, and now my gears soaked. Couldnt ask for a better day, huh?
The rains washing away footprints, which might save us from being tracked. Small blessings.
Ran into a pack of boars in the rain. Slippery ground made it a nightmare to fight them off.
Had to take shelter under a crumbling roof. This rain doesnt seem like itll stop anytime soon.
The rains turning this place into a swamp. Feels like were wading through quicksand.
Rains making it tough to light a fire. Guess were stuck with cold rations tonight.
Almost slipped off a ledge. Wet rocks and bad footingbad combination in this rain.
Lightning keeps flashing, and I keep thinking I see figures in the distance. Maybe its just my nerves.
Got ambushed by a controller during the rain. The sounds of the storm drowned out its approach.
The rains masking our scent. Maybe well avoid attracting mutants for a while.
Rains filling up the craters. Stepped into one and sank halfway to my knees.
A flash flood nearly took out our camp. Spent hours digging a trench to redirect the water.
The rains soaking through my pack. If I lose my PDA to this, Im screwed.
Saw a mutant lurking just at the edge of my vision. Rains making it too risky to move out there.
Rains drumming on the roof, and its getting harder to tell the difference between the sound and footsteps.
Somethings stalking us in the rain. Its using the noise to hide its movements.
The downpours making it hard to hear anything, but I swear I just caught a low growl nearby.
Found a small cave to wait out the rain. Hope it doesnt have any occupants.
The rains hiding the scent of fresh blood. Whatever killed that stalker is still out there.
A mutant attacked us in the rain. Could barely see it until it was right on top of us.
The rains so loud its drowning out our radios. If we get separated, were on our own.
Nearly slipped into an anomaly hidden by the rain. Got lucky this time.
Rains made our weapons slippery. Almost dropped my rifle during the last encounter.
The rains washing away all the blood from that fight. Almost like it never happened.
A sudden gust of wind and rain knocked over our gear. Lost a lot of supplies to the mud.
The rains so thick you cant even see your own shadow. Perfect for an ambush.
Rains pooling in the low ground. Had to climb higher to avoid getting stuck.
A pack of pseudodogs attacked during the rain. Their growls were almost drowned out by the storm.
Got caught in the rain and had to abandon our campfire. At least the mutants will leave it alone.
Rains making it hard to see anomalies. Almost stumbled into one earlier.
Rains gotten into my boots, and now every step feels like carrying a bucket of water.
The rains chilling me to the bone. If we dont find shelter soon, well be in trouble.
Mutants seem to love the rain. Saw a pack of them roaming closer than usual.
The rains loud enough to mask gunshots. Guess thats one way to stay unnoticed.
The rain's making everything slick. Almost fell while trying to climb a ridge.
Got into a firefight in the rain. Couldn't tell if I hit them until they stopped shooting.
The rains masking our movements, but its also hiding whats hunting us.
A bloodsucker attacked in the rain. We didnt even hear it coming.
Rains filling the air with the smell of wet dirt and decay. Somethings close.
Lost my flashlight in the rain. Guess Im navigating by instinct now.
The rain made it impossible to see the controller until it was too late.
Rains drowning out the sound of my Geiger counter. Hope Im not walking into a hot zone.
Lightning lit up the sky for just a second. Thought I saw something massive out there.
The rains relentless, and my gears starting to feel like dead weight.
Saw a shadow moving in the rain. Cant tell if its friend or foe.
The rains making my scope useless. Cant see more than a few meters ahead.
Stumbled into a nest of fleshes during the downpour. Barely got away.
Rain turned the trail into a muddy mess. Almost lost my footing a dozen times.
Got caught in the open during the rain. Had to dive into a ditch to avoid a patrol.
Rains making the forest come alive with noise. Cant tell whats real and whats just the wind.
The rains covering our tracks, but its also hiding the ones were following.
Rain soaked through my pack. Lost some ammo to the water. Damn it.
The rain turned our campsite into a swamp. Everythings soaked now.
A mutant ambush during the rainperfect cover for them, a nightmare for us.
Lightning illuminated the horizon. Saw something moving, and it wasnt human.
The rains so loud, even the anomalies are quieter than usual.
The downpours making everything heavier. Even my boots feel like lead.
The rains so thick its muffling gunshots. Cant tell where theyre coming from.
Had to use my jacket to cover the rifle. Dont want it jamming in the middle of a fight.
The rains making it impossible to navigate. Feels like were wandering in circles.
Almost walked into an anomaly hidden by the rain. Barely stopped in time.
Found an old shelter to wait out the rain. Looks abandoned, but who knows?
The rains creating small rivers everywhere. Nearly got swept off my feet by one.
Rains turning everything into a slippery deathtrap. Moving slow is the only way.
The rains hiding my scent, but its also making it harder to track our target.
The rains a blessing and a curse. Keeps the mutants at bay, but its slowing us down.
Rains making everything so damp my lighter wont even spark. No fire tonight.
Rains so bad even the mutants are probably cuddling for warmth.
At least the rain washes away the stench of my last meal... or lack of it.
Rains got my boots so wet I might as well be swimming to my next stash.
If I hear one more squelch from my boots, Im tossing them into the next anomaly.
Rain's so loud, I almost didnt hear my own stomach growling. Almost.
Well, at least the rains giving me a free shower. Been weeks since the last one.
Got drenched and slipped into a puddle. Lets just say the Zone doesnt do dignity.
The rains bad, but the worst part? Wet socks. Absolutely miserable.
I swear this rains trying to drown us, one drop at a time.
My canteen's empty, but hey, at least the rains keeping me hydrated... kind of.
This rain is so relentless, Im starting to believe the Zones got a twisted sense of humor.
Rains making everything slick. I slipped, and now I owe my pride an apology.
Found shelter, but the roof leaks. Guess Im only half-soaked now. Progress?
Rains so heavy, I wouldnt be surprised if snorks start wearing floaties.
The good news? Rain keeps the boars away. The bad news? I might have trench foot by morning.
Rains so loud I cant even hear my own excuses for being out here.
If I stay out in this rain any longer, Ill turn into a mutant fish. At least thatd be unique.
Lightning struck nearby, and I think I just set a new personal jump scare record.
Rains pouring so hard it feels like the Zones trying to drown me on purpose.
Forgot my raincoat. Guess Ill just embrace being a soggy mess.
Slipped in the mud and landed on my stash. At least the Zones having a good laugh.
The rains relentless, but hey, at least its washing off the bloodstains from yesterday.
Rain's not so bad until you realize your spare socks are wet too.
The Zones cruel, but this rain? Its just petty.
Better stay inside until the storm ends.
Storm? Right when I'm about to do my contract? What bad luck.
When is this storm gonna end?
The Zone is angry at us.
No thanks, I don't want to get wet today.
You know what I really need in this storm? A campfire, a guitar to play next to it, and a bottle of vodka.
Shit, my mask... I can barely see in this storm.
You guys think mutants hide during storms too?
Great... my PDA is wet, just what I need...
I can feel my ass getting wet, should've bought a better outfit.
This storm's not natural... I can feel it in my bones.
The winds are howling like somethings screaming from the depths of the Zone.
Cant tell if the storms getting worse or if its just my nerves. Somethings not right.
Hell, I thought the storm was a mutant at first. It's that bad out here.
These storms arent just a weather phenomenon... theyre part of the Zone's curse.
I can hear something in the storm... dont know if its the wind or something else.
The storms rattling my bones. I hate being stuck in this mess.
The storms making it hard to even hear my own thoughts. I hope its over soon.
Everythings so quiet after the storm... too quiet. You ever get the feeling somethings watching?
Does anyone even know where the storms coming from? Feels like the whole Zones on fire.
This storms not letting up. I guess Im stuck here for now.
Its the kind of storm that feels like the Zone itself is throwing a tantrum.
The lightning out here feels like its out to get me. I just need to stay alive through this.
The storms already wrecked half my gear. Great. Just great.
Even the mutants know to hunker down in this storm. The rest of us are just trying to survive it.
I can barely see a foot in front of me... Hope Im not walking straight into a trap.
The winds howling through the wreckage like a banshee. Someones gonna lose their head if theyre not careful.
I'm getting tired of this damn storm. I didnt sign up for a test of patience.
Stay close, the storms bad, but the real danger is what comes after.
This storms not natural... Its like the Zones showing us just how little control we have here.
I swear, every time the lightning strikes, I feel the ground tremble beneath me.
The storms relentless. Id say its not worth heading out, but I dont have much of a choice.
This storms stronger than usual. Better stay alert.
The winds biting today, but at least its not cold enough to freeze my gear.
The storms picking up, but Ive seen worse. Just need to ride it out.
Cant think straight with all this noise. Hopefully, the storm clears soon.
It feels like somethings off with this storm, but its probably just the Zone doing its thing.
The storms heavy, but the mutants are quiet. Guess were not the only ones hiding out from it.
The thunders shaking everything, but its nothing I cant handle. Just need to stay focused.
The storms a bit much, but Im more worried about what its hiding in the distance.
The winds cold, but nothing I havent dealt with before. Just gotta keep moving.
Lightnings striking hard today. Not a good time to be out in the open, but Ive got no choice.
This storms pretty intense, but Ill wait it out. Itll pass, like they always do.
Lightnings flashing everywhere. Better not stay in one spot too long.
Ive seen worse storms, but this ones got a bit more bite. Just have to keep an eye out for trouble.
The storms making everything feel smaller. Guess its just the way things are out here.
The storms loud, but its nothing I havent heard before. Its just part of life here.
This storm feels alive, like its hunting something... or someone.
The winds are howling, and the Zone feels angrier than usual. Best stay sharp.
Ive seen storms tear through whole squads. This ones got the same energy.
Feels like the thunders chasing me. Better not stop moving.
Storm like this makes me wonder if the Zones trying to wash us out.
Rain this heavy feels like needles. Gotta find shelter before it soaks through my gear.
Lightnings too close for comfort. Feels like its got my name on it.
Storms like this always make me think something worse is coming.
The Zone seems to love storms. Guess it keeps the foolish ones inside.
Even the mutants seem to respect this storm. Havent seen a single one in hours.
The rains loud, almost loud enough to drown out the sound of danger. Almost.
Feels like the storms trying to push me back. Guess Im heading in the right direction.
Every step in this weather feels like a fight. Nothing out here comes easy.
This storms not normal. Feels like its trying to bury the Zone itself.
The thunder isnt just noise its like the Zone itself is speaking. And its angry.
The skys torn apart by lightning. Feels like the Zones at war with itself.
This storm... its like its watching us, waiting for us to slip up.
The clouds look like theyre boiling. Ive never seen anything like it before.
The winds so loud its like the Zones trying to drown out all other sounds.
Rains washing away the tracks, but something tells me were still being followed.
The storm feels endless, like its trying to trap us here forever.
Lightnings lighting up the sky like flares. Wonder whats lurking in the shadows it reveals.
The Zone feels different in a storm, like its holding its breath before something big happens.
The wind keeps whispering, but I cant make out the words. Maybe its better that way.
Feels like the storms pushing us towards something... or trying to keep us away.
The airs electric, and not just because of the lightning. Somethings coming.
The rains relentless. Its like the Zones trying to wash away all traces of us.
Ever notice how storms out here feel alive? Like theyre chasing you down.
The thunders shaking my bones. Its a good reminder of how small we are out here.
The skys dark, but the lightning keeps showing glimpses of something out there.
Even the mutants are quiet in this weather. That should terrify me more than it comforts me.
The rains drowning out the sound of footsteps... or maybe thats just wishful thinking.
The storms battering us, but its the silence between the thunderclaps that scares me most.
Winds howling like a wounded beast. Makes you wonder whats out there suffering.
The lightnings so bright its blinding, and I cant shake the feeling its deliberate.
The storms a perfect cover for us, or for whatevers stalking us.
This storms no ordinary weather. Its like the Zones throwing everything it has at us.
The grounds slick, and every step feels like a risk. I hate this kind of weather.
Thunders rolling across the Zone like a warning. Wish I knew what it meant.
Rain like this hides a lot and reveals even more.
Cant tell if its just the storm or something else moving out there.
Feels like the storms watching us, deciding what to do next.
The lightnings too regular, too deliberate. I dont trust it.
Something about this storm feels wrong, even for the Zone.
Every flash of lightning feels like a spotlight, and Im in the center of it.
Rains washing away the blood, but the memories are harder to get rid of.
This storms bad, but its the calm that follows it that really scares me.
The storm feels alive, like its searching for something... or someone.
Each lightning strike feels closer than the last, like its zeroing in on us.
Somethings moving with the storm. I swear I saw it in the last flash of lightning.
The thunder doesnt echo. It growls, like something waiting in the dark.
The rain feels heavier than it should, like its trying to drown the world.
The winds whispering secrets, and none of them sound good.
This isnt just a storm. Its a warning and were ignoring it.
Ever feel like the storms watching you? Like it knows exactly where you are?
The shadows in the rain move wrong, like theyre not really shadows at all.
The lightning isnt natural. It flashes too fast, too bright, like its searching for prey.
The ground trembles with every thunderclap. Its like the Zone itself is restless.
The storms drowning out the world, but I can still hear something moving just beyond the wind.
The rains so thick, it feels like the Zone doesnt want us to see whats coming.
The lightning keeps lighting up the horizon, but I wish it wouldnt. I dont like what Im seeing.
The storm feels wrong, like its not here by chance. Like its been sent.
The thunder doesnt just shake the air it feels like its shaking my soul.
The Zones storms always felt alive, but this one... this one feels like its hunting us.
Well, at least the mutants are probably hiding from this storm too. Right?
If the Zone wants me to take a shower, it couldve at least warmed up the rain.
Great, my gears soaked. Ill be squelching around like a clown all day.
This storms so loud, I bet even the bloodsuckers are plugging their ears.
Who needs a flashlight when lightnings doing the job for free?
Its raining sideways. Must be the Zones idea of a spa day.
The storms so bad, I just saw a snork using an umbrella. No joke.
Ive been out here for hours, and my socks feel like Im wearing fish tanks.
Zone weather forecast: 100% chance of me regretting this mission.
The thunders so loud, its like the Zones trying to start a metal band.
At least this storm keeps the stalkers smelling better. A wet dogs better than no shower.
If I get struck by lightning, Im suing whoever manages this place. Oh wait...
Its official: I hate storms more than anomalies. At least anomalies dont soak your underwear.
The lightning flashes so much, Im starting to feel like Im at a rave. Wheres the DJ?
This storms so bad, even the mutants are probably cuddling for warmth.
If the Zone doesnt kill me, this storms going to make me die of embarrassment soaked to my skivvies.
Next time Im packing an inflatable raft. This rains turning the Zone into a water park.
This storm is awakening the mutants...
The winds so strong, I saw a flesh trying to hold onto a tree. Poor guy lost the battle.
The Zones storms dont just soak you; they get into your soul and wring it out for fun.
Lightning hit an anomaly out there. Im not sticking around to see what that creates.
The rain feels like needles on my face. Either that, or the Zone found a new way to hurt me.
Who needs a shower when the Zones rain feels radioactive? Im glowing already.
This storms so bad, even my vodkas getting watered down. Thats the real tragedy.
Ever seen a pseudo-dog slide in the mud? This storms got everyone struggling out here.
The thunder feels like its shaking the anomalies. This cant end well.
My gears soaked, my boots are squelching, and Im pretty sure my pride drowned an hour ago.
The Zones storm playlist: thunder, wind, and the occasional stalker cursing the skies.
Heard a bloodsucker scream in this storm. Either its angry, or its as miserable as I am.
This rains so cold, Im starting to think the Zones punishing me for something. But what?
Lightning lit up the whole swamp. For a second, it looked like the Zone was showing me its teeth.
My raincoats about as useful as a tissue in this storm. Thanks, Zone.
I swear the thunders laughing at me. The Zones sense of humor is cruel.
The rains turning this place into quicksand. The Zone doesnt need mutants when the muds doing the work.
Saw a controller walking in this storm. Even it looked miserable. Thats saying something.
Storms so bad, I think my flashlights given up on life. Same, buddy, same.
Just slipped in the mud and landed on my rifle. If the Zone doesnt kill me, humiliation might.
The Zones storms have a special kind of misery. They dont just hit you; they stay with you.
This storms so loud, I couldnt hear my Geiger counter. Lets hope that doesnt come back to haunt me.
The lightnings so close, I think I just got a tan. Zone luxury at its finest.
The rains coming down sideways. Not even the anomalies know what to do with this mess.
Storms bad enough, and now my boots are filled with mud. Thanks for the full spa treatment, Zone.
Just saw a boar get struck by lightning. Smelled like barbecue for a second. Tempting, but no thanks.
The thunders so constant, I cant tell if its the sky or a mutant stampede anymore.
This storms making me rethink every life choice that brought me here. Starting with this mission.
The rains so thick, I might as well be swimming through the Zone. Could use some goggles.
Saw an artifact light up in this storm. Either its more active, or its mocking me for being out here.
Got hit by a branch in this storm. The Zones throwing hands now.
The Zones idea of a storm is like its idea of mercy: nonexistent and cruel.
Even the anomalies look miserable in this storm. I didnt think that was possible.
The storms so bad, I just saw a mutant running for cover. Thats a first.
The Zones storms dont just rain; they hunt you. I swear this winds got a grudge against me.
Lightning struck an anomaly right in front of me. The explosion lit up the whole Zone... and my nerves.
The storms so fierce, I cant even hear my own thoughts. Maybe thats for the best out here.
I thought I saw a shadow in the rain. It wasnt moving like a stalker... or a mutant.
This storm feels alive, like the Zones breathing down my neck. I cant shake the feeling Im being watched.
Thunder rolled across the sky so loud, I thought the Zone itself was tearing apart.
Every flash of lightning feels like a spotlight in the dark. I just hope its not pointing me out to something.
The storm turned the forest into a maze of shadows. I cant tell if theyre moving or if its just my mind.
The rain is so cold it feels like its cutting through my suit. Zone weather never does anything halfway.
Something screamed in the distance during the last thunderclap. I dont know if it was human... or worse.
The storms pushing me towards the swamps, and I dont like where this is heading.
Lightnings hitting so close I can feel the static. The Zones trying to cook me alive.
Every step I take in this storm feels heavier, like the Zones trying to pull me into the mud.
I just saw something in the rain. It moved fast, too fast for anything human.
The storms so loud, I didnt hear the mutant coming until it was almost too late.
This storms turning the Zone into a nightmare. Every shadow looks like its about to jump at me.
The storms bad enough, but the air feels wrong. Like something big is coming.
I heard laughter on the wind during the last lightning strike. Im not sticking around to find out whoor whatit was.
The rains so heavy I can barely see. Perfect hunting weather... for something else.
Lightning just lit up the Zone for a split second. I wish I hadnt seen what it revealed.
Each step in the mud feels like the Zones trying to drag me under. This storm doesnt want me to leave.
The winds howling so loud, it sounds like its carrying voices. I hope its just the storm playing tricks.
Something just moved across the lightnings glow. Whatever it was, it was too big to be human.
The Zones storm feels like its alive, like its hunting everything unlucky enough to be caught in it.
Lightning strikes keep hitting near me. Either the Zones toying with me, or its aiming for something else.
The muds so thick I can barely move. Its like the Zones trying to hold me in place for something to find me.
Every thunderclap feels closer than the last. I cant tell if its the storm or something stalking me.
The storms got me pinned down, and I swear I heard a bloodsucker out there in the dark.
The lightnings relentless. Every flash makes me feel like Im not the only thing out here.
I cant tell if the Zones trying to drown me or scare me to death with this storm. Maybe both.
Just saw an anomaly light up during the storm. Its glowing brighter now. That cant be good.
Somethings wrong with this storm. The Zone feels... angrier than usual.
The rains so cold it burns. Either this storms unnatural, or the Zones playing with me again.
The Zones storms dont just test your gearthey test your sanity. Every sound out there feels alive.
Lightning just struck so close, I swear I felt the hair on my neck rise. The Zones reminding me whos boss.
The storms wind just threw my hood back, and for a second, it felt like the Zone wanted to look me in the eyes.
I saw something crawling in the mud during the last lightning flash. It wasnt human, and it wasnt friendly.
The thunder feels too rhythmic, like its trying to send a message. I dont want to know who its for.
The rains so relentless, I cant tell whats water and whats sweat. Or blood. Maybe I dont want to know.
The winds pulling at me, like its trying to drag me somewhere. Somewhere I dont want to go.
I thought I saw a figure standing still in the rain. When the lightning came, it wasnt there anymore.
Every step I take in this storm feels like Im being followed. The Zone loves to play these games.
Lightning just illuminated a pack of mutants in the distance. Theyre moving faster than the storm itself.
The storm feels like its closing in on me, like its alive and angry. I need to find shelterfast.
Something just growled in the shadows. It wasnt thunder, and it sure wasnt human.
Rains hitting so hard its drowning out my thoughts. Maybe thats for the best in the Zone.
Saw an artifact glowing brighter with every lightning strike. Either its charging, or its about to blow.
This storms so dark, I cant tell if Im looking at the horizon or a mutant waiting to pounce.
The thunder keeps rattling my gear. Either Im shaking, or the Zones trying to unnerve me. Probably both.
Every shadow in this storm feels like its moving closer. I cant tell whats real anymore.
I heard something running through the rain. Too heavy for a stalker. Too quiet for comfort.
The storms tearing through the trees, and I swear I heard a scream mixed in with the wind.
The rains coming down so hard it feels like its trying to drown the Zone itself.
Lightning just struck a tree nearby, and for a second, I thought I saw something run from the blast.
The winds howling like a chorus of voices. If its trying to scare me, its working.
The storm feels endless, like its been here forever. Maybe this part of the Zone doesnt have normal weather anymore.
Every time the thunder cracks, I think I hear footsteps right behind me. But when I turn, theres nothing there.
Saw a mutant dart through the rain, only to vanish when the lightning hit. Now Im not sure if I saw anything at all.
The Zones storms are worse than any firefight. At least in a firefight, you know what youre up against.
My Geiger counters clicking faster with every lightning strike. Whatever this storms doing, its not natural.
Lightning keeps flashing, and with every flash, I feel like the shadows around me are moving closer.
The storms relentless, and now the anomalies are acting up. This isnt just bad weatherits a warning.
The Zones storms dont just drench youthey seep into your bones. I feel colder than ever before.
The lightning keeps lighting up the area, and every time, I see shapes that werent there before.
I cant shake the feeling the storms trying to herd me somewhere. But whereand why?
The thunders so loud, I didnt even hear the mutant until it was too close. Barely made it out alive.
The rains so heavy it feels like the Zone itself is crying. But what for?
The skies are bruised tonight, and every lightning bolt rips at the fabric of reality. The Zone is writing its own eulogy in the heavens.
Thunder claps now serve as a sinister metronome, counting down to a moment even the Zone might dread.
The relentless downpour sounds like a chorus of lost soulsa morbid lullaby that haunts every step.
Every flash reveals twisted silhouettes in the distance; these arent mere shadows, but echoes of old nightmares.
I swear I saw a figure dancing with the storma fleeting glimpse that could be a mutant or just my imagination on edge.
The howling wind carries voices, half-remembered warnings that make every rustle seem like a threat.
This isnt a natural furyits as if the Zone itself is venting its rage, shaking the earth with every gust.
The rain here feels like acid, a corrosive mix of water and regret that burns through both gear and hope.
Lightning scars the sky in jagged lines, and for a heartbeat, I wondered if the Zone was signaling an unholy pact with the void.
Every rumble carries the weight of forgotten sins, echoing over a landscape thats long abandoned mercy.
Between each thunderclap lies a silence so heavy it feels like the calm before a storm of chaos.
The storm is a brutal reminder that the Zone cares nothing for us, yet it makes sure we never forget our insignificance with every drop.
The ground trembles under a wind that howls like a beast unchained; tonight, the Zone is on a rampage and were all its prey.
With every lightning strike, the horizon shifts into a surreal montage of chaos and despaira display only the Zone could conjure.
The rain turns the world into a mirror reflecting my battered soul, each drop a reminder of relentless, unyielding misery.
Every flash now seems deliberate, as if the storm is pointing a skeletal finger at anyone daring enough to survive in this forsaken land.
The deluge is like a mad artist, painting despair in strokes of black and blue, each one more haunting than the last.
Even my gear screams under the relentless hail and wind. The Zones a ruthless critic, and tonight its giving its harshest review.
As the storm rages on, I cant shake the feeling that nature itself is rebelling, tearing down the remnants of civilization with every furious gust.
Im soaked to the bone, but the real chill comes in the silence after the storma moment when the Zones cruel humor echoes in every raindrop.
Oi, this damn storms pummeling everything like a drunken brawler on a bad night. Feels like the Zones lost its mind.
The winds howling like a pissed-off babushka, and Im standing here wondering if its gonna tear me apart.
Damn, the rains slapping me like spilled cheap vodka on cracked concrete. No mercy tonight.
Every flash of lightning feels like a sucker punch in the gut. This storms a full on brawl.
The Zones gone mad, I tell ya. This storms as rough as a back-alley scrap after one too many shots.
Feels like Im being chased by the ghost of my last bender every time thunder crashes. Aint no ordinary night.
These winds could knock the boots clean off a drunkard. Im clinging to life like a stray in a hurricane of misery.
The rains so cold it cuts like a rusty blademakes you question every lousy choice you ever made.
Even my old tracksuits seen better days. This storms got more bite than a rabid mutt on a bad trip.
Every gusts a reminder of a shoddy brawl in a dank squat. Fists, curses, and no one left standing.
The thunder roars like a drunken shout from the depths, louder than a gaggle of gopniks on a vodka run.
I swear the storms got its own battle cry.A furious mix of wind and rain thatd make any tough guy shudder.
This aint no gentle drizzleit's a hellish downpour that makes you want to hightail it back to your bunker.
The skys pissed off tonight, and each lightning strike lands like a brutal jab, reminding you whos boss.
Feels like the whole Zones throwing a drunken rave, with the storm as the DJ spinning chaos and cold fury.
Never felt rain that stings like thisits as bitter as cheap vodka, leaving you numb and downright pissed.
The winds howling like a mob of pissed-off babushkas, dragging you down if you let your guard down.
This storms brutal enough to knock a man flat, like a sucker punch from a drunk gopnik after a hard night out.
I swear the thunders got a swagger, rough and unapologetic, like a street fighter whos seen it all.
Tonight, the storms a ruthless bastard out for bloodeach drop slaps you hard, a grim reminder that the Zone dont give a damn.

Believe me when I say this: I don't wanna see a single chimera in my life.
You hear those growls in the distance? That's a bad sign, man.
We should stick close to each other, $name. I got your back.
Maybe it's none of my business, but what brought you here in the Zone, $name?
Freaking psy-dogs can control someone's brain, can you believe that? I'm telling you, I have no plans of being a dog's toy any time soon.
Have you ever heard stories about dark stalkers? They lurk in the shadows, ambush unsuspecting stalkers and drag them away somewhere, never to be seen again...
Running low on supplies... You wouldn't happen to have an extra medkit, would you?
My boots are falling apart. The Zone isn't kind to your gear.
Another day, another bloodsucker on the horizon. I swear they're multiplying.
Its getting colder out here... Maybe there's a storm coming.
There's something off about this place. Cant shake the feeling were being watched.
Remember, if you see a controller, don't let it get in your head. Id rather die by gunfire than that.
Ever wonder if were just pawns in some bigger game? Because it sure feels like it.
If I ever find out who thought it was a good idea to build a lab under all this, Im going to have some words with them.
Its been too quiet. Dont like this one bit. Were overdue for something nasty.
Theres a small settlement up ahead. I hope they have a drink or two to offer. My throats parched.
What do you think the Zone's real secret is? All the rumors... none of them seem to add up.
These things... those invisible anomalies? I hate them. You never know where they'll strike.
Even if we survive this, whats left for us? No home, no family... Just the Zone.
Do you hear that? Sounds like a mutant pack... Great, just what we needed.
Got to hand it to the guys who run this place, though. They've got the guts to survive where others can't.
You know, when we first entered the Zone, I thought Id just find some artifacts and get rich... Now Im just trying to stay alive.
If you see anything glowing out there, dont touch it. Trust me, some things are best left alone.
I once knew a stalker who thought he'd hit the jackpot... He ended up getting snatched by a chimera.
I'm getting sick of these bloodsuckers. One of them almost got me last time.
The other day, I found an old journal. Some poor bastard wrote about seeing shadows in the trees. I think he was right.
Sometimes I think about just walking away... but then I remember there's nowhere else to go.
Ive been thinking about heading to that old radar tower. Maybe theres something there worth checking out.
You can feel the tension in the air, right? Somethings brewing. I dont think were alone out here.
Ever wonder if we'll ever get out of this place? Or are we just stuck here forever?
Don't let the sound of the wind fool you. Its just the Zone playing its tricks on us.
If you think you saw a shadow move in the corner of your eye... you did. Trust your instincts.
One thing Ive learned: if you don't know what it is, don't touch it. The Zones full of surprises.
Its been a while since Ive seen a normal sunrise. Everything out here is just... off.
Dont go near the scorched forests. Thats where the worst of the mutants like to hide.
Whats that smell? Not just the usual decay... something worse.
Ive heard stories of people getting lost in the Zone. They dont even know theyre dead, wandering around, hearing voices.
The Zone has a way of making you feel like youre the only one left. I wouldnt wish that on anyone.
I dont trust the people who live here. Theyve been around the Zone too long. Makes you wonder what theyve seen.
If you're planning on going into that old factory, just remember: the floor might be the least dangerous thing in there.
Careful near the swamps. There are things there that dont make a sound until its too late.
The old labs? Stay far away from them. They say some of the experiments are still... active.
Ever wonder if were all just walking corpses, waiting for the Zone to claim us?
Ive seen things out here... Things that shouldnt exist. And I dont think anyone will believe us if we ever make it out alive.
We should have brought more ammo. The last few days have shown me that we cant be too prepared out here.
They say the Zone changes you. Im starting to believe it. Somethings different about the way I think now...
Every time the wind picks up, I feel like somethings going to jump out at us. We need to stay sharp.
I once saw a stalker with a whole stash of artifacts... He didnt make it out alive. Be careful what you get attached to out here.
You ever feel like the Zones alive? Like it has a will of its own? Sometimes I wonder if it knows were here.
I hear strange voices in my sleep. Its the Zone messing with my head... I swear, its trying to communicate.
If you're hearing things out here, dont ignore it. The Zone doesnt just send random sounds. It has a purpose.
People come and go in this place. But the Zone? It stays. It just keeps on taking, no matter what we do.
They say this place was once a thriving city. Cant even imagine it... Now, its just death and despair everywhere you look.
If you see a flash of light, dont follow it. Thats how they get you.
Sometimes I think about the people who died here... Did they even know what was coming? Or were they just like us, trying to survive?
I'm telling you, the Zone changes everything. Look at me Ive lost a bit of myself out here. And Im not sure Ill ever get it back.
I dont know whats worse: the mutants or the people whove been here too long. Both are just as deadly in their own way.
One wrong step out here and it's all over. I dont think anyone realizes how fragile life is in the Zone until it's too late.
The radiation messes with you. I can feel it in my bones. Maybe thats why Im getting so paranoid.
You ever notice that the sun never quite shines through the clouds here? Like the Zone itself is blocking it out.
It's been weeks since I've had a decent meal. Everythings rotten out here. Even the food we find.
Mutants are one thing, but I fear the humans out here even more. Theyre just as dangerous, and theyre everywhere.
Theres always something in the distance, waiting. The Zones full of them shadows lurking just out of sight.
Sometimes I wonder what the world outside looks like now. Maybe its just as broken as this place.
I swear, the air feels heavier today. Like something big is about to happen.
They say you can see ghosts in the fog near the Red Forest. Im starting to believe them.
Ever notice how some people just disappear? No screams, no signs of a struggle. Just... gone.
The silence out here is worse than any sound. Its like the world forgot this place exists.
I saw something moving in the shadows last night. Too big to be a mutant. I didnt stick around to find out.
This rifles been with me for years. I just hope it doesnt quit before I do.
The rustling in the trees isnt just the wind. Id bet my last bullet on it.
Used to dream of going home. Now I cant even picture what home looks like anymore.
I once saw a bloodsucker tear through an entire squad. Never ran so fast in my life.
Theres a strange hum at night if you listen closely. Dont know if its in the air or in my head.
Most of the old worlds treasures are still out there, buried under dirt and death. Whats left of them, anyway.
I once heard about a stalker who found an artifact that made him immortal. Never saw him again, though.
The fire in the distance could mean anything a camp, a mutant nest, or something worse. We should tread carefully.
You ever think about how quiet the nights are here? Its unnatural, almost like the worlds holding its breath.
The ground felt like it shifted under my feet yesterday. Like something beneath us is alive.
If you see glowing eyes in the dark, dont look twice. Thats how they get you.
These old roads used to lead somewhere. Now, they just loop back to the same dead ends.
Theres something comforting about the crackle of a campfire, even when everything else feels wrong.
The air tastes metallic today. Probably nothing good coming our way.
The Monolith troops arent just fighters. Theres something off about them. Almost like theyre not human anymore.
Its funny how you can get used to the smell of decay. That, or Ive lost my sense of smell entirely.
If you find old notes or photos out here, dont look too closely. Some memories are better left buried.
The silence before a blowout is the worst part. Its like the whole world stops to wait for the chaos.
I heard a trader talk about a hidden bunker filled with pre-Zone tech. Sounds like a trap to me.
Some days I forget what year it is. The clocks stopped, the calendars faded. Time doesnt mean much anymore.
Ever wonder how many people are buried out here, unmarked and forgotten? The land remembers, even if we dont.
Theres a spot near the old bridge where the air feels cold, even in the sun. I dont like it.
Once saw a pack of pseudodogs take down a bloodsucker. I didnt stick around to see how it ended.
The stars look different out here. Like theyre watching us. Or maybe its just me losing my mind.
If you find a lone campfire still burning, walk away. Whoever lit it is probably still nearby.
The old bunker doors are rusted shut, but I swear Ive heard something banging from the inside.
The crows here dont just circle the dead. Sometimes, they wait for you to join them.
Last time I trusted someone out here, I woke up without my gear. Wont make that mistake again.
Keep an eye on the treeline. Theres something big moving out there, and its not friendly.
The ground here feels softer than it should. Like its hiding something just below the surface.
They say the anomalies are alive. Watch how they pulse and move, like theyre breathing.
The wind always sounds like whispers at night. I cant tell if its just the trees or something else.
Someone left a warning scrawled on the rocks ahead. Looks fresh. We should turn back.
When youre alone out here, even the shadows feel heavier. Like theyre pressing down on you.
I found a doll buried in the dirt yesterday. Who leaves something like that out here?
Every time we pass that old monument, I get the feeling were being watched. Not by people.
Once saw a guy pick up an artifact without a detector. His hand melted right off. Dont be that guy.
Its strange how quiet the animals are sometimes. Makes you wonder whats scaring them.
The fog out here isnt normal. It clings to you, almost like its trying to pull you in.
Ever hear a growl that doesnt sound like it came from any mutant you know? Yeah, me too.
I once saw an anomaly pull a whole tree into itself. Imagine what it could do to a person.
The shadows seem longer here. Like theyre reaching for you when youre not looking.
Old tracks lead into that cave. No tracks lead out. Lets avoid it.
The air here feels thicker, like youre breathing through a wet rag. Somethings wrong.
Dont wander too far from the group. Its too easy to get lost out here... and not get found.
Ive heard stories of stalkers disappearing mid-sentence. Just... gone. No trace left.
That sound isnt the wind. Its too rhythmic. Like footsteps.
Theres a clearing ahead, but it feels wrong. Like the trees didnt want to grow there.
I heard about a stalker who claimed to see lights under the swamp water. He went to check... never came back.
The wind carries whispers around here. I cant tell if its the echoes of the past or something worse.
That abandoned church up the hill? They say its cursed. People hear bells at night, but theres no one there to ring them.
The old factory has a smell of burnt flesh. I dont even want to imagine what caused it.
If you hear a baby crying out here, run. Its never what you think it is.
Sometimes I dream of places Ive never been. When I wake up, they feel... familiar. Couldnt tell you why.
The closer we get to the center, the more I feel like Im being watched. And its not by anything human.
Do you hear that low hum? Its faint, but its there. Like the ground is alive beneath us.
Found a skeleton propped up like it was waiting for something. Gave me chills.
The deeper you go, the less you feel like yourself. Its like the air itself is stripping you away.
Saw a group of stalkers walking ahead of us. Thought it was weird when they didnt leave any footprints.
The ruins ahead look like theyre sinking into the earth. Or maybe the earth is trying to swallow them whole.
If you feel a chill that doesnt match the weather, keep moving. Somethings too close.
I once saw a tree out here bleeding. Not sap. Blood. Didnt stick around to see why.
That abandoned farmhouse has been empty for years. But sometimes, you can see smoke coming from the chimney.
They say theres a figure in a hood that wanders at night. If it stops to look at you, youre as good as gone.
The rain feels heavier here, almost sticky. Like its leaving more than just water on your skin.
The radio picks up static sometimes, but I swear Ive heard voices in it. And they werent speaking any language I know.
If you see a glow on the horizon, dont walk toward it. Youll never find your way back.
Every now and then, youll see a shadow move faster than it should. Keep your eyes on it, or it might be the last thing you see.
Theres a spot by the old train tracks where the ground feels hollow. Dont stand there too long.
That graffiti on the wall? It wasnt here last week. And the paints not dry anymore.
The air smells like sulfur. Could be an anomaly, or something worse. Keep moving.
Ive heard that mirrors reflect more than whats in front of them out here. Dont stare into one for too long.
The footprints ahead lead into the forest, but they dont lead back out. I say we avoid that trail.
If you hear laughter out here, dont laugh back. Thats how it starts.
The night isnt quiet. Its full of sounds, but not the kind you want to listen to for long.
Theres a boulder near the cliffs that looks like its weeping. I dont want to know why.
Saw a flash of light near the horizon. Thought it was lightning, but the sky was clear.
Every once in a while, youll hear a name whispered. Dont respond, no matter what.
When the fog gets too thick, I swear I see shapes moving through it. Not human shapes.
The air hums sometimes. Not like machinery, more like... chanting.
In the distance, I thought I saw a figure wave at me. But when I blinked, it was gone.
Theres a spot deep in the woods where nothing grows. No plants, no animals, no sound. Just... nothing.
Once, I found a notebook in the dirt. The last page said, "If youre reading this, its already too late."
Sometimes at dusk, the shadows stretch out toward you. They stop just short, as if waiting for something.
The old gas station on the ridge? Every night at midnight, a light turns on inside. But theres no power.
They say the stalker who found the Golden Sphere vanished after holding it. Not even a trace was left.
In the middle of the marsh, theres a single tree with carvings on it. Names. Hundreds of them. No one knows who put them there.
I once saw a line of footprints leading into a cave. But heres the thingthey were human going in and something else coming out.
Near the ruins of the old tower, theres a pond that never ripples, no matter how strong the wind blows.
The railway tunnel ahead? They say you can hear whispers echoing, but only when youre alone.
A stalker once claimed he found a mirror that didnt reflect him. It showed something standing behind him instead.
Every now and then, youll find a fire burning in the middle of nowhere. No signs of people. Just flames.
I saw a statue in the middle of the forest, covered in moss. Looked like it was crying, and the tears were fresh.
Theres an old barn to the east. People say they hear a baby crying from it at night. No one goes to check anymore.
The further we go, the quieter it gets. Not even the wind makes a sound. Like the worlds holding its breath.
Someone once told me about a river that flows uphill deep in the Zone. They swore its real.
In the factory ruins, theres a room with handprints on every wall. Big ones. Too big to be human.
The old military checkpoint? Ive heard the soldiers still patrol it, even though they died years ago.
Ever seen lightning strike the same spot over and over? Theres a field like that near the Red Forest.
Once I heard a melody in the distance. It was hauntingly beautiful. But the more I listened, the more it hurt my head.
The trainyard has a boxcar with its doors welded shut. People swear theyve heard knocking from the inside.
Found a coin on the ground with a face I didnt recognize. Looked ancient, but the metal felt warm.
Theres a clearing in the forest where the grass grows in a perfect spiral. Step inside it, and youll feel dizzy instantly.
Saw a raven that wasnt flapping its wings, just gliding. But it stayed still, like it was frozen in mid-air.
Dont touch the metal poles sticking out of the ground around here. They hum at night, and people say theyre cursed.
Once I saw a face in the fog. It didnt move, didnt blink. Just stared until the mist swallowed it.
Sometimes youll find footsteps in the mud that stop suddenly. Like the person vanished mid-step.
The field ahead is littered with bones, but no one knows what kind. Too big for animals, too small for humans.
Saw a campfire once with no one around it. The flames were green, like theyd been soaked in chemicals.
That old monument in the square? Its shadow moves faster than the sun. Always facing east, no matter the time of day.
Theres a bridge ahead where your footsteps echo twice. Once when you step, and once when you stop.
They say theres a field where the wind never stops blowing, but the grass doesnt move.
If you find a door standing alone in the woods, dont open it. Just walk away.
Found a footprint bigger than my head out near the swamp. Whatever made it, I dont want to meet it.
Theres a lake that looks like glass, but when you throw a rock, it just sinks silently. No ripples.
Once saw a shadow that didnt belong to anyone. It was walking beside me, matching my steps.
Sometimes, you can hear laughter echoing through the factory ruins. High-pitched, like a childs. But theres no one there.
Ive heard of a stalker who always carried a red scarf. One day, just the scarf was found, tied to a tree.
At an old checkpoint, I saw a gas mask staring back at me from the dirt. I could swear it blinked.
The old tunnels hum at night, like something is alive in the walls. And its listening.
Near the abandoned silo, theres a patch of ground where compasses spin wildly. No one stays there long.
A stalker told me about a rifle he found that fired without bullets. He left it behind when he saw the target bleed shadows.
I once saw a bird flying backward. Thought my eyes were playing tricks until I realized it cast no shadow.
Theres a burned-out building where no grass grows, no wind blows, and no sound escapes. Dont linger there.
One of the old trucks near the junkyard has bloodstains on the inside of its windows. Its locked, and no one has the key.
Passed a clearing once where all the trees leaned inward, like they were bowing to something in the middle.
Saw a fox once with glowing eyes. It just sat there, watching. Didnt run, didnt blink. Just watched.
Theres a place where radios crackle with voices, even when theyre off. Old voices, speaking languages no one knows.
A stalker told me he saw his reflection wave at him, even though he wasnt moving. He smashed the mirror and ran.
In the ruins of an old school, theres a chalkboard with writing on it. No matter how many times its wiped clean, the words come back.
The swamp reeds sometimes rustle even when theres no wind. Like somethings crawling through them, just out of sight.
Theres a house where the windows glow faintly at night. Step inside, and the glow disappears... along with your sense of direction.
Found a backpack once in perfect condition. Inside was a journal, but the last entry was dated twenty years from now.
A stalker swore he saw footprints in the mud that formed as he watched. But there was no one there to make them.
The fog in the valley doesnt just cover things up; it swallows sound. Even gunshots vanish into it without a trace.
In the ruins of an old church, the bell rings at random times. But theres no wind, and the rope is missing.
The wild dogs around here sometimes howl in harmony. It sounds almost... rehearsed. Too coordinated to be natural.
I heard about a stalker who found an artifact that floated above his hand. It never touched him, but he swore it whispered his name.
Theres a field of flowers that only bloom at night. But if you touch one, it wilts instantly, as if its afraid.
The ground near the old bunker feels soft, like its hollow underneath. Some say it is, and something lives down there.
Once, I found a watch in the dirt. It worked fine, but the hands moved backward. Didnt stop until I threw it away.
In the heart of the forest, theres a tree that bleeds when you cut it. The sap is red and smells like rust.
Saw a deer with glowing antlers. It didnt run when it saw me. Just stared, like it was daring me to come closer.
Theres a patch of ground where compasses spin and shadows dont fall. No one stays there long.
Ever hear of the Whispering Stone? They say if you stand near it too long, youll start hearing things you shouldnt.
Theres a hill out past the swamp where no birds land. Not a single sound comes from there, day or night.
I heard footsteps behind me once, but when I turned, there was nothing. The sound didnt stop until I ran.
Theres an abandoned camp where the fire still burns, but no ones been there for years. The embers never die out.
They say the shadows in the factory sometimes move on their own, even when theres no one to cast them.
Near the power lines, the air hums like its alive. It gets louder if you stand still for too long.
The fog rolled in so thick one night, I couldnt see my own hands. But I felt something brushing past me, just out of reach.
Theres a lone tree in the valley with rope marks on its branches. No one knows how they got there, but the marks are fresh.
Once, I passed by a crater where nothing grows. My Geiger counter screamed the whole time, but I swear I saw something move in the middle.
In the ruins of a house, I found a photo. The people in it looked happy, but their eyes were scratched out, all except one.
The old clock tower hasnt worked in decades, but some nights, you can hear it chime. Always thirteen times.
Theres a well out past the edge of the forest. Drop a stone in, and youll hear it hit... minutes later.
The train tracks here end abruptly in the dirt, but sometimes at night, you can hear the faint sound of a whistle.
One time, I saw lights flickering in the abandoned hospital. It wasnt power, and it sure wasnt human.
The echoes in the canyon dont just repeat your voice. Sometimes, they answer back.
They say theres a door in the old bunker that only opens at midnight. No one whos gone through it has ever returned.
The graves near the village dont stay the same. I swear theres more every time I pass by.
In the distance, I once saw a figure standing perfectly still. It was gone when I blinked, but the hairs on my neck didnt settle for hours.
If I had a ruble for every time I almost died out here, Id be rich enough to hire someone else to almost die for me.
You know what we need? A Zone tour guide. "On your left, a death trap. On your right, a slightly worse death trap."
If this is the afterlife, Ive got some complaints to file. First of all, the amenities suck.
The Zone really knows how to keep you humble. One minute youre a hero, the next youre running from a pissed-off boar.
I saw a stalker once wearing two mismatched boots. When I asked, he said, "Its the Zones latest fashion." Now Im considering it.
If I had a decent meal for every mutant Ive killed, I wouldnt look like a walking skeleton.
Note to self: never trust the guy who says, "This shortcuts perfectly safe."
Sometimes I wonder if mutants tell campfire stories about us. "And then the stalker took out his gun and... BOOM!"
I once tried to trade an artifact for vodka. The trader laughed, then gave me a lecture on market value. Still got the vodka, though.
If you ever find yourself smiling in the Zone, dont worryitll be wiped off your face in about two seconds.
I miss civilization... but not enough to deal with rush hour traffic again.
I told a snork to buzz off once. It didnt listen. Now Im walking with a limp.
You know what they dont tell you before you come here? Theres no decent coffee. Thats the real tragedy of the Zone.
The Zone is like a bad ex. It takes everything from you, but somehow you keep coming back for more.
One day, Im gonna write a guidebook: "How to Not Die in the Zone." Chapter one: Dont come here.
I thought I saw a Monolith soldier dancing once. Turns out he was dodging a swarm of bees. Still impressive, though.
You think stalker fashion will ever hit the runways? "And here we have the ripped trench coat, accented by blood stains."
Ever notice how the best plans here always start with, "So, well just wing it..."?
If I had a grenade for every stupid idea Ive had out here, I could start my own faction.
You cant spell "survive" without "run like hell." Pretty sure thats Zone wisdom.
What was that?
I think I just heard some footsteps...
You know, the Zone isnt so bad. Its got character. And plenty of ways to die. Character-building, really.
Im starting to think the anomalies are just bored and messing with us. Like some cosmic game of tag.
If you ever find a stash of perfectly good food out here, its probably a trap. Or maybe the Zone just felt generous. Dont get your hopes up.
Heard a rumor about a talking cat in the Zone. Probably just a load of bull but what if?
You know, for a place thats supposed to be dead, the Zone is sure lively. Lively with things that want to kill you.
Im convinced the Zone has a sense of humor. A very dark, twisted sense of humor.
If you hear someone singing opera out here, run. Its not a mutant. Its much, much worse.
I saw a stalker trying to teach a blind dog to hunt artifacts. The dog kept running into trees. Zone life.
The Zone is like a box of chocolates. Except all the chocolates are poisoned. And some of them bite back.
Ive decided to open a Zone gift shop. Well sell mutant plushies and anomaly-shaped paperweights. What could go wrong?
If you ever feel like the Zone is playing tricks on you, youre probably right.
Im starting to think the Monolith is just a really elaborate prank. A prank that involves brainwashing and death rays.
The Zone is a great place to lose weight. Youll either run it off or get eaten. Either way, youll be thinner.
If you see a sign that says "Do Not Enter," definitely enter. Just kidding. Dont do that.
Ive decided to write a Zone survival guide in haiku. "Mutant growls nearby run very fast now probably too late."
The Zone is a place where dreams come true. Nightmares, mostly.
Im pretty sure the Zone is just one big social experiment. And were the lab rats. Delicious lab rats.
If you ever find a map of the Zone, dont trust it. Its probably outdated. Or a trap. Or both.
Im convinced the Zone is sentient. And its playing a very elaborate game of chess with us. And were losing. Badly.
The Zone is a great place for people-watching. Assuming you can spot the people before the mutants do.
If you ever feel like youre being watched in the Zone, you probably are. By something. Something creepy.
Im thinking of opening a Zone spa. Well offer mud baths and radiation treatments. Guaranteed to change you.
The Zone is a place where the only constant is change. And death. Mostly death.
If you ever find a working toilet in the Zone, use it. It might be the last one you see for a while. Or ever.
Im starting to think the Zone is just a giant recycling center. Except it recycles people. Into mutants.
Whats the difference between a stalker and a mutant? About six months. Give or take.
Ever wonder if the mutants have their own little campfire stories about us? Probably something about how we taste.
I found a stash of canned peaches today. Peaches! It's the little victories that count out here.
Heard a rumor about a stalker who found a whole case of vodka. Said he shared it with a pseudodog. Sounds about right for the Zone.
You know, sometimes I think the Zone is just one big, messed-up game of "Survivor." Except with more radiation and less voting.
If I ever find a decent cup of coffee in this Zone, I'm going to frame it. It'll be a relic.
I'm starting to think the Zone is just a giant cosmic recycling bin. Everything ends up here eventually.
You ever try to teach a mutant a trick? They're not very good at fetch. Or anything, really, besides killing.
If I ever find a stash of chocolate, I'm not sharing. Not even with you. Okay, maybe a little.
Heard a rumor about a stalker who found a suit of armor made of pure gold. Then he ran into a burer. Gold doesn't stop telekinesis, apparently.
You know, the Zone is a great place for self-reflection. Mostly because you're constantly reflecting on how you almost died again.
If I ever find a working television in the Zone, I'm going to watch reruns of old sitcoms. Just for a taste of normal life.
I'm starting to think the Zone is just a giant ant farm. And we're the ants. Except the ants have guns.
You ever try to reason with a pseudogiant? They're not very good listeners. Or conversationalists.
If I ever find a working shower in the Zone, I'm going to take the longest shower in history. And I'm not coming out until I'm squeaky clean.
Heard a rumor about a stalker who found a map to the center of the Zone. Said he followed it and found a dead end. Typical.
You know, the Zone is a great place to learn how to appreciate the little things. Like breathing.
If I ever find a working barber shop in the Zone, I'm going to get the fanciest haircut they offer. Even if it's just me and the barber and a few mutants.
I'm starting to think the Zone is just a giant experiment. And we're the subjects. Unwilling subjects.
You ever try to play cards with a snork? They always cheat. And they smell terrible.
If I ever find a working library in the Zone, I'm going to read every book in it. Just to escape reality for a while.
Heard a rumor about a stalker who found a suit of power armor. Said he wore it for a week straight. Never took it off. Probably smells great by now.
You know, the Zone is a great place to build character. Mostly by running for your life.
If I ever find a working pizza place in the Zone, I'm going to order the biggest pizza they have. And I'm going to eat the whole thing myself. Don't judge me.
I'm starting to think the Zone is just a giant game. And we're all playing. For our lives.
You ever try to dance with a bloodsucker? They're not very good partners. And they tend to bite.
I'm craving some Hunter's Delight sausage. Think we can find some? Or maybe I'll just settle for some slightly irradiated jerky.
Remember that time you tried to fix your gun with duct tape and a rusty nail? Good times. Almost as good as that time we found a whole case of Kazaky vodka.
I'm thinking of joining the Clear Sky. They seem organized. And they have those cool blue jackets. Though, I'd probably just get shot by a renegade five minutes after joining.
Ever try a Hercules protein bar? Tastes like cardboard, but it gives you the strength of ten men. Or at least, the strength to run away from ten men.
I'm starting to think the best artifact is a full stomach. And maybe a working gas mask. Those are tied.
Remember that time we found that stash of Flash grenades? That was blinding. And loud. And slightly terrifying.
I'm thinking of trading some artifacts for a new backpack. Mine's starting to smell like a mix of mutant and old socks. A delightful aroma.
Ever try a Psi-Block pill? Makes you feel fuzzy. And slightly paranoid. But hey, at least you don't hear voices mostly.
I'm thinking of getting a tattoo. A picture of a pseudodog. Or maybe a bloodsucker. Something to commemorate my time in the Zone.
Remember that time you tried to use a Veles detector to find your car keys? Classic you.
I'm craving some BonAqua. Nothing like slightly radioactive water to quench your thirst.
Ever wonder what the mutants do when we're not around? Do they have little mutant parties? Play cards? Gossip about us?
I'm thinking of starting a band. We'll call ourselves "The Anomalies." Our music will be experimental. And probably deadly.
Remember that time we found that Compass artifact? It led us straight to a pack of boars. Thanks, compass.
I'm craving some Energy Drink. Gotta stay awake to run from all the things that want to kill me.
Ever wonder if the Zone has a mascot? Probably a mutated rat. Or maybe a snork. Something cute and cuddly.
I'm thinking of writing a book. "The Zone for Dummies." Chapter one: Don't go in the Zone. Chapter two: If you ignore chapter one, good luck.
Remember that time you tried to use a Kalashnikov to open a can of beans? Necessity is the mother of invention. And explosions.
I'm craving some sleep. Is that an allowed craving?
Ever wonder if the Zone is just one big simulation? And we're all just code?
I'm thinking of learning how to play the guitar. Maybe I can serenade the mutants. Or maybe they'll just eat me. Worth a shot.
Remember that time we found that Medkit? It was empty. Of course it was empty.
I'm craving some sanity. Is that something you can find in the Zone?
Ever wonder if the Zone is just one big joke? And we're all the punchline?
I'm thinking of starting a support group. "Stalkers Anonymous." Our motto: "We're not addicted to the Zone we can quit anytime probably."
I'm starting to think the Zone is just a giant, messed-up escape room. And we're all desperately searching for the exit... or at least a working door.
Ever wonder if mutants have their own version of "Zone Tourist"? You know, someone who wanders in, gets lost, and becomes a cautionary tale?
I'm thinking of opening a Zone-themed restaurant. We'll serve Bloodsucker Burgers and Pseudodog Stew. I'm sure it'll be a hit... with the mutants, at least.
Remember that time you tried to use a Detector to find a signal for your phone? You're a special kind of stalker.
I'm craving some Cossack energy drink. Need the extra boost to outrun those pesky anomalies. And maybe a few pseudodogs.
Ever wonder if the Zone has its own stock market? "Mutant futures are up! Artifact prices are plummeting!"
I'm thinking of starting a "Zone Dating" app. "Find your soulmate... or someone who'll watch your back."
Remember that time we found that Gravi artifact? We spent hours trying to make it float. Turns out it only works on rocks. Zone logic.
I'm craving some peace and quiet. Is that too much to ask for in the Zone?
Ever wonder if the Zone has its own "Zone Idol"? Mutants singing karaoke? That's a mental image I didn't need.
I'm thinking of opening a "Zone Barber Shop." We'll specialize in "mutant-resistant" haircuts. And beard trims, of course.
