Remember that time you tried to use a First-Aid Kit on a mutant? It just got angrier. Live and learn, I guess.
I'm craving some hot food. Not irradiated, not slightly glowing. Just hot.
Ever wonder if the Zone has its own "Zone Olympics"? Mutants competing in well, mutant stuff.
I'm thinking of writing a "Zone Cookbook." "101 Ways to Cook a Mutant (and Not Get Eaten in the Process)."
Remember that time we found that Night Star artifact? We thought it would make us invisible. Turns out it just makes you glow in the dark. Helpful.
I'm craving some clean clothes. Mine are starting to walk on their own.
Ever wonder if the Zone has its own "Zone Fashion Week"? Mutants strutting their stuff? I'm scared now.
I'm thinking of starting a "Zone Delivery Service." "We deliver eventually. And maybe not alive."
Remember that time you tried to use a Rusty Shotgun to shoot down a helicopter? Ambitious. Very ambitious.
I'm craving some sunshine. Real sunshine. Not the slightly radioactive kind.
Ever wonder if the Zone has its own "Zone Museum"? Exhibits like "The Evolution of the Pseudodog" and "The History of Irradiated Jerky."
I'm thinking of opening a "Zone Petting Zoo." We'll have well, we'll figure it out. Maybe some slightly less aggressive mutants.
Remember that time we found a working toilet? It was a miracle. A true Zone miracle.
I'm starting to think the Zone is just one big social experiment. And we're all the guinea pigs. Delicious, irradiated guinea pigs.
I'm thinking of starting a Zone fashion line. "Ripped and Rad" - it'll be all the rage... or maybe just all the rags.
Ever wonder if mutants have their own version of "Zone Got Talent"? Imagine a snork doing interpretive dance. Terrifying.
I'm craving some Tourist Delight stew. It's got that radioactive flavor.
Remember that time you tried to use a Sparkler anomaly as a lighter? That was shocking. Literally.
I'm thinking of opening a Zone Lost and Found. Mostly lost. And occasionally found in pieces.
Ever wonder if the Zone has its own "Zone Oscars"? Best Mutant Performance? Best Irradiated Jerky Recipe?
I'm craving some quiet. Just five minutes of blessed silence. Is that too much to ask in this chaotic wasteland?
Remember that time we found that Mama's Beads artifact? We thought it would bring us good luck. All it brought us was a pack of angry boars. Thanks, Mama.
I'm thinking of starting a Zone advice column. "Dear Zone, I'm being chased by a pseudogiant. What should I do?" Run.
Ever wonder if the Zone has its own "Zone Census"? "How many mutants are currently trying to kill us?" A lot.
I'm craving some non-irradiated water. Just plain, old, clean water. A luxury in these parts.
Remember that time you tried to use a Rusty Revolver to shoot down a BTR? Bold move. Not very smart, but bold.
I'm thinking of opening a Zone detective agency. "We solve mysteries mostly the mystery of who stole my last can of stew."
Ever wonder if the Zone has its own "Zone Bingo"? "Bloodsucker! Pseudogiant! Anomaly! BINGO!"
I'm craving some decent socks. Mine have more holes than well, than anything should have holes.
Remember that time we found that Golden Goose artifact? We thought it would lay golden eggs. It just laid regular eggs. Disappointing.
I'm thinking of opening a Zone daycare. For mutant babies. What could possibly go wrong?
Ever wonder if the Zone has its own Zone Speed Dating? "Hi, I'm looking for someone who can outrun a pseudogiant. Must be okay with radiation."
I'm craving some peace of mind. Just a little bit of sanity. Is that too much to ask in this wonderland of weirdness?
Remember that time you tried to use a Broken Shotgun as a club? It worked surprisingly well. Until it broke more.
I'm thinking of opening a Zone tour guide service. "See the Zone's most terrifying sights from a safe distance maybe."
Ever wonder if the Zone has its own Zone Film Festival? "Mutant Massacre 7: The Sequel"?
I'm craving some clean air. Air that doesn't smell like well, like the Zone.
Remember that time we found that Comet artifact? We thought it would grant us wishes. It just made us really dizzy.
I'm thinking of opening a Zone survival school. "Learn how to survive until you don't."
Sultan is offering new jobs, I need to check them out later.
Got a message from the fellas, they spotted rookies wandering in the Garbage. Heh, we should check out what kind of shit they brought for us.
Eh, $name, my man. You got some smokes?!
The other day, I joined the boys into a hunting trip. Hunting dogs and shit is fun, you know.
Fucking shit, I forgot my lighter...
I was thinking, is hunting artefacts worth it?
Sultan says that we need to stick our asses around, looks like he got new job for us.
Yo $name, got some vodka?! I need something strong.
Once I meet with the gang again, we'll go wild to hunt some asses. Those stalkers always have good shit in their pockets.
Those fucks at Cordon think they own the Car Park, someone needs to teach them how things work here.
One of the boys in Agroprom Underground came back to us the other day. He talked for hours about all sorts of creepy things dwelling in that place. I wouldn't go down there myself.
Duty troops gave our boys at the Garbage a hard time, they want to take control of the area. I hate those scum.
You can never go wrong with hunting eggheads, those nerds usually have expensive detectors and shit.
The bastards from the army think they can order people around. Those jokers can't lay a finger on us, I'm telling ya.
Monolith confuses me. What's your thought about them, $name? Personally, I'm not sure if they got brain cells, or someone's actually controlling them.
I'm tired of hearing stories about Freedom and Duty. To hell with both of them.
There is no law in the Zone, people always seem to forget about this.
Yo $name, let me know if you spotted a lonely stalker wandering around, okay?
Heard there's a stash hidden near the old factory. We should check it out.
Some rookie tried to sell me a faulty detector. I had to teach him a lesson.
Ever wonder if the Zone's playing us? Like we're just pawns in some twisted game.
That last raid was a bust. We need better intel next time.
I've been thinking about setting up a new hideout. Somewhere off the beaten path.
Those Duty guys think they're the law here. Someone should remind them who's in charge.
Found a stash of old military rations. They're still good. We should stock up.
Ever notice how the Monolith guys just stand there, staring at the sky? Creepy.
Some of the boys are talking about hitting the Freedom base. Could be profitable.
Heard there's a new trader in the area. Might be worth checking out.
That last firefight was too close. We need better gear.
Some of the boys are talking about hitting the Freedom base. Could be profitable.
Ever notice how the Monolith guys just stand there, staring at the sky? Creepy.
Found a stash of old military rations. They're still good. We should stock up.
Those Duty guys think they're the law here. Someone should remind them who's in charge.
I've been thinking about setting up a new hideout. Somewhere off the beaten path.
That last raid was a bust. We need better intel next time.
Ever wonder if the Zone's playing us? Like we're just pawns in some twisted game.
Some rookie tried to sell me a faulty detector. I had to teach him a lesson.
Heard there's a stash hidden near the old factory. We should check it out.
That stash we hit last week? Got some nice artifacts, but I swear we were being watched.
Heard a rumor that Freedom is planning something big. Could be trouble for us.
Don't trust anyone from the army, they never have good intentions.
I swear, the Zone changes people. Some of these stalkers are getting crazier by the day.
Found an old PDA with some encrypted data. Who knows what kind of secrets it holds?
Let's head to the Dark Valley. I heard theres a few bandits who know where the big stash is.
Noticed a few newcomers near Yantar. Somethings off about them, might be worth investigating.
Those Duty guys are getting bolder. They better keep their distance, or we'll teach them a lesson.
Have you ever been to the Red Forest? I hear it's full of good loot, but dangerous as hell.
Stay sharp, soldier.
I have orders to shoot bandits on sight.
Don't allow intruders to wander around, we must prevent stalkers from passing through.
We got medical supplies from the HQ yesterday, I need to resupply later.
Talk to the commander if you're looking for a job, he might accept your assistance in a few cases.
Being a soldier isn't an easy job, especially in a place like the Zone.
Shit... I forgot my lighter.
We need to get rid of those Freedomers forever.
We need to tighten security at the checkpoint, no one should be getting through without clearance.
Scavengers near the southern border? I'll make sure they don't get too comfortable.
Any stalker who doesnt know the rules should be put down on sight. This is military territory.
The commanders planning a big operation soon. I hope well be ready for it.
We lost contact with some of our patrols up north. I dont like the looks of that.
The Mutants are getting bolder, we need to form better defenses around the perimeter.
The commander has ordered all soldiers to stay alert. The Zone doesnt forgive mistakes.
Those damn Duty guys are constantly poking around. I don't trust them at all.
Last time we crossed paths with the Freedomers, it didnt end well. We should avoid them if we can.
The Zone isnt safe for anyone, but we have a duty to protect the interests of the Motherland.
If we dont secure the southern route soon, itll fall into bandit hands. We cant let that happen.
Ive seen the horrors of this place. Only the strong survive here, and we will remain the strongest.
Theres been strange activity near the Red Forest. I think something bigger is happening in the Zone.
Be on the lookout for rogue stalkers. They're getting more organized, and we cant have them moving freely.
Weve been ordered to assist at the Cordon checkpoint. No one gets through without our say-so.
Somebody needs to handle those Bandits in the Garbage. Its been a thorn in our side for too long.
The situation in Yantars deteriorating. We may need to move in and secure it soon.
If you want to see the real side of the Zone, take a look at what were protecting. No one else gets it.
The militarys presence is the only thing holding back chaos from taking over this place.
We got a new shipment of weapons coming in. Good to see well be ready if things go south.
We cant trust any of the factions out here. Everyones got their own agenda, and we cant let ours slip.
Ive heard whispers of a strange artifact found in the swamps. If its real, we need to control it.
Sometimes I think were the only ones left who can keep order in the Zone. God help us if we fail.
Cold was offering some jobs, you may want to check them out later.
The old team has screwed up, but we will get our full strength back in no time.
Be careful, bandits may show up at any moment.

Ever wondered what happened to Lebedev and the rest of his troops after the big emission? Cold says they died, but I heard someone say they became Monolith soldiers... \nCome to think of it, it's very possible that they're still alive.
I think I caught a frog in my ass. Staying at the swamps all the time isn't that healthy.
The Ecologists in Yantar supplied us with new detectors and other equipment, this will help our cause.
I prefer to stay away from military checkpoints, they don't go easy on anyone these days.
Many stalkers joined our side as of late, this is good news.
Latest readings showed that emissions are getting stronger as time passes by, what is the Zone up to?
Psi-storms usually don't participate in artefact creation, massive blowouts on the other hand are a different story.
What happened to the old team was unfortunate.
The Zone is full of mysteries, but even we cant explain the recent wave of anomalies. Somethings stirring up again.
Ever heard of the Bloodsucker packs to the north? Im not sure if anyone can deal with them, but well try.
Cold mentioned something about an old stash hidden somewhere in the swamps. Could be worth checking out.
Weve been getting word from other factions about strange activity near the Dead City. I think its best if we keep our distance for now.
Ive got a feeling that the emissions are getting smarter... somehow. Not just random blasts anymore, there's some kind of pattern.
Some of the newer recruits are starting to question our methods. I wonder how long theyll last in this place.
The Monolith, man... Ive heard rumors theyve got some kind of cult worshipping the Emissions themselves. Crazy, right?
Our last mission took a turn for the worse. We lost good men to those damn anomalies. I hate that feeling of helplessness.
I don't trust those Ecologists in Yantar. They might be providing us with equipment, but they've got their own agenda. Watch your back.
Cold is obsessed with finding answers about the Zone. But the more we search, the more I feel like its not something were meant to understand.
Ive heard whispers about new artifacts appearing near the Barrier. If youve got the guts, its worth investigating.
The last psi-storm I encountered almost fried my brain. I don't know how much more of this I can handle.
Im starting to think the Zone itself is alive, like it's watching us, testing us.
Those anomalies in the Swamps are a ticking time bomb. We need to find a way to safely traverse them, or itll be our grave.
Some of the old stalkers swear theyve seen the Monolith controlling the weather in the Zone. Sounds like a load of crap, but who knows?
I think theres something hidden beneath the surface of the Zone. Its not just artifacts and mutants theres a whole other layer to this place.
Colds been acting more strange lately. I think the Zones getting to him, like it does to everyone. You start losing yourself out here.
The mutants are evolving. More aggressive, more organized. It feels like the Zones alive, evolving, changing its own rules.
The armys been getting closer to our base. We need to be careful, one wrong move and theyll wipe us out without a second thought.
I found an old journal from a previous expedition. They recorded something about the Monolith cult growing stronger. We need to pay attention to that.
Some old reports say there are ancient ruins beneath the Zone, relics from the past. Cold thinks its worth investigating. I think its a death sentence.
One of the newer stalkers got caught by a blind dog pack. They tore him apart before anyone could react. Its getting worse out here.
Cold said something about finding a way to use the Zones emissions as a weapon. I cant decide if hes a genius or just insane.
Weve been hearing rumors of a secret military facility near the Dark Valley. If its true, we need to get there before anyone else does.
Cold's got this obsession with the Emission cycles. If he's right, we may need to start moving to higher ground when the next one hits.
The Monolith's hold on the Zone is getting tighter. It's like they can sense any threat to their power and eliminate it swiftly.
We've spotted a new breed of mutant near the Lab. They're faster, deadlier... Its only a matter of time before they spread further.
I've seen the way Cold looks at the horizon when the wind picks up. He thinks the Zone is calling to him. Im not sure if its brave or just madness.
We've been avoiding the army for now, but it won't be long before they start hunting us down. We need to prepare for their next move.
I don't know who or what is behind the growing presence of Monolith forces. But it's only a matter of time before we clash.
The radiation levels in the Zone have been steadily rising. It's becoming harder to stay out of harm's way, even for those of us who know how to handle it.
I heard there's a stash of rare artifacts hidden in the Red Forest. No one's made it out alive trying to find it, but if youre brave enough, it might be worth the risk.
Theres word of a new group of stalkers trying to form a resistance against the Monolith. Ill believe it when I see it, but if its true, we need to align with them.
Cold insists we keep moving north. Says the Emission anomalies are forming some kind of pattern there. I think he's chasing ghosts, but Ill follow his lead for now.
Its only a matter of time before the Zone claims us all. But until that day comes, well keep fighting. Its the only thing we know how to do.
We've been getting some strange signals from the east, near the old radar tower. I dont know what it means yet, but we need to check it out before its too late.
Stay sharp, soldier.
If you've found any artefacts, bring them to the commander. The scientists will make good use of them.
If you spotted any bandit scum crossing the line, shoot on sight. The last thing we need is scumbags wandering around.
The guards at our base say that mutant activity has increased as of late, the Zone is getting more dangerous day after day.
I need to have a nice drink at the 100 Rads.
Have you ever considered the Arena? If you're strong and lucky enough, you can earn yourself quite the sum.
I've just heard that the General has sent new troops to the old farm in Army Warehouses. If those clowns even dare trying to stop us, we'll make them pay.
Those stalkers think wandering around our base is a bloody joke.
Be careful, no-one knows what will show up next. The Zone is full of all sorts of creepy things.
We got reinforcements and supplies from the Ukrainian Army a few days ago, the outfits were not bad at all.
Having affairs with bloodsuckers must be fun enough for our bored Freedom friends.
I have orders to shoot Freedom spies on sight, let me know if you spotted one.
The latest reports say the Monolith is pushing deeper into the Cordon. If they set up a base there, it'll be a real problem for all of us.
Weve received intel on some Freedomers holed up in a ruined building near the Junkyard. They wont know what hit them when we move in.
The scientists keep sending us to the most dangerous parts of the Zone. One of these days, theyll get someone killed.
Its been quiet on the western front for now, but that doesn't mean we can afford to relax. Stay sharp, stalker.
We need those artifacts, don't forget. If you spot anything useful, bring it back to base. The Commander will reward you for your efforts.
Ive been hearing strange noises near the bloodsucker dens. Id say somethings up, but with the Zone, who knows whats really happening?
Some of the newbies are talking about trying their luck at the Arena. If they think they can survive that, theyll learn the hard way.
The mercenaries are stirring again. Something tells me theyre preparing for something big. We cant let our guard down.
I heard there's a stash of military-grade weapons hidden near the Dead City. If youre feeling adventurous, maybe its worth the risk.
Stay away from the bandit camps if you value your life. Those scum wont hesitate to ambush anyone who isnt part of their gang.
We've been working with the Ukrainian Army on some joint operations. They've got some decent tech, but theyre not exactly used to the Zones horrors.
Theres word of a Monolith group forming near the Agroprom. I dont know why theyre so obsessed with that place, but I don't trust them.
The Zones radiation is getting worse by the day. Make sure your suit is sealed tight before heading out. One wrong move could be your last.
Do yourself a favor and avoid the Wild Territory. Its swarming with mutants, and the place is crawling with Freedomers trying to get a piece of the action.
We intercepted some radio chatter from the Freedomers. Sounds like theyre planning something big. I think they might be looking to attack our base.
Im not a superstitious man, but the way some stalkers talk about the Zones moods makes me wonder if theres more to it than we realize.
If youre heading towards the Red Forest, be extra careful. Theres no telling what kind of horrors hide among the trees.
The Bandits are getting bold, spreading their influence. If you see any near our checkpoints, make sure they dont get away.
The Zone's getting more unstable by the day. Id say were in for another big blowout soon. Brace yourselves.
I hear the scientists are still poking around in the Dead City. I dont know why they keep going back to that cursed place, but theyre stubborn.
I havent seen a single friendly stalker for days. Looks like everyones busy dealing with their own problems.
The Freedomers keep making trouble near our base. Sooner or later, theyre going to regret that.
Word is, the Army's been taking casualties. If their morale drops any lower, we might get some opportunities to hit them where it hurts.
I need to replace my detector, it displays incorrect readings sometimes.
I saw one of the scientists holding a Svarog detector in his hands, it was one of the most beautiful things I've seen in a while.
The Professor is looking for certain artefacts, you might want to help him.
I'm writing a dissertation about Electro anomalies, but I need to collect more samples.
The Ukrainian government approved on sending new equipment, I need to get me a decent anomaly detector.
Despite the amount of artefacts that can be found there, there is no way I'll ever go near Lab X-16. Controllers and zombies roam around the place.
I heard Hermann once mentioning his intentions of hiring a group of mercs to assist our scientists in Jupiter. I concur, many research groups have disappeared lately.
Funnily enough, bolts are still the cheapest and most effective way to detect anomalous activities around.
Many don't know the difference between a Whirligig and a Vortex; the latter has a much larger range. Many have died due to wrong estimations between both kinds.
I heard that the fabled Heart of the Oasis artefact can even nourish the bearer. This is a miracle to science and medicine.
Gas anomalies are rare, but they share similar properties to those of the Fruit Punch.
Burnt Fuzz is the least dangerous type of anomalies. However, stalkers die to it because they don't expect an anomaly above their heads.
Psi-storms usually don't participate in artefact creation, massive blowouts on the other hand are a whole different story.
Im certain there's a new type of anomaly near the Agroprom, something I haven't seen before. I need to investigate it before it gets worse.
After hours of testing, I finally managed to isolate a signal from an unusual artefact. It seems to have properties we can't yet comprehend.
The research on the Zone's radiation levels is ongoing, but we still dont have a clear understanding of how it fluctuates during a blowout.
Ive been trying to map the best route to the Dead City, but the Psi-fields in the area make it impossible to get clear readings.
I once witnessed a bolt get thrown into a Whirligig anomaly, the bolt turned into dust right before my eyes. Truly terrifying.
Ive been hearing rumors about a new mutant, the so-called "Skrads". They are said to be able to survive Psi-storms, but Ive yet to encounter one.
The fact that the Heart of Oasis can also increase longevity raises so many questions. If only we had the time to conduct proper studies.
Many of the researchers in Jupiter are getting more paranoid. Some believe theres a hidden force in the Zone, one that manipulates reality itself.
I've noticed more anomalies appearing near the Cordon. The nature of their presence is strangealmost as if the Zone itself is trying to speak.
Some old, forgotten research from a scientist named Dmitry Zhdanov suggests that the anomalies could be linked to strange cosmic events. I'm not convinced, but it's worth investigating.
Occasionally, we find artefacts with properties that dont match known categories. I suspect there are more unknown anomalies than we can document.
The Fruit Punch anomaly? It's rare, but Ive seen stalkers walk right into it without knowing its true nature. Those who survive say its like drowning in pure liquid air.
Ive been working on a new prototype for the detectors, one that might be able to pick up anomalous signatures before they manifest physically. The results are promising so far.
Im trying to get a sample from a Psystorm, but it's risky. No one really knows if they can be captured or measured without triggering a disaster.
Theres been a slight drop in anomalous activity lately, but I wouldn't get too comfortable. We all know the Zone can change its mood at any time.
Dont trust the nearby roads too much; the anomalies seem to move when they feel threatened. The Cordon has become far more dangerous than it used to be.
Weve made some headway with the study of gas anomalies. If we could harness their energy, it could revolutionize power sources across the whole region.
The zone seems to be evolving. Old anomalies are becoming more unpredictable, and new ones are cropping up in areas we thought we knew well.
Ive been meaning to travel deeper into the Red Forest, but Im afraid of what might be lurking there. The rumours about its curse are growing stronger.
Yesterday I witnessed an electrical anomaly interacting with a Whirligig. It created some kind of feedback loop and almost fried my equipment. We still dont know what happened there.
I don't care what they saysome artefacts are more than just junk. They are the key to unlocking the true mysteries of the Zone.
If you come across any Svarog detectors, let me know. The professor would pay a lot for one, and I wouldn't mind getting my hands on one myself.
Some say the Zone has a consciousness of its own, like its watching us, playing with us. Im starting to wonder if thats true.
Have you heard about the so-called "Eternal Anomaly"? It's been spotted near the Bar, but no one's brave enough to study it up close.
Ive been studying the residue left behind by blowouts. It's as if the energy released becomes a part of the land itself. Strange things happen in its wake.
I once saw an artefact called the "Fallen Star". It pulsed with energy like nothing Ive ever felt. Ill never forget that moment.
Theres talk of a new type of artefact, one that can bend light itself. If it's real, it could turn everything we know about the Zone upside down.
Some researchers are convinced that the Zones anomalies are connected to deep space phenomena. Ive seen nothing to prove it, but Im keeping an open mind.
The Lab X-18 may have been abandoned, but the mutant activity around it is still as intense as ever. Im not sure whats lurking inside anymore.
Ive seen reports of strange artefacts appearing in places that were thought to be devoid of any anomaly. The Zone seems to be shifting its boundaries.
Theres a new rumour about a forgotten lab deep in the Red Forest. Some say it contains secrets from before the disaster. Im not sure if its true, but its worth looking into.
Ive always been cautious around the Bloodsucker's lairs. Some say theyre more than just mutants. They seem to have an uncanny sense of their surroundings.
If we could find a way to stabilize the energy from an Electro anomaly, we could harness it for power. But every attempt so far has ended in failure.
Its not just the mutants we need to worry about. Ive heard reports of entire research groups going missing without a trace. Somethings off about the Zone.
I once found an artefact that altered my perception of time. It was only for a few moments, but it felt like an eternity. Im still not sure what I experienced.
I've been hearing strange noises around the outskirts of the Zone. Its as if the wind itself is speaking to us, though no one else seems to notice.
There are whispers of a place where the anomalies are so dense, they create an invisible barrier around it. No one has made it out alive. I wonder whats hiding there.
The Zone is evolving, that much is clear. Ive been charting its changes for months, but its hard to keep up when everything shifts so rapidly.
The gas anomalies in the Cordon have been growing in intensity. It seems like every day they become more dangerous, more unpredictable.
My detectors have been picking up strange readings lately. At first, I thought it was malfunctioning, but now Im not so sure. Something's definitely wrong.
I've been trying to catalog the different mutations in the Zone, but the truth is, every day brings something new. It's like the Zones own evolutionary experiment.
Some artefacts seem to have a mind of their own. I once found one that tried to escape from my pack, and it took a hell of an effort to get it back.
Theres a storm brewing, and I dont mean the kind were used to. Something bigger, something worse is coming. Well need to prepare for whats ahead.
The data from our last mission indicates a rise in the frequency of mutant sightings near the Agroprom. We should proceed with caution.
I've come across some peculiar plant mutations in the Cordon area. There's something strange about the growth patterns.
Theres a peculiar anomaly near the Garbage. Ive never seen anything like it. It's worth investigating.
Were seeing some disturbing changes in the electromagnetic readings around Pripyat. Something big is coming.
The data from our anomaly detectors is showing a sudden surge of activity. Keep your eyes peeled, things are about to get intense.
I've received word that a new type of artifact has been discovered near the Yantar. We should consider a full-scale investigation.
My research shows that some creatures in the Zone are adapting to the anomalies. They are evolving faster than we can track.
Ive been studying the changes in the local ecosystem. Some areas are flourishing, while others are slowly dying off.
Did you hear about the strange metallic object found near the Dead City? It might be worth checking out. Could be a clue to the Zones origins.
Im planning an expedition to the Jupiter plant to investigate new mutations in the local fauna. We could use all the help we can get.
The last expedition to the Red Forest yielded some incredible findings. Ill be putting together a report soon.
Ive been testing some new equipment. The new anomaly scanner should make our research a lot safer.
Some of the local fauna are showing signs of mutation that are unlike anything we've seen before. Its getting worse.
There are reports of strange occurrences in the Dark Valley. We should organize a team to investigate immediately.
It seems the Zone's radiation levels are stabilizing in some areas, but new threats are emerging. Be prepared for anything.
I've been looking into the Zone's weather patterns. The anomalies seem to be reacting to the environment more than before.
The local vegetation around the Army Warehouses seems to be thriving, despite the radiation levels. It's a mystery that needs solving.
I've just been informed that a new, previously unknown type of anomaly was detected near the Great Swamp. We should send a team there ASAP.
Weve observed some strange phenomena near the Chernobyl NPP. The energy readings are off the charts. I think we need to investigate further.
Theres been an increase in the number of bloodsuckers near the outskirts of the Zone. Be cautious while traveling through there.
Our latest study suggests that the anomalies are becoming more volatile. I suspect they are reacting to some new influence.
Word is, the militarys been seen around the Zone again. Keep your distanceour research is much more important than their games.
The anomalies near the Dead City are becoming increasingly unstable. Its only a matter of time before they start changing the landscape.
I've just heard that an important artifact was stolen from one of the labs near Yantar. Its probably in the hands of bandits now. We need to recover it.
We've detected some unusual radiation spikes in the Cordon. Something is definitely brewing underground.
There are rumors about a new kind of artifact being formed in the X-18 laboratory. We might be able to get our hands on it if we act fast.
Recent storms have disturbed the local fauna. We might have to rethink our research approach for the coming months.
I've been looking into the reports from the scientists at Yantar. It seems the anomalies in that area are growing more erratic.
Theres something odd about the mutated animals around the Pripyat area. Their behavior is becoming less predictable.
Some of the new artifacts weve found have strange electromagnetic properties. Its like they have a mind of their own.
The radiation levels in the Red Forest are fluctuating. I think somethings messing with the local ecosystems stability.
I've read some disturbing reports. The military is starting to get more aggressive in their attempts to take control of the Zone.
Rumor has it that the Freedom faction is planning a large-scale raid on one of the labs in the Zone. We may need to prepare for a fight.
Theres an anomaly near the Chernobyl NPP thats been causing erratic energy surges. Well need to take more readings before we can approach it.
Word is, some of the mutants in the Zone are evolving faster than anticipated. We might need to recalibrate our detectors to account for new species.
The local ecology is rapidly changing. Were seeing species that were once rare popping up in areas where they shouldnt be.
Im thinking of heading to the Dead City soon. The rumors about powerful artifacts there are too tempting to ignore.
Some of the old research notes from X-16 indicate that the facility might hold the key to controlling the anomalies. We should check it out.
The Psi-storms have been growing more frequent. Some of our team members are worried they might be linked to the creation of new artifacts.
Theres a strange humming sound near the Yantar lab. It's unlike anything I've encountered in the Zone before. We should investigate it further.
Ive been analyzing the soil in the Zone. Some areas show signs of unusual mutations in the plant life. It might be connected to the anomalies.
The scientists at the Jupiter plant are having trouble understanding the new behavior of the local mutants. Something in the air is changing them.
Its been a long while since weve had a breakthrough on the artifact front. Ive got a few ideas that might lead us to something big.
Ive heard talk of a new type of anomaly being discovered in the Dark Valley. We should probably check it out before someone else does.
The energy readings around Pripyat are off the charts again. We need to conduct more tests to figure out what's causing the spikes.
Stay sharp, Duty scumbags may show up any time.
Voronin keeps sending scouts to that farm over the hill. They never learn, don't they?
Hey $name, if you're feeling sick, let me know and I will let my friend patch you up, you won't regret it.
"Maintaining order in the Zone", best joke I've ever heard.
Monolith forces are giving our guys at the Barrier a hard time. It was never easy actually, I don't envy them.
Gotta admit, Duty did a great job protecting the Bar from the dogs so far. That's impressive.
Yo $name, got a lighter? I left mine in the camp.
I don't mind having the bandits around, as long as they stay out of our way.
There is no law in the Zone, gotta keep that in mind.
Shit, I feel a bit dizzy.
Sooner or later, we will free the Zone from those who abuse its treasures.
The Zone's a wild place. As long as were still breathing, were free. Thats all that matters.
If anyone tells you the Zones getting safer, they're either lying or out of their mind.
Ever wonder how long itll take before the government finally realizes they can't control this place?
Weve been surviving in the Zone for years, but the real fights ahead. The Monolith wont just roll over.
Sometimes I feel like Im just here to watch the world burn. And, you know what? Im okay with that.
Did you hear? A group of Mercs tried to get into the Bar last night. They're lucky our guys were on point.
Freedom's not about anarchy. Its about choice. A choice to live outside the system's chokehold.
Hey, dont go poking around the wild territories. Mutants are getting restless out there.
If you see any of those Monolith fanatics, tell them to keep their distance. Theyre asking for trouble.
The only thing more dangerous than the mutants in this place is the power-hungry fools who think they can control it.
Sometimes I wish we could just pull out of the Zone, but where else would we go? It's all we've got.
I've been watching the skies. Another Psi-storm might be brewing. Stay inside if you can.
If we could just get our hands on more of those gadgets from the scientists, we'd have a real edge out here.
Theres a rumor going around about a stash of old military supplies near the Agroprom. Could be worth checking out.
Id be lying if I said I wasnt looking forward to the day we can finally walk out of this hellhole.
Ever thought about what happens when all the scientists disappear? Well be left to deal with the monsters ourselves.
Whats the deal with all the stalkers around the Bar? Youd think they'd have better things to do.
Stay away from the Red Forest. People disappear there faster than you can blink.
The more time I spend in this place, the more I understand why they call it "the Zone". It's a place of no return.
The Bars getting busier every day. Too many bandits trying to blend in. Well need to keep an eye on them.
Don't get too comfortable. The Zone has a way of changing things when you least expect it.
If those Duty dogs think theyre getting the upper hand, theyve got another thing coming. Freedom never bows down.
There's always something more in the Zone than meets the eye. Keep your guard up, especially around the swamps.
Been hearing some weird noises at the Bar lately. Probably just mutants, but it's worth checking out.
The Zone might try to break us, but we'll always come back stronger. That's the Freedom way.
I dont trust those Monolith freaks. Theyre just puppets, and theres someone pulling their strings.
Youve got to hand it to Duty, theyve got discipline. But weve got something theyll never have: freedom.
The Zones chaos is its beauty. Anyone trying to make it orderly is fighting the very thing that makes it alive.
If you think the stalkers are the real danger here, you havent seen the worst the Zone has to offer.
Last night, I heard shots from the direction of the Army Warehouses. Someones stirring trouble, and it isnt us.
Dont let the rumors fool you. No one controls the Zone. You either survive or you dont.
I dont trust the way Duty operates. Theres too much secrecy. The truths out there, but were the ones digging for it.
Weve got the right idea. Let the others chase after relics and powerFreedoms here to live, not to rule.
Sometimes, I think the Zones been trying to tell us something. I dont know what, but theres something bigger going on.
If you see any mercenaries wandering around, steer clear. Theyre always after somethingand it's never good for us.
Keep strong smoking that ganj.
To be honest, I don't really feel comfortable about killing all those people. But hey, work is work, and I need to make a living.
The scientists were looking for bodyguards, they're having a hard time dealing with mutants and bandits.
One of my clients asked me to go with him hunting artefacts. I refused, that's not what I was trained for.
Dushman got new contracts for us, I will check that out on my way back.
Being a hitman isn't an easy thing.
If you need something done, I can offer my services... At the right price, of course.
Always go for the squad leader first, this will distract the rest for good.
I can help you with your bounty contracts, we can split the money after that.
Artefact hunting is actually quite common among mercs, especially those who prefer to stay away from killing others.
I always keep a pistol around. You can never go wrong with a reliable, fast sidearm.

I wonder what happened to Scar. You know, the legendary merc who assisted Clear Sky before that big emission, right?\nPeople say he died, others say he became a Monolith leader... Is it possible that he might still be alive?
You can make easy money out of Freedom - Duty conflicts, both offer assassination contracts on each other's targets.
Monolith assassination contracts make me nervous... don't you dare telling anyone that I've said that.
As long as bandits don't interfere with my contracts, I don't mind seeing them around.
Stalkers are usually the easiest targets in the Zone. Sometimes I feel bad about killing one.
Ive been paid to take out all kinds of people, but it still doesnt sit right with me when its just someone trying to survive the Zone.
When youre a merc, the job never really gets easier. But hey, the pays good, and thats what keeps you going.
Mutants are easier to kill than men. Theyre predictable. Humans? Not so much.
The scientists, they think they can buy protection with their money. But what they really need is good intel... and Im the one to provide it.
I heard theres a big bounty on a stalker named Sashka. If the rumors are true, hes one dangerous bastard.
I dont care about the politics of the factions. Just tell me who to kill and pay me, thats all I need to know.
Being in this line of work means always watching your back. You can trust nobody, not even your own reflection.
Sometimes I wonder if Ill ever be free of this bloodshed. But thats a luxury for the weak, and Im not weak.
If Ive learned anything in this business, its that trust gets you killed. Only contracts and cold cash are the truth here.
Theres something unsettling about the Monolith, but a contracts a contract. Doesnt matter who the target is.
Even the worst bandits know the value of a good assassin. Funny how theyre willing to pay for a service theyd usually end up killing.
Ive crossed paths with too many former clients. Its not always a friendly reunion, especially when theyve paid for my services more than once.
Rumors say theres a new leader rising among the bandits. If hes anything like the others, hell be dead within a week.
Money makes the world go round, but in the Zone, it just makes the killing easier.
My friend found some rare artefacts in Zaton, I need to get a good detector.
Those Ukrainian army bastards think they can order stalkers around. "We are here to protect you from the Zone", my ass.
Man, Sidorovich's prices are unbelievable.
Stay alert, bandits may show up at any time now.
Those bloody bandits think they can stroll around and rob stalkers just like that, they are gonna pay for it.
Hey, let's avoid the military checkpoints, I don't want to commit suicide today.
I haven't decided yet what's best for me. Artefact hunting is profitable, delivery jobs are not that bad either.
Duty and Freedom confused me for a long time, both have got good points and ideals.
I can still hear Duty megaphones inside my head, what the hell...
$name, have you ever considered the Arena? Seems like a good deal.
I wanna visit the 100 Rads Bar. Barkeep's got all sorts of drinks, and I'm in the mood for one.
Moving out from Cordon to Rostok isn't a piece of cake, you can thank bandits for that.
Beard was offering jobs about hunting specific artefacts, too bad I don't own a good detector...
My friend said once to never trust a merc. You might be his friend today, and his contract tomorrow.
I came here looking for work and opportunities, I want throw my old life behind. What about you, $name?
Theres a rumor going around that the militarys been getting more aggressive lately. Something's brewing, and I don't like it.
Sometimes I wonder if Im just a pawn in some bigger game... but then I remember, at least Im alive to wonder.
Theres a lot of strange things in the Zone, but nothing messes with your head quite like those damn anomalies.
If I ever find a stash of military gear, I'm taking it for myself. Those guys are too busy with their checkpoints to know whats out there.
Ive heard a few stalkers claim they saw a pocket of reality somewhere in the Zone. Thats one mystery I wont be chasing anytime soon.
The mutants dont scare me, but getting caught between a firefight between Freedom and Duty? Now thats a real threat.
That old shack near the burned-out village? I hear its cursed. Still, I bet theres something good hiding there. Its worth a look.
Ever since the last emission, things have been off. I've seen more strange creatures and heard whispers that shouldn't be there.
Some say the Zone is a gift, others call it a curse. Personally, I think its bothdepending on how you play your cards.
I try to avoid the military when I can. Ive got nothing against them, but their security usually comes with a bullet for the wrong people.
Vasily tried to teach me how to make explosives once. It ended badlylets just say Im better at finding them than making them.
Heard something about a big stash of supplies near the Agroprom. Too bad its guarded by mutants and probably the military by now.
They say the Zone changes you. I can feel it. Every day out here feels like a year back home.
If youre looking for work, theres always something to do around the Bar. People are always losing something in the Zonemakes for easy profit.
Be careful around the anomalies, mate. Theyre the Zones way of saying dont get too comfortable.
Sometimes I can hear whispers in the wind. I dont know if its the Zone or just my mind snapping, but its unsettling either way.
I hear the scientists at the research facilities are getting close to a breakthrough on the artifact theory. If thats true, were all in trouble.
My buddy said he saw something moving in the bushes, but when we checked, it was just a mutated boar. Still, it could have been something worse.
Whoever thought the Zone would be a good place to live was out of their mind. Its nothing but death and madness out here.
The bandits might be a pain, but theyre not stupid. If you catch them off guard, theyll pay for their mistake.
Ever thought about the weird stuff happening in the Zone? Time bends, reality cracks. Sometimes I wonder if were just walking through a dream.
Ive seen things in the Zone that I cant explain. No one can, really. But it keeps me coming back for more.
Sometimes I wonder if the Zone itself is alive, pulling us all into its twisted game. Its a hell of a way to spend a life.
I used to think the Zone was just a place for crazy scientists and thrill-seekers. Now I know betterthis place doesnt care about who you were.
Theres a story about a stalker who disappeared in the Labyrinth. They say he found the heart of the Zone, and it drove him mad. I dont know if I believe it, but I dont plan on finding out.
I hear theres a hidden stash in the Chernobyl area, but the rumors say the place is cursed. Whats left of it, I mean.
If you ever find yourself in Pripyat, dont go near the ferris wheel. People say the dead dont rest there, and Ive seen enough to believe it.
The Freedom guys talk a lot about the truth, but Ive never met one who wasnt trying to get rich off it. Same goes for Duty. Ideals dont pay the bills out here.
Dont trust the Monolith. Theyll tell you theyre here to save you, but Ive seen what they really do. Theyre just another cult, and their god is the Zone itself.
Its funny how all these factions claim theyve got the answers, but none of them can even survive a full day out here without their precious gear and numbers.
I swear, some days it feels like the mutants are evolving. Im not sure how, but theyre getting smarter. Its only a matter of time before one of them outsmarts us.
Sometimes I wonder if well ever leave the Zone. Everyone says theyre looking for a way out, but every time I turn around, theres more to explore.
Brother, show no mercy to those who stand against the Monolith's will.
May the Monolith be with you, $name.
We thank you, oh Monolith, for revealing the cunning plans of your enemies to us.
We need to avenge our fallen brothers, let's move.
Clear Sky paid dearly for interfering with the Monolith's plans once, others will follow.
$name, the Monolith has blessed us with wonderful artefacts. Bring as many as you can find to our base.
Be careful brother, the enemy may show up at any moment.
Bring death to those who spurn the holy power of the Monolith.
In the Monolith, we are eternal. Those who defy us will be forgotten, lost to the winds of time.
We are the chosen. Our path is righteous, and the Zone will bow to our will.
Every artefact you bring us brings us closer to the Monolith's truth. Never forget that, brother.
The Zone's secrets are not for the weak. Only those with faith can uncover the power hidden within its depths.
The world outside the Zone is corrupted. The Monolith offers the only true salvation. Join us, or perish alone.
Our enemies are blind to the truth, they fight against the very force that will save them. We are their last hope, though they will never realize it.
The Monolith does not forget. It is watching, always guiding those faithful to its cause.
Brother, each step you take in the Zone brings us closer to the Monolith's will. Fear nothing, for it is with you.
Let the winds of the Zone carry us forward, for the Monoliths will shall never falter. Every enemy you face is another step toward our ascension.
We stand united, as one, for the Monolith. The weak fall before us, and the strong are absorbed into the truth.
The Monolith speaks to us through the anomalies, guiding us. Every artefact is its voice, and we listen.
It is not enough to conquer the Zone. We must reshape it to fit the will of the Monolith, and then the world shall follow.
Our enemies call us fanatics. They do not understand the Monolith. They do not understand the power we wield.
Let us teach these infidels the meaning of devotion. The Monolith will not be mocked.
Fear is a tool of our enemies. But we, the chosen, fear nothing. The Monolith guides us in all things.
We walk the path of the righteous, for the Monolith has already decided our fate. To resist it is to resist destiny.
Brother, take solace in knowing that every life lost is a step toward the Monolith's victory.
The Monolith does not care for the foolishness of mankind. Only the faithful will see its true power.
The Zone is nothing but a reflection of the Monolith's will. Those who fight it fight against fate itself.
The Monolith whispers of things to come. We must be vigilant, for its will is boundless, and its power unstoppable.
Every strike against the Monolith is a strike against the truth. We shall never yield, for we are its servants, and its servants are immortal.
The Monolith stands as the last bastion of order in a world lost to chaos. And we, its children, shall defend it until the end.
The Monolith is not a mere object, it is the key to the universe. We are its guardians, chosen to lead the way.
Our enemies stumble in the dark, but we walk with the light of the Monolith. There is no darkness that can hold us.
Brother, the Zone is our trial, and we are destined to emerge as its victors. The Monolith demands it.
Every step taken in the Zone is a step closer to the truth. Those who stand in our way will fall before the might of the Monolith.
The Monolith does not ask for loyalty, it commands it. Those who do not heed its call will be lost to the winds of time.
We are the harbingers of change. The Zone will be reshaped in the Monolith's image, and we will stand as its eternal heralds.
Let those who oppose us tremble, for they are nothing before the Monolith's will. The truth is unyielding, and so are we.
The Monolith whispers to us, revealing the secrets of the Zone. We are its chosen ones, its voice in this world.
To question the Monolith is to question the very fabric of existence. We are its instruments, and we will carry out its will, no matter the cost.
Every victory we claim in the Zone is a victory for the Monolith. Its power grows stronger with each passing day.
Even as the world around us crumbles, the Monolith stands as an unshakable force. We shall remain true to it, no matter what comes.
We do not seek power for ourselves. We are the Monoliths servants, and in serving it, we become more than human.
The Zone will bend to the will of the Monolith, and all who defy it will be cast aside like dust.
Our cause is divine. To fight against the Monolith is to fight against destiny itself. We will not be swayed.
I'm so used to this place, it's getting really old.
Home sweet home.
Are we staying here for long?
Feels good to be here. Our fellas are guarding the place.
I need to explore the rest of the Zone, staying here won't help.
Been here for quite a long time.
This place is familiar, but every time I walk through, it feels like I'm seeing it for the first time.
It's quiet today. Too quiet. I don't like it.
We've got a good setup here, but I can't shake the feeling we're being watched.
Nothing's changed since the last time I was here... except maybe me.
This place used to feel like a refuge, now it just feels like another pit in the Zone.
Sometimes I wonder if we'll ever leave this place or if it's already become our tomb.
Feels like I've been here too long. Like the Zone is drawing me back to its depths.
Cant decide if this place feels like home or a trap. Maybe its both.
I keep looking at the same damn walls. At this point, I could navigate it blindfolded.
Its strange. This place used to have life, now it feels like a ghost town.
Were settled in here, but something in the air keeps telling me were not safe. Not really.
Every time I walk around here, its like the place changes. No two days are the same in the Zone.
I think weve seen enough of this place. Time to pack up and head deeper into the Zone.
The longer I stay, the more I wonder what happened to all the others who came before us.
Home? Yeah, if you count a place where you're always on edge, waiting for the next disaster.
Its quiet here, but it feels like the Zones been holding its breath, just waiting for something to happen.
Some days, I wonder if were just here to mark time... while the Zone slowly devours us.
This place is starting to feel more like a cage than a refuge. Maybe its time we moved on.
Weve been here too long. It feels like this place has a hold on us, like its refusing to let us leave.
I can hear the wind howling outside, but inside... its too quiet. Its like were alone in this entire place.
Weve been hiding here for a while, but Im starting to think the real danger isnt outside. Its in the air, in the walls, in the silence.
This place feels like its holding its breath. Waiting. Waiting for something... but Im not sure what.
Its strange how this place feels like a home and a tomb all at once. Every corner feels like its watching you.
Weve been keeping to ourselves here, but I wonder how much longer we can ignore the rest of the Zones chaos.
Every step around here feels like a memory, but I cant tell if its from before or after everything went wrong.
This place used to be safe. Now, it feels like its just a waiting room before something worse comes along.
We used to think we could find refuge here, but now its just another part of the Zone, twisted and infected.
I thought Id find some peace in this place, but its just as haunted as every other corner of the Zone.
Maybe it's the calm before the storm. Maybe its the Zones way of lulling us into a false sense of security before everything falls apart.
Theres something about this place. Every time I walk through, its like I see something newor something old Id rather forget.
Its funny, this place doesnt even feel like a home anymore. More like a place to wait, just biding our time.
I'm not comfortable with this...
Would you look at this place...
This used to be a town built for the engineers and the personnel working at the Chernobyl NPP...
It was quite a big place once, it is a ghost town now, with mutants and Monolith as the only residents.
The famous Ferris Wheel... it's even bigger than what I imagined.
The former Pripyat Stadium became a battleground infested with Monolith troops.
So visiting this place is your greatest idea?!
We are far behind enemy lines, I hope you know what you're doing...
Get ready for Monolith troops, they will show up at any moment now.
Why did I agree on coming along with you...
This city... it's not just abandoned, it's cursed.
The air smells different here. Almost like it's thick with radiation.
Even the quiet feels wrong. It's too... empty.
I can't believe people used to live here. Now it's just a tomb full of echoes.
Is that the Pripyat River? It's strange to see something so calm in a place like this.
Theres no telling whats lurking in the shadows of this city. Keep your guard up.
Ive heard stories about what happens to those who wander too far into Pripyat let's not become one of them.
Those Monolith freaks have no place here. This was a peaceful town before they showed up.
Look at the Ferris wheel. It's like the citys last smile before it all went to hell.
Pripyat was once a symbol of Soviet power... now it's just a graveyard of broken dreams.
Somewhere in this place, there are still remnants of what it used to be. I wonder how much longer they'll last.
Keep your eyes on the rooftops. Ive seen movement there before.
Being here feels like walking through a bad memory... one thats still alive and waiting to drag us under.
This place is still too quiet... it feels like the citys just waiting for something to happen.
I cant shake the feeling that somethings watching us from the shadows. This town doesnt sleep.
Every corner of Pripyat holds a memory. But I think some memories are better left forgotten.
Its strange, isnt it? How something so still can feel so alive... in a way, its haunting.
The skys dim, but the city feels like its burning from within. Too many secrets buried here.
Nothing about this place feels natural anymore. Even the wind carries the smell of lost time.
Do you hear that? Its like the city itself is breathing, waiting for us to make a mistake.
The further we go, the more the place feels... wrong. Like were intruding on something ancient and forgotten.
That old hospital... I can almost hear the screams of the past echoing from its walls. I dont want to go there.
I wonder what this place was like before the disaster. It couldnt have been all bad, could it?
The Ferris wheel seems almost... inviting, doesnt it? Like its offering us a view of something we dont want to see.
This city used to be full of life. Now it feels like a tomb. And I cant shake the feeling were not alone here.
Ive heard about the things that walk through Pripyat at night. Dont think Im ready to meet one of them.
Stay close. The Zones never as quiet as it seems. Things always start moving when you least expect them.
This place is filled with memories. Some of them are better left undisturbed.
Theres something in the air here. Its thick, like its suffocating us. I cant explain it, but it feels alive.
I thought I was ready for anything, but this place... its like its watching, waiting for us to slip up.
If you listen closely, you can hear the hum of the citys old power. Its faint, but its there, like a heartbeat.
Pripyat feels like a dream I cant wake up from. No matter how far I go, I cant escape it.
The buildings here seem to crumble with each passing wind. The Zones power doesnt just affect the landit rots away the very foundations of whats left.
I thought Id seen everything, but Pripyat... its a different kind of ruin. Its not just abandoned, its forgotten.
The silence here is heavier than it should be. Theres something unnerving about it, like the citys holding its breath.
Pripyat was supposed to be the future, but its a graveyard now. A monument to ambition gone wrong.
Who knows how many eyes are watching us from those shattered windows? This place was full of life once. Now its a collection of dead memories.
Have you ever wondered how many people died here and never had a chance to say goodbye? Its like theyve all been absorbed into the city.
That Ferris wheel is haunting. It's as if its still trying to take people on a ride they cant escape from.
Every shadow in Pripyat feels like its alive. Sometimes I think the buildings are trying to swallow us whole.
Walking through this place, I keep expecting to hear footsteps behind me, but theres no one here. Or is there?
They say the Zone can make people disappear without a trace. Pripyats where they vanish. Im starting to see why.
Feel that cold breeze? Its not natural. Like the city is exhaling its last breath, one gust at a time.
The sky here is never truly clear. Its like the sun cant bear to shine down on the ruins of what was once a thriving city.
I keep hearing things out here. Voices? Wind? Cant be sure. But it feels like the citys still trying to talk to us.
This place was supposed to be full of dreams, but now it feels like its cursed with nightmares that refuse to fade.
The last time I was here, everything felt wrong. Now, it feels worse. Theres no escaping the sense that the Zone is closing in on us.
Can you feel the ground beneath you? Its unstable, like the city itself is shifting, trying to bury us all under its weight.
They say the heart of the Zone is in Pripyat. Ive seen enough to believe it. Something dark, something alive, lies within these streets.
Im starting to think that the people who lived here never truly left. Their presence still lingers in the cracks and the walls.
Theres something about the old hospital here It feels like its holding onto something. Something it shouldnt.
Look at the remains of that stadium. What were they cheering for back then? Now, its nothing but a reminder of whats been lost.
Theres a chill in the air here that doesnt come from the weather. Its the kind of cold that seeps into your bones, making you feel like youre not alone.
Pripyats silence isnt peace. Its a warning. I cant help but feel were not meant to be here.
The wind howls through the broken buildings like a mournful wail. It's as if Pripyat itself is crying out for somethingperhaps for those lost in the disaster.
The walls of these buildings have seen too much. I swear I can almost hear the echoes of the lives that once filled this place, now gone forever.
The Monoliths influence isnt just in the airits in the very ground we walk on. Its as if Pripyats been twisted, reshaped by something we dont understand.
This place used to be full of laughter and life. Now, all thats left is the silence and the slow crawl of decay. Its almost as if the city is waiting for its next victim.
The sky here has a different color. Its like the sun cant bear to shine fully on this forsaken city, casting it in an eternal state of twilight.
The abandoned apartments here arent empty. Theres a weight to them. Ive never been so sure that somethingor someoneis watching us from the windows.
I swear the Ferris wheel is moving on its own. Maybe its just the wind, but something about it feels wrong, like its remembering something it shouldnt.
This place was built with such pride. Now its a tomb of broken promises. How long before the last traces of humanity here are swallowed by the Zone?
Theres a strange hum in the air. Maybe its the radiation, or maybe its something else. It feels like the entire city is vibrating, as if its alive in ways we cant understand.
Pripyats ruins are more than just abandoned buildings. Its a monument to failure. And theres something about this place that makes me think its not done with us yet.
Rookies' home, everyone starts from somewhere after all.
The border, I won't mind staying here.
The Ukrainian military guards couldn't stop stalkers from breaking through, after all.
How's that old fat ass doing these days... Still ripping people off I presume.
Stalkers spotted bloodsuckers near the tunnels once. It's not safe, not even here.
One day you see bandits inhabiting the Car Park, next day it's the loners' turn.
The Railway bridge used to be the second gate to the Zone, I don't think the army has control over it any more.
The Mill is a good place to hide a stash, stalkers usually don't stay in there.
If I'm not mistaken, there is a technician in the northern farm.
The situation at the outpost is unstable. Many parties are fighting over it.
Been a while since Ive seen the old checkpoint. Still smells like blood and dust, just like the good old days.
Watch your back near the mill, Ive seen some weird stuff there at night. Could be ghosts, could be mutants. You never know.
Not many know this, but the tunnels below the old factory have a strange hum to them. Some say its a sign, others say its just the Zones way of messing with your head.
The forest to the south isnt just denseits alive. You feel that pressure? Its the trees watching you.
If youre heading towards the swamp, keep your eyes peeled. Ive seen something large move beneath the surface. Definitely not a croc.
I heard someone call this place The Border of the Dead. Seems fitting. If you're still here after all this time, youre either desperate or damn lucky.
Ever notice how quiet the place gets once you pass the railway? Its like youve crossed into a whole new world. Whatever happens there stays there.
Those old guard towers are more than just a relicthey're a reminder of how fast things can fall apart. One minute, youve got control, the next, its all gone to hell.
Its not about surviving out here, its about learning to live with it. You cant escape the Zone, no matter how far you run.
Ever wonder how many have come through this place and never left? Maybe its better not to think about it.
One of these days, Im gonna take a nap on top of that old rusted car and let the mutants sort me out. They seem like a more peaceful bunch than the bandits.
That old barn by the farm? Its been used by stalkers, bandits, and even the army. Who knows whats hidden in there now.
Had a run-in with a bloodsucker near the tunnels. If you value your face, dont make the same mistake I did. Theyre faster than you think.
Somebody left a stash in the abandoned warehouse by the railroad. Youd think after all these years someone wouldve claimed it, but its still sitting there untouched.
The old factorys a mess. Dont go in there looking for trouble unless youve got a death wish. That place has a bad energy to it.
Last time I passed through the old checkpoint, the guard dogs were unusually quiet. Too quiet. Makes me think they know something we dont.
Were close to the car park. Its a decent place to stay, but dont expect it to stay empty for long. Bandits and worse come through there regularly.
If you see a big pile of junk near the farm, dont bother looking through it. People have disappeared doing that. Its almost like the Zone is pulling them in.
You know that weird humming noise near the tunnel entrance? I used to think it was just a weird anomaly. But now Im starting to think its something else entirely.
Weve had some close calls around here. Not just with mutants, but with the Zone itself. It feels like the walls are closing in every time I hear that distant scream.
Ive got a bad feeling about tonight. The air feels thick, like somethings waiting to strike. Its gonna be a long one.
Ever wonder if were just part of the Zones game? Ive got this nagging feeling were being watched from every corner.
Sometimes I think about what itd be like to leave this place behind. But then the Zone reminds me why I cant. Its a prison, and Ive been here too long to forget that.
This graveyard gives me the creeps, I heard many stalkers vanished while moving between the vehicles.
Would you look at this, what a shitty depressing place.
Duty and bandits have some presence here, but no-one goes too deep.
Stay away from the middle area, I don't wanna be food for bloodsuckers today.
Those tanks and vehicles lying around are quite radioactive, you better have a good gas mask.
Vortex anomalies are common around here, watch your step.
You can hide in the camp in the north-eastern side. It's a good place to stay safe from emissions.
Every time I walk past these old wrecks, I feel like they're watching me. Like they're waiting for something.
The trucks are all rusted and broken, but there's something still... off. Its like the Zone doesn't want them to be forgotten.
This place doesnt feel abandoned. If you listen closely, you can almost hear footsteps from the past... or maybe thats just me losing it.
Heard the bandits keep to the northern edge. If you want to stay out of trouble, steer clear of their territory. They dont take kindly to trespassers.
Dont let the quiet fool you. The trucks here hide more than just rusted metal. Many have made that mistake.
Ive seen bloodsuckers slip between the trucks like shadows. Its best to stay out of their way, trust me on that one.
The radiation heres off the charts. Even the most experienced stalkers stay in the safe zones. One wrong step, and youre done.
That old tank in the center? It's a deathtrap. Dont bother checking it out unless you have a death wish. The air around it reeks of bad memories.
Theres a strange silence around the trucks. No wind, no birds. Its almost like the place is holding its breath, waiting for something to happen.
If you find a stash in the middle of this place, its probably booby-trapped. Nothing good comes easy here.
Maybe its the dead quiet, or maybe its just me, but I swear I hear voices coming from the wrecks. You ever get that feeling, like you're not alone?
If you're looking for cover, there's an old bunker up ahead. It's not much, but it'll shield you from the worst of the radiation and anomalies.
I heard a story once, about a stalker who disappeared here. Some say he found something valuable. Others say the Zone took him. You decide.
Theres a strange warmth to the trucks here, like something's still keeping them alive. Its not natural, and I don't trust it.
Eh, we got a long road ahead of us.
You know what we really need right now? A freaking car.
Be careful, I feel like something is waiting for us behind those trees.
Bandits usually hide at the bridge, waiting for rookies to show up.
Pseudodogs are quite common here, I hope we don't meet a hungry one.
Looking at the rails, this place used to be a big train station. Now it's just an empty forest.
We can stop by the warehouse to rest for a bit, although I'm not sure who's controlling it.
The trees here feel like theyre closing in on us... its not just the wind, something feels off.
There's an eerie silence in this place. I haven't heard any birds or wildlife since we entered. Something's watching.
These old train tracks stretch out for miles. Too bad the trains dont run anymore. Not that Id want to ride one in this hellhole.
I wouldnt trust the ground here. These forest floors have been known to swallow up a stalker or two. Stay light on your feet.
Bandits? In this territory, theyre not the worst thing youll run into. There are worse things lurking in the dark.
We could make it to the warehouse, but its always crawling with scavengers. Do you think it's worth the risk?
I swear I heard something out there in the trees... couldve been a mutant or just my nerves playing tricks on me. But keep your eyes peeled.
Havent seen any of the Monolith here... yet. But the further we go, the more likely well run into them. Just dont trust anyone you meet.
If you think this place looks bad now, just wait till the storms roll in. Its like the whole Zone gets angry.
Theres an old rumor about a hidden stash near the abandoned warehouses. Could be junk, but could be something valuable too. Worth checking out later.
This area used to be a lifeline for transportation. Now its just a graveyard of broken tracks and abandoned hopes.
Im no expert, but Ive heard strange things happen around this place. Dont stray too far from me unless youre ready to disappear.
We should keep moving. I have a feeling something bigger than bandits is out here. And its not going to stay hidden much longer.
If we stay here too long, the Zone might start claiming us as its own. We should head out before night falls.
I hate swamps.
What are we exactly doing here? Watching the frogs?
This place is no joke, walk in the water for a few minutes if you want to join the zombies.
No-one knows what's waiting for us behind those reeds.
The view isn't that bad.
I think I caught bugs in my ass, and staying in this swampy place isn't helping it.
It looks like Clear Sky is back in business. I can't say the same for the Renegades, though.
Did you know, the swamps were not always a marshland. This area used to be a farming region, with villages and fields.
If I'm not mistaken, the pump station was built in order to extract anomalous substances from the bottom of the swamps.
There's a machine yard near the north-eastern part. Renegades used to control the place.
Have you ever been to the old church? It's beautiful yet creepy at the same time.
You can find some stashes in those farms... if you're lucky enough.
The swamp's fog is thick. Almost like it's hiding somethingor someone.
I swear, every step I take here feels like the ground's going to swallow me whole.
It's quiet here. Too quiet. I dont trust it, not one bit.
What do you think? We head deeper into the swamp or start looking for a way out? This place has a way of getting under your skin.
Ever heard of the "Swamp King"? Some say there's a mutant out here that rules this place. Id rather not meet him.
These plants... they don't look right. Theres something off about them, like theyre watching us.
Ive heard stories of people getting lost here. They say the swamp takes them... I hope thats just a myth.
If we run into any more of those mutated frogs, Im outta here. I didnt sign up for this kind of wildlife encounter.
Watch where you step, the mud here could pull you in faster than you think. And believe me, no ones getting you out.
Why the hell is everything so damn wet here? The swamps never given up, even after all this time.
If the Renegades were smart, theyd have abandoned this place long ago. Its a deathtrap out here.
Someone told me the swamp used to be a paradise... Cant imagine it now, just a damn mire full of death.
The church looks untouched, but something about it just feels wrong. Like its holding secrets better left buried.
Im starting to think the best way out of this swamp is to just keep walking. Find a way to leave the damned place behind.
I... I can't believe my eyes..... we made it to the centre!
I'm still alive...
The centre of the Zone... the Chernobyl Nuclear Power Plant is lying right in front of us...
We made it...
After all this time, the Power Planet itself...
The centre... We've finally made it to the centre...
I have never been this nervous in my whole life...
The air here feels... different. It's like the Zone itself is watching us.
Its strange, isnt it? All this destruction, and yet... theres still a strange beauty to it.
The Chernobyl NPP... I never thought I'd see it up close. And Im not sure if thats a good thing.
Every step feels heavier here. I can almost hear the screams of those who died for this place.
Ive heard whispers about the horrors within. Lets hope theyre just stories... but something tells me they arent.
This is it. The heart of the Zone. And somehow, I feel even more lost now than I did when we started.
The reactors still standing... but for how long? This place feels like it could fall apart at any moment.
We made it to the heart of the Zone, but theres a sinking feeling in my gut. I dont think its over yet.
Have you noticed? Its dead quiet. No birds, no wind. Just the eerie hum of the reactor in the distance.
Everything here seems wrong. Like it's been cursed by its own sins.
Ive seen some horrors, but nothing like this. The air here feels like its filled with regret.
We're not alone. I can feel it. The Zone doesnt like intruders, and it will make us pay for being here.
Theres something unsettling about the Reactor. It feels like it's still alive, waiting for something.
This place is so quiet, and creepy.
Ever wondered what kinds of stuff we can find in those buildings?
Watch your step, a friend of mine once told me about old forgotten mines lying around.
Monolith squads roam the area in the north, they come from the Deserted Hospital.
The mercenaries are having a hard time holding the road to Dead City.
I have a feeling that one day the Monolith will seize control over the whole city.
The silence here is unsettling... its like the citys holding its breath, waiting for something.
Its strange, isnt it? Once bustling streets, now just empty shells of what they were.
Theres something about those old buildings... they seem to watch us, like theyre waiting for us to make a mistake.
Something about this place feels like its stuck in time. Like no ones ever really left.
The Monoliths presence is heavy here. Its like theyre trying to turn this place into their own twisted sanctuary.
I dont trust the mercenaries in this area. Theyre too quiet, too desperate. Somethings off.
Ive heard rumors about hidden weapons caches in the ruins of this place. Too bad theyre guarded by nightmares.
The fog here feels different. Its like its alive, creeping around like its part of the citys twisted heartbeat.
Watch out for the southern roads, theres been talk of more mutants gathering near the outskirts. Not sure whats driving them.
Dont get too comfortable in the buildings. Theres a rumor that some of the floors are unstablebetter keep an eye out for any weak spots.
The zone is full of old ghosts, but this place? Feels like the dead never really left. They just changed form.
Its hard to tell whats worsethe Monolith or the monsters lurking around. But one things for sure: this place isnt safe.
Every time we pass by this area, I cant shake the feeling that were being watched, that the city itself is alive somehow.
Even the air in Limansk feels wrong. Its thick, like its been tainted by years of suffering. Keep your wits about you.
Zombies wander around the area, it's called Dead City after all.
I wonder if we can find anything good inside those buildings.
The situation here is tense, mercs and bandits are known for fighting each others over the mid area.
The main base for the mercs is here, usually they don't allow outsiders to wander near their hideout.
The statue of Lenin is bigger than what I imagined.
Mercs took control over the sports centre. Bandits got the old school.
You know, the city was stripped of most of its valuables. Now it's an empty shell of its former self.
My friend told me about a tunnel system beneath the city, a whole grid connects every building around.
It's strange, isn't it? The city feels like its still alive, even though its been abandoned for years.
The silence here is deafening. Its almost like the city itself is waiting for something to happen.
Those zombies arent the only ones to watch out for. Ive seen some strange things lurking around these buildings.
Some say the citys cursed. I wouldnt be surprised, not after all the stories Ive heard.
The Mercs think they own this place, but the Bandits arent going down without a fight. This could turn ugly real quick.
Ive heard rumors about the old government facility near here. No one whos gone inside has come back to tell the tale.
Im not a fan of this place. Too many eyes watching us, too many things moving in the shadows.
There are stories of people disappearing in this city. Maybe its the zombies, maybe something else Who knows?
Its eerie how calm the city is. Like the calm before a storm... or something worse.
Look at those old buildings. Hard to believe they were once bustling with life. Now, theyre nothing but tombs.
The zombie horde doesnt scare me as much as the silence. Something about it just feels... wrong.
We need to watch our backs. The mercs are playing a dangerous game here, and they dont take kindly to trespassers.
Be careful with the tunnels. They might have been useful once, but theyve become a deathtrap for anyone who doesnt know the way.
I can feel the psi-waves already.
The Miracle Machine exists somewhere around here. It's quite dangerous to get in range.
I don't wanna be zombies' soup today, let's keep moving.
