When someone mentions Yantar, the first two things that come to my mind are zombies and snorks.
You can try to make your way to Dead City from here, but local mutants may not like it.
Yantar wasn't always a swampy, desolate place you know. A long time ago it was a large lake.
The infamous Lab X-16 is right beneath us, and I don't feel really comfortable about knowing that...
Sometime after the Zone's appearance, Yantar was chosen as a prime location for the mobile science lab...\nNot the best decision if you ask me.
Hearing stories about the massive zombie waves over here, the psi-emitter is probably bigger than what I imagined.
Watch your step, were near the heart of the anomaly field. A wrong move, and we might be vaporized.
Do you hear that? Its like a low hum, but its coming from everywhere. I dont trust it.
The research station here has seen more than its fair share of horrors. Who knows what the scientists unleashed...
This place was supposed to be a sanctuary for scientists, but its a prison for anyone unlucky enough to wander in.
Theres something... off about the air here. Like its thick with secrets, and not the good kind.
The zombies here... theyre different. Something about them feels more aware, almost like theyre watching us.
Yantar used to be a bustling town, but now its a graveyard. I can almost feel the screams echoing in the wind.
I dont care how many artifacts are here. This place is cursed. Id rather take my chances elsewhere.
The old military outposts in this area? Dont bother. The mutants have claimed them, and the stories dont end well for anyone who tries to reclaim them.
Ever wonder how many souls are trapped in this place? The lab experiments didnt go well... not by a long shot.
If we make it out of here, itll be a damn miracle. It feels like this place is alive, and its waiting for something or someone.
You think youve seen all the horrors the Zone has to offer? Wait until you see whats lurking around Yantars underground labs.
Ive heard rumors about the things still alive in the underground research areas. No one comes back the same, if they come back at all.
I wonder if there are actual bloodsuckers in that abandoned village... On a second thought, never mind.
Those anarchists roam the area, heard they had a hard time defending the Barrier from Monolith forces, heh.
I would keep my ass away from that village if I were you.
The Warehouses are bigger than I expected them to be. Freedom picked an ideal spot for their headquarters.
Freedom kicked the remaining military units out of here after the big emission, they stormed this place and occupied the area.
Mercs usually control the north-eastern outpost, but they never go further than that.
The farm at the northern side is a nice place to hide, only if there's no other squad over there.
Duty usually send their scouts to the farm on that hill.
Watch your head when you cross the village, Burnt Fuzz anomalies are quite common there.
Comet anomalies usually roam the village. It's normal to find fried stalkers lying around the place.
The military's presence here is always heavy, but even they can't control the chaos the Zone brings.
The Warehouses are starting to feel like a warzone. I dont envy Freedoms position, theyve got their hands full with Monolith and mercs.
Even the best-trained soldiers cant deal with what the Zone throws at them. Dont get too cocky out here.
Did you know the military used to patrol this area like it was their own? Now, its just a battleground for anyone willing to fight.
If you ever think about running into that village at dusk, remember that the shadows might not be as empty as they seem.
The old base to the west? Its been abandoned for years. A ghost of the militarys past. Wonder what secrets it hides.
Youd think the military would have learned by now, but every time they try to push deeper, something worse shows up.
They say some of the old equipment in the warehouse still works. I wouldnt trust it, though. The Zone corrupts everything.
Freedom's presence here is a reminder that the Zone doesnt belong to any one faction. Its everyones battleground.
The village? Stay out of there. Last time I checked, it was a bloodbath waiting to happen, with anomalies all around.
If youre looking to make a name for yourself, dont mess with the mercs at the north. Theyve got a reputation for a reason.
That old church? Bandits are always trying to claim it, but it never stays quiet for long. Something about that place just attracts trouble.
Ever notice how even the trees seem to be dead in the military outposts? Like the Zone itself is trying to strangle any hope.
The farms a decent hideout... when its not crawling with rival squads. Don't expect to find peace for long.
Be careful, this place is quite dangerous.
Snorks and poltergeists are quite common around here, keep your eyes open.
Stalkers found rare artefacts here. The underground tunnel is known for nice artefacts, but the amount of Electro anomalies there will change your mind.
The mercs are trying so hard to hold that outpost near the tunnel, but they don't always win.
Some of the worst mutants inhabit the mid area, I heard horrific stories about stalkers dying over here...
The tunnel leading to Yantar has Burners and Comets anomalies, basically a big fucking oven!
Keep your eyes on the vehicles around, snorks usually hide between them.
Here you can find either valuable artefacts, or instant death.
Rostok might look calm, but the Zone always has a way of making you regret your next step.
Be mindful of the wild dogs around here. They're often in packs, and theyre not shy about attacking.
If you hear that eerie hum, get down low. Thats usually the signal for an Electro anomaly to activate.
Not even the local stalkers venture too far into the central part of Rostok. Too many unknowns lurking there.
The underground tunnels are crawling with mutants, but the loot... it's too tempting to pass up.
If you decide to head north, watch for the bandit ambushes. They love setting up on the outskirts of the old military base.
The locals used to talk about seeing shadows move on their own. Sometimes I think those stories werent just rumors.
Don't trust the silence. It's always too quiet here, and then suddenly, chaos breaks loose.
Theres an old bunker in this area. Last time I checked, it was swarming with Zombies. Steer clear unless you're ready to fight.
The abandoned vehicles around here tell a grim story... most of them belong to stalkers who never made it out.
Electro anomalies? Youll find them everywhere around here. But don't worry, well make it through.
I've seen a Snork tear apart a whole group of stalkers here. Don't think you can take them lightly.
The mutants around this part of Rostok are strange... they seem more aggressive than usual, like they're hunting something.
The road leading out of Rostok is littered with broken cars. I wonder how many stalkers met their end on that stretch.
Watch out for the Burners near the old gas station. One wrong move, and you'll be cooked alive.
If you see strange lights in the sky, it's not a rescue team. It's the Zone playing its tricks.
I've heard whispers of an old military stash hidden deep in the tunnels. But those who went looking for it never came back.
People say Rostok is cursed. I can see why. It's a place where even the toughest stalkers end up losing their minds.
Some say the best artefacts are found here, but I wouldn't be surprised if it's just the Zone's way of tempting us into danger.
The tunnels might seem like a shortcut, but the further you go, the worse it gets. Don't say I didn't warn you.
If you hear rustling in the bushes, dont assume it's a rabbit. It might be something worse, something watching us.
Theres something unsettling about Rostok... the wind howls like its crying for something lost long ago.
This place... it feels like the earth itself is alive, watching us. Stay sharp.
Rostoks roads are like gravesites for the unlucky. Be careful where you step, you never know what's buried underfoot.
The Zone's influence here is thick. Some of the stalkers claim they can hear voices in the wind. I dont think I want to find out.
Most of the buildings here have collapsed, but the twisted wreckage still hides threats. I wouldnt trust any of them.
Stay away from the old factory. Last time I passed by, I heard something big moving inside... but it wasnt human.
If you hear something scratch at the walls, don't turn around. It could be a Snork trying to get the drop on us.
Ive seen people lose their sanity around here. The Zone can mess with your head when you least expect it.
This place is a maze of rust and decay. If we get separated, dont expect to find each other easily.
Sometimes, I think the worst threat in Rostok isnt the mutants, but the other stalkers. Trust no one around here.
Theres a faint smell of burning around here. Could be the remnants of old anomalies or just the rotting ruins. Either way, stay alert.
Don't get too comfortable. Just when you think you've figured out Rostok, it throws something new and deadly at you.
I heard that Rostoks been the site of some unsanctioned experiments. Makes you wonder what they left behind.
The mercenaries here? They dont take kindly to strangers. Keep your head down if you want to avoid trouble.
Some say the mutant populations here are getting more aggressive. But the real danger might be the ones we can't see.
The airs thick here, almost like the Zone itself is pressing down on us. Cant be a good sign.
Keep an eye on the sky, the storm clouds here move strangely. You dont want to be caught in one of those lightning strikes.
Ive never understood whats so special about Rostok, but every time I come here, it feels like the Zone's grip tightens a little more.
What a creepy place.
A while ago, I've heard that a group of stalkers saw creepy creatures coming out from the lab around here. Sounds like a bad deal.
This place has always been gloomy.
There's supposed to be a lab somewhere around here...
Freedom used to control the place before the big emission. When they moved to the Army Warehouses, bandits took control here.
Lots of stalkers died here. This place is no joke.
A friend of mine once told me that Strelok used to have a hideout in the underground tunnels, I wonder what's left of it.
The Ukrainian military controls the area, but that didn't prevent stalkers from sticking around in the utility building.
Duty used to control the research institute before the big emission.
Let's stay out of the underground section, I heard stories about dangerous anomalies and nightmarish creatures flooding the tunnels.
This is one big messy place.
Stay away from the radioactive wastes, I don't want to lose my skin.
What are we doing in the Garbage anyway?
You can never guess what you can find in this graveyard.
Right after the Power Plant's reactor meltdown, whole heaps of radioactive waste were dumped here by the Ukrainian government.
This place swarms with rookie stalkers, with the occasional group of bandits loitering around, always on the lookout for rookies.
There are some artefacts to be found here, but most of them are just not worth the effort.
Loners and bandits are always trying to get their hands onto the best loot, most often leading to fighting and bloodshed.
Bandits have taken hold of the old train hangar for quite a long time now.
There's a Duty outpost to the north, on the path which leads to the Bar. They don't let everyone pass through.
The western side is quite dangerous. Mutants hide between the trees over there, waiting for the next free meal to come to them.
If you're looking for artefacts, your best pick would be the vehicle graveyard, or the radioactive swamp on the other side.
Garbage might be a junkyard, but it hides some serious dangers. Stay alert.
Don't be fooled by the peace and quiet. This place is crawling with threats, just waiting for the right moment to strike.
The old scrap yards here... some say theyre haunted by the souls of those who didnt make it out.
Looks like were walking through a graveyard of the Zones forgotten. Maybe thats why it feels so damn eerie.
Last time I was here, I ran into a group of rookies. They didnt last long. Be careful where you step.
If youre planning to search the scrapyard, better bring extra batteries. The mutants love to lurk in those dark corners.
Theres a reason this place is called Garbage. Its a dumping ground for both junk and death.
That building over there? It was once a supply depot, but now its just a tomb filled with the forgotten remnants of past stalkers.
Watch out for the toxic sludge. One wrong step and you could end up melting into the muck.
Bandits arent the only problem around here. You might run into a Snork or two if you wander too far into the swamp.
The place reeks of old radiation. If we stay here too long, I dont think either of us will make it out unscathed.
Im not a fan of the area near the railway. Bandits have set up ambushes there. Id recommend we keep our distance.
The garbage dump to the west? Thats where all the mutant nests are. Its not a place Id want to spend too much time in.
If you need help finding artefacts, I know the swampy south is crawling with anomalies. But be warned, its like a death trap there.
Its strange... youd think a place like this would be empty by now, but its still crawling with scavengers and things worse than them.
The air smells like metal and decay. This whole place feels like its slowly rotting from the inside out.
There's something off about the north side of the Garbage. Some say the radiation levels there are enough to fry your circuits.
The bandits here arent the type to negotiate. If they see us, they wont hesitate to open fire.
I've heard stories of stalkers making it rich in Garbage, but those who get greedy never seem to make it out.
The railway tracks are a mess of twisted metal. Theyre a constant reminder of what happens when everything goes wrong here.
Out in the swamps, theres a lot of strange electrical interference. Some say its the Zone playing tricks on us.
If you ever find yourself alone here, pray you dont run into the Bloodsuckers. They love this place.
Hey, wanna have a drink at 100 Rads?
Those freaking megaphones are so loud...
Every time I come in here, that stupid guard tells me to get out of here. Does that fucker think he owns the place or something?
That guard at 100 Rads is a good fella, he always welcomes me inside.
I need to buy some food and ammo from the Barkeep, hope his prices are reasonable.
Duty won't allow anyone go near their headquarters.
This place gives me the creeps, keep your eyes open and stick close.
Gotta be extra careful, all sorts of dangerous mutants dwell in this place.
It's easy to vanish without leaving a trace here, no matter how lucky you have been in life so far.
I wonder how's that old guy doing these days.
Anomalies are everywhere in the forest, watch your step.
The forest's gate witnessed heavy firefights between different factions. It was never a quiet place.
You may find some rare artefacts in the old mines, but you should know that few stalkers ever return from them.
The Symbiont anomaly lies deep within the forest. It looks like two giant claws.\nIf the rumours are true, it holds all sorts of artefacts inside its core.
Freedom from the south, Monolith from Radar, bandits at the bridge, stalkers near Forester's tower.\nA usual day in the Red Forest.
The trees here seem to whisper in the wind. Its like they know something we dont.
Last time I was here, a group of mercs disappeared without a trace. No one really knows what happened to them.
The forest's heart is cursed. Anyone who ventures too deep usually finds themselves caught in a deadly trap of anomalies.
If you hear a sound, dont assume it's just a bird or the wind. In the Red Forest, everything has a way of turning on you.
Ive heard strange stories about a forest spirit that roams these woods. Some say its just a myth, but Im not so sure.
The old research station up ahead was abandoned in a hurry. If youre lucky, you might find something useful, but be prepared for anything.
Out here, even the ground can betray you. Watch for sinkholes, they can swallow a man whole before you even notice.
Can we stay away from this place...
I have a bad feeling about this.
We are crossing the red line, are you sure about what you're doing?
It's easy to vanish without a trace here, no matter how lucky you have been in life so far.
Whoever gets close to the Brain Scorcher immediately goes insane, turns into a zombie and starts stalking the Zone restlessly...
Is visiting this place your greatest idea?!
I'm a bit nervous...
Monolith squads may show up any second now.
The road is patrolled by Monolith forces and the forest is inhabited by the worst kinds of mutants. It's a suicide either way.
Rare artefacts lie deep in the forest. Good luck reaching them.
Watch out! Those vehicles are highly irradiated, keep your distance.
I can hear voices inside my head...
This place is cursed, I can feel it in my bones. Ive seen too many good men lose their sanity here.
If you get close enough to the Brain Scorcher, youll hear it whispering to you. Id rather not find out what its saying.
Theres something off about this place. Its like the Zone itself is watching us, waiting for a mistake.
Monolith doesnt tolerate trespassers, and their patrols are relentless. We might not get out of here alive if were not careful.
This is the heart of the Zone, my friend. Many have come here looking for answers, but all theyve found is death.
There are stories about people going mad from just being near the Brain Scorcher. I hope youre ready for that risk.
Be ready to fight or run. Monolith doesnt spare anyone, and those mutants wont stop until were nothing but corpses.
Ive heard whispers about a hidden bunker in the Radar. If its true, wed need to be extra cautious. It could be a trap.
The road here is littered with the remains of past explorers. Dont become one of them.
Strange things happen to people here. The farther you go, the less youre sure of whats real.
I can feel the radiation creeping up on us. This place isnt just dangerousits cursed.
The Zone knows were here. Ive never been so sure of anything in my life. Lets get what we came for and leave.
The Monolith forces are everywhere, but there are rumours of an even darker presence. Something worse than them, lurking in the shadows.
Monolith claims to be invincible, but they dont know whats waiting for them beyond the Brain Scorcher. Its not just us they should fear.
I... I can't believe my eyes... we made it to the centre!
I'm still alive...
The centre of the Zone... the Chernobyl Nuclear Power Plant is lying right in front of us...
We made it...
After all this time, the Power Planet itself...
The centre... we've finally made it to the centre...
I have never been this nervous in my whole life...
What an empty place, quite depressing actually.
I wonder if we can find anything good inside those buildings.
This used to be a town built for engineers working at the Chernobyl NPP.
What used to be a booming city once is a ghost town now, with mutants and zombies as its only residents.
I've heard that one of those creepy labs is somewhere around here.
Laundromat became a hideout for stalkers.
This bloody place confuses me... where was the entrance we came from?!
The Monolith used to have a psi-emitter in that school, it's broken now.
Department and grocery stores are nearby, wanna go shopping?
The hospital is probably the biggest building around here. Monolith squads might be hiding in there.
All kinds of creatures roam this big area.
I wonder what's inside that big factory.
Heard once that Jupiter was Strelok's preferred area to operate within the Zone.
Freedom managed to take control over the station, after all.
Jupiter is known for having all sorts of mutants around.
This area used to be an active train station before the accident.
My friend told me some stories about the Jupiter factory. He said that many merc and bandit squads vanished there without a trace...
Do you believe stories about the Oasis?
The rail tunnels are known for being inhabited by creepy mutants, mostly groups of burers. Honestly, I would steer clear from them.
The cooling tower offers one hell of a view. People say that spooky distorted radio transmissions can be heard while passing by.
Kopachy village near the cooling tower is swarming with zombies, not to mention the high radiation levels.
Some stalkers found Soul artefacts in the Concrete Bath Anomaly near the factory, I should check that out too.
See the substation workshops over there? The "Quarry" Anomaly is in the middle, right in the swamp. You'll turn into a skeleton in a matter of seconds if you fall into it.
A few years ago, the Ukrainian Military was investigating helicopter crash sites here. There's one in the factory if I'm not mistaken.
You can go through the abandoned underground tunnels to reach the outskirts of Pripyat. Not a bad choice if you want to avoid going through the city's centre.
You can see the whole area if you climb up the old cement factory. It's a perfect spot for sniping.
They say that the Oasis lies beneath the ventilation complex.

Many people talk about the wonderful Oasis, but it seems that nobody has ever seen it. One of our guys said it's like healing waters. If you walk in, your wounds heal and your energy is replenished...
Bandits hide in the container warehouse because it's a remote location.
I'm not a fan of swampy areas, but this one isn't that bad.
You can find all kind of artefacts here.. and anomalies... and mutants..... Let's just keep moving.
I think I caught bugs in my ass, and staying in this swampy place isn't helping it.
The stalkers at the Skadovsk kicked the bandits out a long time ago.
Zaton is also called "Backwater"... makes sense.
Those rusty ships can save your ass once an unexpected blowout hits.
The trucks on the Preobrazhensky Bridge might contain some forgotten valuables, I should check that out later.
Mercs still hold the waste processing station. They don't allow outsiders to pass through.
Have you seen the Sawmill before? It's usually empty, maybe a few zombies are roaming around.
I heard that many stalkers vanished while exploring the Krug Antenna Complex to the west, better stay away from it...
There's a guy called Noah nearby, my friend told me he tamed a pseudodog! I won't believe him until I see that myself.
Watch out when you go near the fuelling station. Many mutants hide there, and they're usually hungry.
The Claw anomaly here in Zaton is probably the biggest of its kind, not to mention all the goodies inside. But be aware of the snorks flooding the caves nearby.
Ever wondered how the Scar anomaly got carved? Just look at it through your PDA's map.
The Circus anomaly has got a fitting name, getting an artefact from there requires constant jumping. Don't forget to bring a good SEVA suit.
You might find an Electro in the Iron Forest anomaly. Be careful though, poltergeists are waiting for careless stalkers.
Your name is $name, right? You're new around here or something?
$name?... I don't recall you, you're new here?
You haven't spent much time in the Zone, right $name? Seems like it.
Feels good to join a guy who knows what he's doing, $name.
Your name is $name? My PDA says you have quite the experience, glad to have your company.
You're $name?! I heard a lot about your adventures back at our campfire last night. My friends said you're one of the few who survived a while in the Zone.
You're $name, right?! My friends said you're a real veteran.
$name?! People say you're a real hero. Maybe I can learn from your experience.
I can't believe it... the living legend, $name himself!
The legendary $name?! I feel blessed already.
Is this real... It's $name! You have my utmost respect.
You're $name? I've heard that you did some bad shit...
You're $name? You've got quite the "reputation" around here.
$name? I think I've heard about you, some people are quite angry due to your actions.
People say you fucked up big time, $name. What have you done exactly?
$name... I don't recall your name.
Your reputation seems fine enough, $name.
$name, you seem like a nice guy. Are you new around here?
My PDA doesn't show much info about you $name. That's a good thing, I suppose.
You're $name right? I've heard good stuff about you the other day, keep it up.
Your name is $name? I've heard that you help stalkers around, that's so nice of you.
$name? I heard about you the other day, you've got a good reputation among stalkers.
I think I heard about you, $name. My friends said you're good at what you're doing.
People say that you're a man of your word, $name. I'm glad to join your team.
Oh! $what! Right in time to get patched up.
$what. Not too bad. It's hard to find supplies like this lying around.
Who's buying medical supplies for the best available prices? I've got $what, and I don't have much use for it.
Goddammit $what! I got this for triple the price from some trader the other day.
$what! Finally! Time to heal up.
Found $what. Should I sell it? Or just take it for myself...?
Hey! Didn't one of you almost kick the bucket a second ago? Will $what be of any help?
Let's see what we got here... $what! Nice! That'll be of use.
Found some $what stashed in an old backpack. Feels like striking gold in the Zone.
Picked up $what from a trader. Paid through the nose for it, but at least Ill survive another day.
$what, huh? Zone's way of telling me not to die just yet.
Got some $what from a stash in the middle of nowhere. Someone mustve been planning ahead.
Stumbled across $what in a mutant den. Risky grab, but its worth it.
$what in the middle of a radioactive pit? Either Im crazy, or Im desperate. Probably both.
Managed to grab some $what off a fallen stalker. Not proud of it, but survival comes first.
Finally found some $what! Thats one less problem to worry about.
Traded my last pack of smokes for $what. Lets hope it was a fair deal.
$what! Didnt think Id get this lucky today. Or maybe the Zones just setting me up for something worse.
Got some $what from a trader who said its top quality. The Zone and quality dont exactly mix.
Found $what in a rusted first aid kit. Lets hope its still good.
Picked up some $what near an anomaly. Almost lost my arm for it, but its better than bleeding out.
Scored some $what in a bunker. Looks legit, but Ill test it first before trusting it.
$what? Out here? Either someones careless, or someones baiting me.
Grabbed $what from a bandit stash. They wont be needing it anymore.
Got $what, but it looks like its been sitting in the Zone for years. Hope its still usable.
Found some $what hidden under a floorboard. The Zone hides its treasures well.
Some $what just fell into my lap. Literally. The Zone has a strange sense of humor.
Got a stash of $what from a loner. They said its good as new, but well see about that.
$what! If the Zone had a loyalty program, Id be a platinum member by now.
Traded some ammo for $what. Hope I dont end up needing that ammo anytime soon.
Found $what in a crate marked with weird symbols. The Zones version of a mystery box, I guess.
Grabbed some $what off a trader who said, No refunds. Classic Zone guarantees.
Found $what in a destroyed lab. Might be cursed, but Im willing to risk it.
Got $what in exchange for a broken artifact. Feels like I just scammed someone for once.
Picked up some $what from a dead mutants stash. How does that even make sense?
$what in my hands means one less trip to the afterlife. Thanks, Zone... I think.
Scored $what in a supply drop. Almost lost it to a pack of dogs, though.
Found $what stashed in an old train car. The Zone always surprises me.
Got my hands on $what. Feels like the Zone just decided to cut me a break.
Picked up some $what in the middle of a thunderstorm. The Zone really makes you work for it.
Found $what inside a mutants den. Im questioning every decision that led me here.
Found some $what in a locker marked emergency use only. Guess this qualifies as an emergency.
Grabbed $what from an old military stash. Probably expired, but still better than bleeding out.
Picked up $what while scavenging in a hospital ruin. The Zone doesnt care about clean environments.
Found $what near an anomaly. Looks intact, but Im not trusting it just yet.
$what... finally! The Zones version of a first aid kit is a rare sight.
Got my hands on $what from a trader. He said its fresh, but the Zones definition of fresh worries me.
Found $what in a safe that took me an hour to crack. Worth the trouble? Time will tell.
Picked up $what in the middle of a firefight. Dodging bullets for bandages feels like peak Zone life.
Grabbed some $what from a crashed helicopter. Guess it didnt help the last guy.
Found $what wrapped in plastic. Looks sterile, but Zone tricks run deep.
Got $what from a trader who claimed it was artifact enhanced. Sounds like a scam, but here we are.
Stumbled on $what tucked into a hidden compartment in a bunker. Someone was trying to keep this safe.
$what in the middle of a swamp? Either its a blessing, or Im walking into a trap.
Picked up $what off a dead merc. One mans loss is another mans lifesaver.
Found $what in a backpack with bloodstains on it. Gruesome, but Ill take it.
Traded an artifact for $what. Feels like a bad deal, but at least Im alive to regret it.
Grabbed $what from a stash someone tried to bury. Zone secrets dont stay hidden for long.
$what inside a mutants lair? Thats gotta be the strangest find Ive made yet.
Got some $what thats stamped Do Not Use After 2005. Guess Ill be the test subject.
Found $what near a collapsed bridge. The Zone always leaves breadcrumbs for survivors.
Traded my last medkit for $what. Feels like swapping one hope for another.
Picked up $what from an old train car. Dusty, but probably still usable.
Got $what from a trader who swore it was military issue. Lets see if its worth the price.
Found $what near a campfire that had gone cold. Whoever left it mustve been in a hurry.
Scored some $what while looting a deserted checkpoint. Feels like a jackpot in this wasteland.
Found some $what in a bloodstained satchel. Looks like someone didnt get to use it in time.
$what from an old stash buried in the dirt. A little dusty, but itll do the job.
Got $what after clearing out a mutant nest. I earned this the hard way.
Picked up $what near a burned-out vehicle. Hope it hasnt expired, or worse, been tampered with.
Grabbed some $what thats still sealed. Feels like I just found treasure.
Scored $what from a military cache. Lets hope I dont need it too soon.
$what from a loner who didnt look like they had much use for it anymore.
Found some $what in an old medkit. A little frayed around the edges, but still usable.
Got $what from a stash marked with strange symbols. Lets hope this stuff doesnt carry a curse.
Traded some grenades for $what. Not sure if it was worth it, but Ill take my chances.
Found $what in the back of an abandoned APC. Mustve been left in a hurry.
$what from an old stash hidden behind a fake wall. Someone went to a lot of trouble to hide this.
Got $what from a trader who swore its the real deal. Zone guarantees arent exactly comforting.
Picked up $what after looting a bandit camp. They wont miss it now.
Grabbed some $what that looks ancient, but its all Ive got. Lets hope it still works.
Found $what near a pile of wreckage. Either a lucky find or a bad omen.
$what from an old crate marked with medical insignias. Hope its not just a decoy.
Got $what after sifting through an anomaly zone. Risky, but worth it.
Picked up $what that still has a faint chemical smell. Probably safe... probably.
Scored $what from a supply drop. Nearly got ambushed for it, but here I am.
Found $what in an abandoned checkpoint. Feels like a gift from whoever was stationed here.
Got some $what, if anyone needs it... I need to lose some weight.
$what from an artifact hunters stash. Guess they wont need it anymore.
Picked up $what from an overturned truck. Feels like someones bad luck turned into my good fortune.
Found some $what hidden inside a hollowed-out log. The Zone always has its secrets.
Grabbed $what that looks suspiciously clean.
Traded a broken detector for $what. Fair trade? Well that broken detector isn't gonna be saving my ass.
Got $what from a bunker that smelled like death..
Found $what that had been taped under a table. Someone was desperate to hide it.
Scored $what while scavenging a ruined factory. Looks legit enough to use.
$what from an old loner who just wanted some vodka in return. I didnt argue.
Got $what after searching a downed helicopter. Time to finally patch up.
Picked up $what that came with a note. It just says, Dont trust it. Great.
$what. Not too bad. It's hard to find food like this lying around.
Who wants to buy rations for the best available price? I've got some $what, and I don't have much use for it.
Goddammit... $what! I got this for triple the price from some trader the other day.
$what! Finally! Time to munch.
Oh! Found some $what! About damn time.
Found $what. Should I sell it? Or just take it for myself ?
Hey! Just found some chub for anyone who needs it! Will $what be of any help?
$what. Yeah. I've had better days.
$what! Great! My stomach's been rumbling...
Found some $what in a stash. Might be old, but it'll do.
Not the best $what, but when hunger hits, it'll taste like a feast.
Another day, another $what. Its all I can find these days.
Well, look what I found. Some decent $what. Couldve sworn the Zone didnt have much left.
Got my hands on some $what, but I wouldn't call it a delicacy by any means.
I found some $what near the old train tracks. Could be worse, could be better.
Just scored some $what! Better than starving, I suppose.
$what... better than nothing, I guess. The Zone's not exactly a five-star restaurant.
Look what I found! Some old $what. Who's willing to trade for it?
Found some $what in the ruins. It's not much, but it's something.
Not sure if this $what is safe to eat, but it's either that or nothing.
Well, here's some $what. Hope it's still good... but in this place, who knows?
Found $what. Haven't had a good meal in days, so I'll take it.
Some $what, huh? It'll keep me from going hungry for a while, at least.
I got some $what, but I don't think it'll go far. Got anything to trade?
Found some old $what. Not sure if its safe, but Im too hungry to care.
Ugh, this $what looks sketchy. But, I suppose it's better than starving to death.
Just grabbed some $what from a stash. It's been sitting there for who knows how long.
Well, I found some $what. Let's see if its still edible...
Picked up some $what. Its not much, but Ive had worse in this damn Zone.
Found some $what! It's not the best, but I'll take whatever I can get these days.
Not exactly the freshest $what, but in this hellhole, its all weve got.
Its no banquet, but I found some $what. Cant complain.
Picked up some $what from a trader. Not great, but better than nothing.
Got some $what... Its not the tastiest, but itll keep me going.
Found some $what lying around. Better than starving, thats for sure.
Some $what to fill my stomach, but don't get your hopes up for a decent meal.
Heres some $what. Probably not the best stuff, but at least its not radioactive... yet.
Found some $what thats a bit stale. I guess the Zone doesnt care about expiration dates.
Got some $what off a trader. Its a bit overpriced, but what else can you do in this place?
Just got my hands on some $what. Dont know if its safe, but Im hungry.
I found some $what. Its not a feast, but it'll get me by for now.
Got a nice stash of $what here. Its not gourmet, but it'll fill the gap.
Picked up some $what. I hope its not been sitting out too long.
Some $what... I wonder if its even safe to eat. Ah, well, cant let it go to waste.
I just found some $what, but its not exactly fresh. Still, better than nothing.
Got a little bit of $what. Not the best meal, but it's something.
Found some $what in an old stash. Should I take a chance and eat it, or just sell it?
Finally! $what! My stomach was about to turn on me.
Ugh, more $what. Im getting tired of this stuff, but its all I can find.
Well, look at that! Some $what! At least it's not irradiated... yet.
Stumbled across some $what. Doesnt smell too bad, so I guess its dinner.
Got some $what from a stash. Its a gamble, but hungers a stronger enemy.
Found a pack of $what. Hope it doesnt bite back.
Managed to scavenge some $what. Not much, but itll keep me going.
Just picked up some $what. Its a rare find these days.
Ive got some $what. Its not going to win any awards, but its edible... I think.

Found $what lying around. Hopefully, its not a trap.
Some $what made its way into my pack. Zone gods must like me today.
Look what Ive got$what! Bet someones jealous now.
Picked up some $what on my last run. Not exactly luxury, but it works.
Traded for some $what earlier. Lets hope its worth what I paid.
Got some $what in my stash now. Looks like I wont starve today.
Found $what, but its seen better days. Beggars cant be choosers.
Stocked up on $what. Lets hope this lasts for a while.
Found some $what during my last sweep. Not bad, considering the Zones usual offerings.
Scored some $what from Sidorovich. Might regret this later, but for now, its food.
Someone left some $what behind. Their loss, my gain.
Ran into some $what in the Zone. Im going to call this a win.
Just grabbed some $what. Its not much, but its better than nothing.
Got some $what today. Id share, but theres not enough for both of us.
Tracked down some $what. The Zone must be feeling generous.
Lucky day! Found some $what in an old stash. Hope its still good.
Stumbled on some $what during my patrol. Small miracles in the Zone.
Got a bit of $what from a loner. Sometimes, the Zone surprises you.
Picked up some $what in a supply run. Its not fresh, but Ill take it.

Got my hands on some $what. Lets hope it doesnt fight back.

Say goodbye to your squad!|Funny, I was about to say the same to you.

Youll pay for that!|With what? Monopoly money?

If only the fire could cook up some optimism.|Or at least a decent meal.
The fires mesmerizing... almost enough to make you forget the horrors waiting out there.|Almost, but not quite.
Id kill for a guitar right now. Or, you know, not kill. Just borrow.|Good luck finding one thats in tune.
The fires a little too big... lets hope it doesnt attract any unwanted visitors.|Big fire, big risk.
If the Zone had a heart, itd look like this fire. Warm, but cruel.|Cruelty is all it knows.
Feels like this fires the only thing keeping the night from swallowing us whole.|Dont let it go out.
The fires nice, but the company could use some improvement.|Careful, youre part of the company.
Something about the firelight makes even the ugliest mutant seem poetic.|Id rather not see poetry in a bloodsucker.
This fires a beacon of hope... or a deathtrap, depending on who sees it first.|Lets hope its friendly eyes.
The fire doesnt judge, it just burns. Too bad the Zone cant take a hint.|The Zone thrives on judgment.
Fires warm, but it wont keep the nightmares away.|Not much will.
Sometimes the fire feels like its staring back. Must be the heat getting to me.|Or the Zone playing tricks again.
If you listen closely, the fires crackle almost sounds like laughter. Creepy, huh?|Only if it starts talking back.
This fires perfect for stories, but nobodys in the mood to talk.|The Zone kills stories before they start.
They say fire purifies. Lets hope it purifies the air, too.|Good luck with that in this place.
If the fire keeps burning, Ill keep surviving.|Solid plan, for now.
The fires beautiful, but the Zone doesnt care about beauty.|It doesnt care about anything.
Every spark from the fire feels like a defiance against the dark.|A small defiance, but it counts.
The fires warm, but my thoughts are colder than ever.|Welcome to the Zone, friend.
If I close my eyes, the fire almost feels like home. Almost.|Dont close them too long.
Careful feeding the fire. Last thing we need is to set ourselves ablaze.|Id rather not be a stalker barbecue.
This fires the best thing to happen all day... which says a lot.|The bars low out here.
This fires crackling like its alive. Maybe its got a story to tell.|Lets hope it doesnt include how we end up.
The fires warm, but its the only thing that feels alive tonight.|Better than the alternativebeing too alive for the mutants.
I lit this fire with one match. Who says Im not a pro?|A pro at wasting resources, maybe.
The flames dance like theyre mocking us. Or maybe theyre cheering us on.|Either way, theyre better company than mutants.
Feels like the fires hiding something in its light. Cant shake the feeling.|Or maybe its revealing whats out there.
Every fire I light feels like a little rebellion against the Zone.|Just dont let the Zone win this one.
The fires warmth reminds me of home. But homes a long way from here.|Too far, if you ask me.
Even the smallest flame can feel like hope. Funny how desperate weve become.|Desperations just another part of survival.
This fires too small to cook anything decent. Unless were talking mutant kebabs.|Pass me a snork skewer, then.
The fires bright, but the darkness feels endless.|The darks only endless if you let it be.
Were just shadows around a fire, waiting for something worse to find us.|Thats the most optimistic thing Ive heard all day.
Cant decide if the fires comforting or just a distraction from whats out there.|Either way, Im not complaining.
The fires nice, but what I wouldnt give for a cold drink right now.|Good luck finding anything cold out here.
The flames flicker like theyre nervous. Maybe they know something we dont.|I dont need the fire to remind me to be nervous.
If this fire goes out, were just another part of the dark.|Then lets make sure it doesnt go out.
The fires bright, but its the shadows that make you feel alive.|Alive and terrified, sure.
This fires like a temporary truce with the Zone. It wont last.|Truces never do out here.
The flames are hypnotic, but I cant let my guard down.|Not unless you want to meet a mutant up close.
Staring into this fire feels like staring into the past. Too bad the futures still waiting.|Dont get stuck in either one.
This fires a reminder that not everything in this place wants to kill you.|But most of it does, so stay sharp.
The fires small, but it feels bigger than the rest of the night.|Lets keep it that way.
If only this fire could keep the nightmares away, too.|You cant burn away whats already inside.
The flames are soothing, but the howling in the distance isnt.|Time to appreciate the calm while it lasts.
This fire feels like a stolen moment. Like were taking something the Zone didnt want us to have.|Take it anyway.
The fires warm, but it wont keep the horrors from creeping in.|Its all about keeping them at bay for now.
Ive seen fires like this burn out too quickly. Lets not let it happen here.|Ill keep an eye on the woodpile.
The crackle of the fire almost drowns out the whispers of the Zone.|Almost isnt enough.
Even in this place, a fire feels like a tiny victory.|Its one worth celebrating.
The firelights dancing, but the shadows are winning.|Lets not let them win completely.
Theres something poetic about a fire in a place like this. Too bad Im not a poet.|Stick to surviving, then.
This fires the closest thing weve got to a beacon of hope.|Lets keep it burning.
The fires crackling, but its the silence thats the loudest.|Silence out here is never a good thing.
The flames feel alive, like theyre trying to tell us something.|Lets hope its not a warning.
The fires warm, but I keep thinking about whats lurking in the dark.|Nothing good, thats for sure.
I miss the days when a fire meant comfort, not survival.|Survivals all that matters now.
This fires nice, but I cant stop glancing over my shoulder.|Cant let your guard down, not even for a second.
The fires crackling like it knows a secret.|Lets hope its a good one.
If this fire had a voice, itd probably tell us to run.|Too bad theres nowhere to run to.
Sparks are flying everywhere. Just like my nerves.|Better keep those nerves steady out here.
The fire feels safe, but its also a beacon for everything that isnt.|Just one more thing to keep an eye on.
Funny how the fire makes you feel alive while everything else out here wants you dead.|A little irony keeps us sane, I guess.
The flames are mesmerizing, but I cant afford to get lost in them.|Getting lost out here is a death sentence.
The warmth is nice, but the light feels like a target.|Cant have one without the other, can we?
Its almost peaceful by the fire, but peace never lasts.|Out here, it never does.
The fires bright, but it casts long shadows. Those shadows make me uneasy.|They should.
This fires keeping us warm, but it wont keep the monsters away.|Thats our job.
If the fire goes out, were back to the real nightmare.|Then dont let it go out.
The flames are calming, but theyre not enough to drown out the screams in my head.|Thats why we keep moving.
This fire feels like the only thing holding the darkness back.|Lets make sure it keeps doing its job.
Funny how something as simple as fire can make you feel almost human again.|Almost.
The fires steady, but my nerves arent.|Thats the Zone for you.
This fires a small victory, but its the only one weve had today.|Small victories are still victories.
The flames dance like theyre mocking us.|They probably are.
This fires the closest thing weve got to hope.|And hopes a rare thing out here.
The fires bright, but the night feels endless.|It always does.
This fire feels like its fighting the darkness for us.|At least something is.
The flames are strong, but they cant burn away my fear.|Fears just another part of surviving.
This fires a brief moment of comfort in a place that knows none.|Take it while you can.
The fire feels alive, like its trying to tell us something.|Lets hope its not a warning.
The flames are bright, but the dark is stronger.|Thats why weve got each other.
The fires steady, but the winds picking up. Better keep an eye on it.|Ill grab more wood.
The fires warm, but it wont last forever.|Nothing does out here.
Staring into the flames almost makes me forget where we are.|Almost.
The fires crackling, but its the silence that worries me.|Silence out here is never good.
The flames are comforting, but theyre also a reminder of how fragile we are.|Fragile doesnt mean broken.
The fires alive, but so is the dark.|Lets make sure the fire stays stronger.
This fires our only friend tonight.|Better keep it burning.
The flames flicker like theyre trying to whisper something.|Maybe they know more than we do.
The fires warm, but it wont fend off a bloodsucker.|Thats what the shotguns for.
The firelight dances, but the shadows keep creeping closer.|Keep an eye on those shadows.
This fires the only thing keeping the chill out of my bones.|Lets hope its enough.
The flames are steady, unlike anything else in this cursed place.|Ill take the stability where I can.
The fires crackling, but it sounds more like laughter tonight.|Whos laughing, the fire or the Zone?
Staring into the flames is the closest thing to peace well get.|Dont stare too long, though.
The fires bright, but I swear I saw something moving just beyond the light.|You sure it wasnt your imagination?
This fire feels like a fragile lifeline.|Fragile doesnt mean weak.
The flames are alive, but they cant burn away the tension.|Thats what keeps us sharp.
Every crackle of the fire feels like a heartbeat.|Lets make sure it keeps beating.
The fires warm, but the darkness is still cold.|Colds better than dead.
The flames feel like a reminder of what were fighting for.|Survivals a hell of a fight.
The fires steady, but Im not. Too much has happened today.|Take a moment, then get ready for tomorrow.
The flames are comforting, but I cant shake the feeling of being watched.|Youre not imagining it.
This fires the only thing standing between us and the abyss.|Then lets keep it alive.
The fires warmth is fleeting, but its enough to keep me going.|Thats all we need, right?
The flames flicker like theyre struggling against the dark.|Just like the rest of us.
The fires bright, but it casts long shadows.|Shadows always have something to hide.
The flames dance like theyre alive, but theyre not our friends.|At least theyre not our enemies.
The fire feels alive, but it cant protect us.|Thats up to us.
The warmth feels real, but everything else out here doesnt.|The Zone has a way of making reality bend.
The fires steady, but Im not sure I trust it.|Better than trusting nothing.
The flames are bright, but the dark feels endless.|The dark always feels endless.
This fires the closest thing to hope weve had in days.|Hopes worth holding onto.
The fires alive, but so is the danger out there.|Well handle it, like always.
The flames are warm, but theyre also a reminder of how cold it is out here.|Were still standing, though.
The firelight flickers like its scared of the dark.|Maybe it should be.
This fire feels like a small rebellion against the night.|Then lets make it count.
The flames are steady, but they cant burn away the fear.|Fear keeps us alive.
The fires bright, but it feels like the dark is winning.|Not tonight it isnt.
The flames dance, but theyre not telling us everything.|What else is new?
This fire feels like a luxury we dont deserve.|Out here, we take what we can get.
The fires steady, but I cant shake the thought of who might be watching us.|Paranoias just survival with better branding.
Every spark feels like a heartbeat in the dark.|Lets keep the heart beating.
The warmths a lie; it cant last.|Lies are better than the cold truth sometimes.
Even a fire feels fragile out here.|Fragility doesnt mean its weak.
This fires the closest thing to safety weve got.|Then we better guard it well.
The fire flickers, like its nervous.|Maybe it knows something we dont.
The flames are warm, but they dont stop the whispers in the dark.|Whispers are just noise until theyre not.
The firelight feels alive, like its protecting us.|Lets hope it doesnt change its mind.
The fires warm, but it doesnt make me feel safe.|Nothing out here ever will.
The fires crackling, but it feels like its warning us.|Warnings are better than silence.
This fires bright, but the dark feels hungrier tonight.|The darks always hungry.
Even the firelight feels like its being watched.|Out here, everythings being watched.
The flames are steady, but my hands are shaking.|Thats just survival kicking in.
The fires bright, but it cant chase away the shadows.|Shadows have a way of sticking around.
This fires the only warmth weve got, but its not enough.|Its never enough out here.
The flames flicker like theyre speaking a language we cant understand.|Maybe thats for the best.
The fires alive, but it doesnt feel friendly.|Out here, nothing ever does.
The firelight feels fragile, like it could disappear any second.|Fragilitys a constant out here.
This fires bright, but it feels like its hiding something.|Everything hides something out here.
The flames are warm, but theyre not comforting.|Comfort doesnt last in this place.
The fire flickers, and I swear its spelling something out.|Maybe its better not to know.
This fires the closest thing to home weve got.|Homes just a memory out here.
The flames dance, but they dont seem happy.|Why would they be?
The firelights steady, but my nerves arent.|Thats just survival talking.
This fire feels like a fragile promise.|Promises break easily out here.
The flames are bright, but they feel distant.|Everything feels distant in the dark.
This fires a small victory, but its a victory.|Well take it.
The firelight feels like its fighting against the dark.|Were all fighting something out here.
The flames are steady, but the nights not.|The night never is.
This fires a fragile reminder of what were fighting for.|Fragile, but important.
The firelight flickers, like its unsure of itself.|Out here, who isnt?
The flames flicker, but the shadows are moving faster.|Shadows dont play fair.
The fire feels alive... almost like its watching us.|Maybe it is.
Every time the fire cracks, it sounds like footsteps in the dark.|Dont look back.
The warmth feels... wrong, like it doesnt belong here.|Nothing belongs here.
The fires small, but the shadows it casts are enormous.|Thats not natural.
I swear I saw something in the flames, just for a second.|Maybe it saw you too.
The fires steady, but I can hear whispers in the wind.|Whispers never mean anything good.
The flames are bright, but the darkness feels... alive.|The dark always feels alive out here.
The firelights flickering like its scared of something.|What could scare fire?
Every crackle of the fire feels like a warning.|Warnings are better than surprises.
The fires warm, but it feels... hollow, like its just pretending.|Everything out here pretends.
The shadows are moving, but none of us are.|Keep your hand on your weapon.
The fires bright, but the shadows behind us are darker than they should be.|Shadows dont lie.
The flames are steady, but the night feels like its holding its breath.|Whats it waiting for?
The firelights the only thing keeping the dark away, but it feels like its losing.|Lets hope it doesnt give up.
It feels like the fires fighting something we cant see.|And we cant help it.
The flames are steady, but the night feels heavier than usual.|The nights always heavier when its hiding something.
Every time the fire cracks, it feels like somethings answering back.|Maybe it is.
The shadows around the fire are moving like theyve got a mind of their own.|Dont let them get too close.
The fires steady, but the darkness feels... hungry.|Lets not give it a reason to eat.
This fires cozy, but Id kill for some marshmallows.|Only thing youre roasting here is your patience.
Finally got the fire going now who brought the vodka?|Check your pockets, genius.
Warm fire, cold vodka, and mutant stories. What else do we need?|Probably less mutants.
This fires nice, but its not exactly gourmet cooking conditions.|Zone cuisine: burned sausage and regret.
Ever notice how a campfire makes everyone look mysterious?|Or just sleep-deprived.
Dont get too comfortable. Last time I sat by a fire, a boar joined us.|Bet it had better table manners than you.
The fires nice, but the company could use some work.|Youre stuck with us, pal.
Remember that time we tried to cook flesh meat over a fire? Never again.|Still tasted better than your stew.
The fires warm, but not as warm as my last date.|Your last date was with a controller.
Who knew starting a fire could feel like such an achievement?|The Zone sets the bar low.
If I squint, this fire almost looks like a fireplace from back home.|Keep dreaming, stalker.
Id enjoy this fire more if I wasnt wondering whats lurking out there.|Probably waiting for you to tell more bad jokes.
This fires great, but Id still trade it for a decent shower.|Or a decent companion.
The fires warm, but Im pretty sure my boots are melting.|Better that than your face.
Is it just me, or does this fire look like its laughing at us?|Probably because were sitting here like fools.
Who needs luxury when youve got a roaring campfire? Oh, right, everyone.|Luxurys overrated. Mutants, however, are not.
If the Zone ever had a tourism board, campfires would be the main attraction.|Right after "Get Eaten by Mutants."
The fires nice, but Id still prefer a brick wall between me and the Zone.|Walls dont keep the Zone out.
The fire crackles, but it sounds... off. Almost like its whispering.|Dont listen too closely.
The light of the fire doesnt go as far as it should.|Thats because the darks pushing back.
This fires peaceful. Too peaceful.|Peace doesnt last in the Zone.
The fires dying down. We should feed it.|Or maybe its time we moved.
Feels like the fires the only thing keeping us sane.|The Zone likes to test that theory.
The flames flicker like theyre afraid of something.|We should probably be afraid too.
The fires small, but at least its ours.|For now, anyway.
If the Zone had a sense of humor, this fire would go out right now.|Dont tempt it.
The fires warm, but it feels like the colds creeping in anyway.|Thats not the cold. Its something worse.
This fire reminds me of my first time in the Zone.|Your first mistake, you mean.
The fires steady, but I keep hearing something moving out there.|Keep your eyes on the dark.
The fires bright, but it feels like somethings watching us from the shadows.|It always is.
This fire makes me nostalgic. For what, I dont know.|Probably for a time before the Zone.
The flames dance, but it almost looks like theyre trying to tell us something.|I dont think we want to know what.
The fires warm, but it doesnt feel comforting.|Nothing here is meant to comfort us.
The shadows are too close to the fire. Closer than they should be.|Dont give them a reason to come closer.
Even with the fire, it feels like the dark is winning.|The dark always wins in the Zone.
The fires small, but its the only thing holding the night back.|Lets hope it holds a little longer.
Every crackle of the fire feels like its counting down to something.|Lets hope we dont find out what.
The fire makes the shadows move, but it feels like theyre moving on their own.|Youre not imagining it.
The fires steady, but it feels like the Zone is waiting for us to drop our guard.|It always is.
This fires nice, but Id trade it for a good nights sleep.|Good luck finding that out here.
The fires light makes the Zone feel almost normal.|But it never is.
The fires steady, but it feels like somethings watching from the trees.|Something always is.
Even with the fire, I feel like I cant shake the cold.|Thats not the cold youre feeling.
The fire feels alive, but not in a comforting way.|More like its hungry.
The fires keeping us warm, but it feels like its draining something from us.|The Zone takes its toll in strange ways.
The flames are dancing, but they feel... wrong.|Everything in the Zone feels wrong.
The fires nice, but its not enough to make me forget where we are.|Nothing ever is.
With the fire going, it almost feels safe.|Almost.
The fires steady, but its not making the night any less dangerous.|The Zone doesnt care about fire.
This fires warm, but I still feel like Im freezing inside.|Thats just the Zone working its magic.
After all these years of the Zone's Existence I heard that the anomalies have gotten worse..|Yes, they've been growing and getting more powerful over the years.
It is told that if you wander around for too long in the Red Forest, you might start hearing voices.|I heard of someone who went there and when he came back he was never the same.
Did you know some stalkers claim to have seen ghostly figures near the Brain Scorcher?|Yeah, and they say those figures whisper your worst fears.
Theres a rumor that the Wish Granter twists your desires into nightmares.|Classic monkey's paw situation. Be careful what you wish for.
They say artifacts formed near anomalies are getting rarer every year.|Rarer and deadlier to fetch, but they still draw us in like moths to a flame.
Some stalkers claim the Zone itself has a heartbeat if you listen closely enough in complete silence.|Sounds like paranoia, but out here, who knows whats real?
Ever notice how some mutants avoid certain areas, like theres something even they fear?|If the mutants are scared, thats probably where I dont want to be.
Theres a legend about a hidden stash guarded by an invisible anomaly somewhere in Agroprom.|Sounds profitable... if you can survive finding it.
They say the Zone shifts terrain after every emission, making old maps unreliable.|Thats why you should never trust a map thats too clean.
Some artifacts supposedly only appear during thunderstorms, but whos brave enough to wait for one?|Sounds like a quick way to end up fried.
Theres a rumor about a stalker who survived walking through a Whirligig anomalyno one believes him, though.|He probably left half his brain in there if he did.
Its said that the Cordons quiet fields were once a battleground for factions fighting over scraps.|Hard to imagine peace lasting long around here.
Some stalkers claim that mutant activity increases right before an emission, like they can sense it coming.|Makes you wonder what else they know that we dont.
The scientists believe theres a link between psi-fields and certain anomalies, but no ones lived long enough to confirm it.|Sounds like a job for someone crazier than me.
Did you know the anomalies in the Zone are getting more volatile every year?|Yeah, some even shift locations right after an emission. Nothing's stable anymore.
They say there's a type of mutant no one's ever seen, just heard in the distance.|If it's staying hidden, it's probably worse than anything we've encountered.
Some stalkers claim there's a second Wish Granter deep in the Zone.|If it's real, its probably even more twisted than the first one.
Ever hear about stalkers disappearing near the Claw Anomaly?|Yeah, they say its because the anomaly shifts to hunt them down.
There's a rumor that the Zone expands slightly with every emission.|If thats true, its only a matter of time before it consumes everything.
They say mutants avoid certain parts of the Red Forest, like theyre scared.|If the mutants wont go there, its probably worse than I want to know.
Did you know theres a bunker full of dead Monolith soldiers somewhere in the Zone?|The weird part is, theyre all arranged like they were praying to something.
Some artifacts are said to form only during a full moon.|Sounds like a death sentence to go looking for them at night, though.
They say theres an invisible anomaly in Agroprom that sings.|Anyone who hears it for too long apparently loses their mind.
Ever heard of stalkers seeing double, like their own reflections walking around?|Yeah, they say its a sign youre being watched by the Zone itself.
Theres a story about a stalker who found a golden artifact but turned to ash when he touched it.|Its said his spirit still wanders the Zone, guarding the spot.
Some stalkers believe the Brain Scorcher wasnt built by humans.|The psi-waves feel too alien to be our creation.
They say emissions are like the Zone breathing.|If thats true, were just ants trying to survive its exhale.
Theres a mutant said to mimic human voices, luring stalkers into traps.|If you hear someone calling for help, make sure its not alone.
Ever notice how some areas of the Zone feel colder, even when its warm?|They say its the spirits of dead stalkers lingering there.
Some artifacts glow faintly when near certain anomalies.|If youre not paying attention, you might walk right into danger.
They say every stalker who uses the Wish Granter hears the same voice.|No one knows whoor whatit belongs to.
Did you know the Monolith faction sometimes speaks in unison?|Some say its because theyre connected through a hive mind.
Theres a rumor that certain artifacts can warp time around you.|Might explain why some stalkers return, claiming years have passed.
They say the deeper you go into the Zone, the more reality bends.|Nothing makes sense theretime, gravity, even your own thoughts.
Ever hear about the "Eternal Flame" anomaly? It burns everything but never goes out.|Some stalkers think its alive, feeding on those who get too close.
Theres a story about a stash guarded by an artifact that makes you hallucinate.|Most who go after it end up losing their minds before they find it.
Some stalkers claim to have found parts of crashed alien ships in the Zone.|The military denies it, but why else would they guard some areas so heavily?
They say theres a mutant out there that only comes out during emissions.|If you see it, its already too late.
Did you know the Zone reacts differently to everyone?|Some stalkers are drawn in, others are repelled, almost like it chooses who stays.
Some anomalies are said to sing at night.|If you hear one, its already too close.
Theres a rumor about a stalker who found a way to survive any anomaly.|He disappeared shortly after. Guess the Zone doesnt like being outsmarted.
They say every artifact has a unique sound if you listen close enough.|The best stalkers use that to find them, but its risky work.
Ever heard of the "Zone Stalker"? A shadowy figure who helps lost stalkers find their way.|Some say hes real, others think its just hallucinations.
They say mutants can smell fear.|If thats true, keeping calm out here is harder than it sounds.
Theres a rumor about a mutant that cant be killed, no matter how much you shoot it.|Most whove seen it dont live long enough to describe it.
Some stalkers believe the Zone is a punishment for humanity.|If thats true, its doing a damn good job.
They say the Zone whispers to you if you listen closely at night.|Some stalkers go mad trying to hear what its saying.
Did you know some artifacts only glow during storms?|Its like the Zone charges them with energy from the sky.
Theres a story about a group of stalkers who found the perfect artifact stash.|Problem is, none of them could agree on what to do with it, and they turned on each other.
Did you know that some stalkers claim the Zone's anomalies are becoming more unpredictable?|Yes, even seasoned veterans are getting caught off guard by new anomaly behaviors.
They say there's a hidden laboratory beneath the Chernobyl Nuclear Power Plant.|I've heard it's where the most dangerous experiments were conducted, leading to the Zone's creation.
Some stalkers believe that certain artifacts can influence a person's mind.|Handling them without proper protection is said to lead to madness.
There's a rumor that the Monolith faction is controlled by a mysterious force at the center of the Zone.|Some say it's an alien entity, others believe it's a rogue AI.
Did you know that some areas of the Zone experience perpetual twilight?|It's as if time stands still, trapping everything in an eternal dusk.
They say that during certain nights, the Zone's sky lights up with strange, unearthly colors.|Some believe it's a sign of the Zone's power, others think it's a warning.
Ever noticed how some areas of the Zone are eerily silent, devoid of any life?|It's as if the Zone itself decides where life can exist and where it cannot.
There's a legend about a group of stalkers who found a way to communicate with the Zone.|They supposedly gained immense knowledge but vanished without a trace.
Some believe that the Zone is expanding slowly, consuming more land each year.|If true, it's only a matter of time before it reaches populated areas.
Did you know that some stalkers have reported seeing their doppelgangers in the Zone?|Encountering your double is said to be a bad omen, often leading to death.
They say that certain anomalies can alter time, making minutes feel like hours.|Some stalkers have aged decades in what felt like moments.
Ever heard of the "Noosphere"? It's believed to be a psychic field connecting all human minds.|Some think the Zone is a physical manifestation of a corrupted Noosphere.
There's a rumor that the Zone was intentionally created by secret experiments.|If true, those responsible unleashed a catastrophe beyond their control.
Did you know that some mutants were once human, transformed by the Zone's influence?|It's a grim reminder of what prolonged exposure to the Zone can do.
They say that the Zone's anomalies are becoming more unpredictable.|Even seasoned stalkers are getting caught off guard by new anomaly behaviors.
Ever noticed how electronic devices malfunction near certain anomalies?|It's as if the Zone disrupts technology, making survival even harder.
There's a legend about a "Golden Sphere" artifact that can grant immortality.|Many have searched for it, but none have returned to tell the tale.
Some believe that the Zone is a test, a trial for humanity's hubris.|Surviving here means understanding and respecting the delicate balance.
Did you know that some areas of the Zone experience perpetual twilight?|It's as if time stands still, trapping everything in an eternal dusk.
They say that certain artifacts can influence a stalker's mind, causing hallucinations.|Handling them without proper protection can lead to madness.
Ever heard of the "Black Stalker"? A shadowy figure said to haunt the deepest parts of the Zone.|Those who encounter him are never seen again.
There's a rumor that the Zone's anomalies are becoming more unpredictable.|Even seasoned stalkers are getting caught off guard by new anomaly behaviors.
Did you know that some areas of the Zone experience perpetual twilight?|It's as if time stands still, trapping everything in an eternal dusk.
They say that certain artifacts can influence a stalker's mind, causing hallucinations.|Handling them without proper protection can lead to madness.

They say that certain artifacts can influence a stalker's mind, causing hallucinations.|Handling them without proper protection can lead to madness.
Ever heard of the "Black Stalker"? A shadowy figure said to haunt the deepest parts of the Zone.|Those who encounter him are never seen again.
There's a rumor that the Zone's anomalies are becoming more unpredictable.|Even seasoned stalkers are getting caught off guard by new anomaly behaviors.
Did you know that some areas of the Zone experience perpetual twilight?|It's as if time stands still, trapping everything in an eternal dusk.
They say that certain artifacts can influence a stalker's mind, causing hallucinations.|Handling them without proper protection can lead to madness.
Ever heard of the "Black Stalker"? A shadowy figure said to haunt the deepest parts of the Zone.|Some say he's a ghost, others think he's a mutant. Either way, no one comes back after meeting him.
They say the closer you get to the center of the Zone, the more unstable reality becomes.|Some stalkers report seeing their past or future selves out there.
Did you know theres a stash in the Zone rumored to be protected by a never-ending storm?|Anyone whos tried to find it hasnt made it back alive.
Theres a rumor that bloodsuckers get smarter the longer they live.|If thats true, then some of the older ones must be terrifyingly cunning.
They say the Zone has hotspots where it feels like youre being watched.|Ive heard its worse near abandoned villages and old ruins.
Ever hear of a mutant that mimics the cries of wounded stalkers?|Some stalkers think it's a chimera, others say it's something worse.
Did you know some anomalies are said to vanish entirely during a full moon?|But the ones that appear in their place are far deadlier.
They say certain artifacts hum in a way that can attract mutants.|If you ever hear it, drop the artifact and run.
Theres a story about a stalker who survived three emissions by hiding in an ancient tree hollow.|He claimed the tree had a heartbeat, but no one believed him.
They say some stalkers have nightmares so vivid they wake up with injuries.|Some believe its the Zone invading their minds.
Did you know certain psi-fields grow stronger during thunderstorms?|Its said the Brain Scorcher was at its deadliest during storms.
Theres a rumor about a mutant with no physical form, just a shadow.|If you see your shadow move when it shouldnt, its probably already too late.
Ever heard about the "Dead Zone"? A place so irradiated not even mutants go there.|Some stalkers say its where the Zones power is most concentrated.
They say some artifacts form only when two anomalies collide.|Its a rare event, but anyone nearby usually doesnt survive to see the artifact.
Did you know the Zones flora mutates as rapidly as its fauna?|Some plants are rumored to release spores that induce hallucinations.
Theres a story about a stalker who claimed he could hear the Zones thoughts.|He disappeared shortly after revealing that the Zone was angry.
They say the Monolith faction has a secret artifact that grants them their resilience.|But no one knows what it is or where they keep it.
Ever noticed how the Zone feels quieter after an emission?|Some stalkers think its the Zone catching its breath, others think its a warning.
Did you know some anomalies produce sounds only animals can hear?|That might explain why mutants act so strange around them.
Theres a rumor about a group of stalkers who tried to map the Zones anomalies.|They all vanished, and their notes were found scattered across the Zone.
They say some artifacts drain your energy instead of boosting it.|The effects are subtle, but those who keep them often fade away slowly.
Ever hear about the Bleeding Stone artifact?|They say it heals wounds but causes severe hallucinations as a trade-off.
Did you know some mutants travel in packs with no leader?|Its as if they all share the same mind, working perfectly together.
Theres a rumor about a hidden cave where all light is absorbed, making it pitch black.|Anyone who goes in is said to vanish without a sound.
They say the Zone reacts differently to each stalkers emotions.|The more fearful you are, the worse your experience becomes.
Ever heard of ghost anomalies? They disappear right after killing anyone who touches them.|Its as if the Zone hides its own tracks.
Did you know certain areas of the Zone get colder at night even without anomalies present?|Some stalkers say its the spirits of the dead.
Theres a story about a stalker who found a perfectly preserved car in the middle of the Zone.|He claimed the engine worked, but he disappeared before he could use it.
They say some artifacts can only be found underwater.|But diving in the Zones water is suicide for most stalkers.
Ever noticed how certain anomalies glow brighter after an emission?|Its as if theyre charged by the Zones energy.
Did you know some stalkers refuse to carry certain artifacts because they bring bad luck?|They say the artifacts choose who theyll benefit.
Theres a rumor about a mutant that mimics the voice of someone you trust.|If you follow it, youll never come back.
They say the Zone becomes eerily quiet just before a massive storm.|Its like its holding its breath, waiting for something big to happen.

Did you know that some stalkers claim to have seen a massive, tree-like anomaly that moves?|Yes, they call it the "Wandering Tree." It's said to uproot itself and relocate, leaving a trail of mutated flora in its wake.
There's a rumor that the Zone's wildlife is starting to exhibit coordinated behavior.|I've heard reports of packs of blind dogs and pseudodogs hunting together, almost like they're strategizing.

Some say that the Zone's anomalies are beginning to merge, creating entirely new phenomena.|That's terrifying. Imagine stumbling into an anomaly that combines the worst aspects of a Whirligig and a Burner.

Did you know that certain areas of the Zone experience time dilation?|Yes, some stalkers have reported spending hours in the Zone, only to find that days or even weeks have passed in the outside world.
There's a legend about a hidden underground city within the Zone.|I've heard that it's a remnant of Soviet experiments, now overrun by mutants and anomalies.
Some stalkers believe that the Zone has a consciousness and reacts to their intentions.|It's as if the Zone rewards those who respect it and punishes those who seek to exploit it.
Did you know that some artifacts are said to have a will of their own?|Yes, there are tales of artifacts moving on their own or even choosing their bearers.
There's a rumor that the Zone's emissions are becoming more frequent and unpredictable.|If that's true, it could make expeditions even more dangerous than they already are.
Some say that the Monolith faction has developed technology to control certain anomalies.|If they can harness that power, it would make them even more formidable.
Did you know that the Zone's radiation levels can fluctuate wildly without warning?|Yes, areas previously deemed safe can become deadly in an instant.
There's a legend about a "Ghost Train" that runs through the Zone at night.|They say it appears out of nowhere, and anyone who boards it is never seen again.
Some stalkers claim to have encountered invisible mutants in the Zone.|That's horrifying. Fighting something you can't see sounds like a nightmare.
Did you know that certain artifacts are believed to be cursed?|Yes, those who possess them often meet untimely and gruesome ends.
There's a rumor that the Zone's anomalies can sometimes heal instead of harm.|I've heard of anomalies that can mend wounds or cure diseases, but finding them is incredibly risky.
Some say that the Zone's mutants are evolving, developing new abilities.|If that's true, we could be facing threats we've never even imagined.
Did you know that the Zone's landscape can change overnight?|Yes, entire buildings have been known to appear or disappear without a trace.
There's a legend about a "Singing Anomaly" that lures stalkers to their doom.|They say its song is irresistible, drawing you in until it's too late.
Some stalkers believe that the Zone is expanding, slowly encroaching on the outside world.|If that's the case, nowhere will be safe from its influence.
Did you know that certain areas of the Zone are said to be haunted?|Yes, there are reports of ghostly apparitions and unexplained phenomena in places like the Red Forest.
There's a rumor that the Zone's artifacts are becoming more unstable.|If that's true, handling them could become even more hazardous.
Some say that the Zone's anomalies can move, changing locations over time.|That would make navigating the Zone even more treacherous.
Did you know that the Zone's emissions can sometimes trigger hallucinations?|Yes, some stalkers have reported seeing things that aren't there during an emission.
There's a legend about a "Living Anomaly" that hunts stalkers.|They say it's a sentient anomaly that actively seeks out and consumes those who enter the Zone.
Some stalkers believe that the Zone is a living entity, with its own consciousness and will.|It's as if the Zone itself decides who lives and who dies within its borders.
Did you know that certain artifacts are said to be able to communicate with their bearers?|Yes, there are tales of artifacts that can convey thoughts or emotions to those who possess them.
There's a rumor that the Zone's anomalies can sometimes merge, creating entirely new phenomena.|If that's true, it could lead to even more unpredictable and dangerous conditions.
Some say that the Zone's mutants are becoming more organized, working together in coordinated attacks.|If that's the case, it could make traversing the Zone even more perilous.
Did you know that the Zone's landscape can shift, altering its geography over time?|Entire areas have been known to change, making maps unreliable.
There's a legend about a "Whispering Anomaly" that drives stalkers mad.|They say it whispers secrets and lies, causing paranoia and insanity.
