Remember to sell your mutant parts to the Butcher at Garbage.|I heard he pays top dollar. I'm done getting scammed from Sidorovich.

Did you know that the AN-94 "Abakan" rifle features a unique two-round burst mode with a high rate of fire?|It's designed to increase hit probability by firing two rounds in quick succession before recoil affects accuracy.

The VSS Vintorez is a favored weapon among stalkers for its integrated suppressor and subsonic 9x39mm ammunition.|It's ideal for stealth operations, allowing for silent takedowns of targets without alerting others.
Some stalkers prefer the FN P90 for its high-capacity 50-round magazine and compact bullpup design.|Its 5.7x28mm ammunition offers good armor penetration, making it effective against armored targets.

The SEVA suit is renowned for its excellent anomaly protection, making it a top choice for artifact hunters.|However, it offers limited ballistic protection, so it's best to avoid direct combat while wearing it.

Did you know that the GP-5 gas mask, while common in the Zone, provides minimal protection against radiation?|It's better than nothing, but upgrading to a more advanced respirator is advisable for better protection.

The Exoskeleton suit offers unparalleled protection and increased carrying capacity but at the cost of reduced mobility.|Its built-in servos assist with heavy loads, but the suit's weight can make quick movements challenging.

Some stalkers swear by the reliability of the AK-74M, citing its durability and widespread availability of 5.45x39mm ammunition.|It's a versatile rifle that's easy to maintain, even in the harsh conditions of the Zone.

The SPAS-12 shotgun is favored for its dual-mode operation, allowing both pump-action and semi-automatic firing.|This versatility makes it effective against both mutants and human adversaries at close range.

Did you know that the Ghillie suit provides excellent camouflage, making it harder for enemies to spot you?|It's particularly effective in vegetated areas, allowing stalkers to blend into their surroundings.

The PKM machine gun offers a high rate of fire and uses 7.62x54mmR ammunition, making it effective for suppressive fire.|Its weight and recoil can be challenging, but it's unmatched in sustained firepower.

Some stalkers choose the Desert Eagle for its powerful .50 AE rounds, capable of stopping most targets with a single shot.|Yea but its fucking heavy ass recoil and limited magazine capacity require some careful shots.

The "Sunrise" suit is a common sight among rookie stalkers, offering basic protection and modest anomaly resistance.|It's an affordable starting suit, but upgrading is essential for survival in more hazardous areas.

Did you know that the AS VAL shares many components with the VSS Vintorez but is configured for automatic fire?|Yep, it's favored by special forces for its integrally suppressed design and effective 9x39mm ammunition.
The LR-300 rifle is appreciated for its modularity and compatibility with various attachments, enhancing its versatility.|I love mine, the 5.56 is easy to find.

Some stalkers equip the SAPI plates in their tactical vests to increase protection against high-velocity projectiles.|While adding weight, these plates can mean the difference between life and death in a firefight.

The TOZ-34 is a popular double-barreled shotgun known for its reliability and stopping power at close range.|Its simple design makes it easy to maintain, a crucial factor in the Zone's harsh environment.

Did you know that the "Berill-5M" armored suit offers a good balance between ballistic protection and anomaly resistance?|It's a solid choice for those venturing into areas with both human threats and environmental hazards.

The HK MP5 is renowned for its accuracy and controllability, making it a favorite among those who prefer 9x19mm firearms.|Its compact size is ideal for close-quarters combat, and it's compatible with various attachments.

Some experienced stalkers opt for the "Bulat" armored suit, which provides excellent ballistic protection.|However, its weight can be cumbersome, and it offers limited anomaly resistance, so caution is advised.

The Saiga-12 is a semi-automatic shotgun based on the AK platform, offering rapid fire and compatibility with various magazines.|It's highly effective against mutants, especially in close-quarter situations.

Did you know that the "Sphere-12" helmet provides advanced head protection and includes a built-in respirator?|It's a valuable piece of equipment for those delving into highly contaminated areas of the Zone.
The FN SCAR-H is chambered in 7.62x51mm NATO, offering superior stopping power and accuracy at longer ranges.|Its modular design allows for easy customization to suit various combat scenarios.

Some stalkers prefer the "Guardian of Freedom" suit, exclusive to the Freedom faction, for its balance of protection and mobility.|It also offers decent anomaly resistance, making it suitable for artifact hunting missions.
The Mosin-Nagant rifle, despite its age, remains a reliable choice for long-range engagements in the Zone.|I love the round it fires.

Did you know that the "PSZ-9d Duty Armor" is favored by the Duty faction for its robust ballistic protection?|It's designed to withstand heavy fire, making it ideal for confrontations with well-armed adversaries.
It's always a pain in the ass when your gun jams and there's a bloodsucker right behind.| Bloodsuckers? Hah, that's nothing.
I never get caught without at least a can of Tushonka on me.| Beats eating mutant dog anyday.
Did you know the Zone's wildlife adapts faster than anywhere else?|Mutants evolving before your eyes. Nature's twisted experiment, gone wild.
They say the Brain Scorcher at Yantar still broadcasts, even if its degraded.|Just echoes now, but those echoes can still scramble your brain if you're not careful.
Some artifacts are said to react to human emotions, especially fear and greed.|Best keep a poker face in the Zone then. Or become a mutant magnet.
Did you know some stalkers believe the Zone is alive, a single entity with its own will?|And were just playthings in its game, some say. Makes you think twice about artifact hunting.
Theres a legend of an artifact that grants wishes, hidden deep in the Zone's center.|Wishes come with a Zone price tag, and the Zone always collects, one way or another.
They say the emissions arent random. The Zone's breathing, a cycle of expansion and contraction.|And every exhale is a new wave of anomalies and mutants pushed outward.
Did you know some anomalies move, almost like theyre hunting for prey?|Zone's not just dangerous by accident, it's predatory. Always remember that.
There are whispers of plants in the Zone with medicinal properties, beyond just healing wounds.|Heard tell of herbs that can sharpen your senses, or blur the line between worlds. Risky business.
Some believe the military knows far more about the Zone's true nature than they ever let on.|They guard the borders, control access theyre definitely hiding something deep down.
Did you know the Cordon is considered one of the safest areas, yet even rookies vanish there?|No place is truly safe in the Zone. Complacency is a death sentence, even in 'safe' zones.
They say old Zone maps are practically useless now. Anomalies shift, paths vanish, new dangers emerge.|Trust your compass and your gut, not some faded piece of paper, out here.
Did you know some artifacts are born directly from anomalies, violent bursts of Zone energy?|Born in fire, forged in chaos. No wonder theyre so volatile and powerful.
They say the Wish Granter at the Zone's center it doesnt actually grant wishes as youd hope.|More like twists your desires into Zone-flavored nightmares. Be careful what you wish for.
Some stalkers claim they've seen 'shadow stalkers', figures that flicker at the edge of vision.|Probably just Zone hallucinations or maybe the Zones playing tricks on our minds again.
Did you know the Clear Sky faction wasn't always about containing the Zone?|Whispers say they were once heavily involved in studying its expansion, maybe even causing it, some say.
They say the Freedom faction's open borders attract more than just free spirits.|Word is, they harbor some truly dangerous and unstable elements within their ranks.
Some anomalies are invisible to the naked eye, only detectable by equipment or experience.|Zone teaches you to feel the danger before you see it. If you live long enough to learn.
Did you know some stalkers believe artifacts are pieces of something larger?|Fragments of the Zone itself, broken off and made tangible. Zones own strange currency.
They say the Chernobyl NPP is not just the origin of the Zone, but also its heart.|Pulsing with some unknown energy, keeping this whole twisted place alive. Or undead.
Some say the mutants are not just random mutations, but have a purpose in the Zone's ecology.|Twisted purpose, sure. To test our limits, to thin our numbers, maybe both.

Did you know some areas of the Zone experience time distortions, where minutes can stretch into hours, or vice versa?|Time itself is warped here. Makes you question whats real, whats just Zone trickery.
They say the Zone attracts people with troubled pasts, those seeking escape or something else.|Zone preys on desperation and broken souls. Be careful what youre running from, and running to.
Some believe the emissions are a form of Zone cleansing, wiping the slate clean, preparing for something new.|Cleansing in fire and radiation. Zones idea of renewal is violent.
Did you know some artifacts are said to amplify psychic abilities, or even awaken latent ones?|Playing with psychic artifacts is like playing with fire for your mind. Burnout guaranteed.

They say deep within the Zone, there are areas untouched by human hands, primordial Zone in its purest form.|Untainted and probably unimaginably hostile. Best to leave those places to the Zone itself.
Some stalkers believe the monolith isn't just a rock, but a transmitter? A receiver?|Transmitting madness, receiving orders from something beyond our understanding. Either way, bad news.
Did you know the weather in the Zone can change in an instant, from clear skies to deadly storms?|Zones mood swings. Always unpredictable, always dangerous. Never trust a clear sky for long.
They say the Zone's artifacts are becoming rarer, harder to find. Hunted out, or depleting?|Maybe the Zones resources are finite, even these twisted ones. Or maybe it's hiding them deeper now.
Some stalkers claim to have seen Zone ghosts, apparitions of past tragedies.|Echoes of the Zone's pain, or just radiation messing with your head? Hard to say in this place.

Did you know the Ecologists aren't just scientists, but almost priests of the Zone in a way?|Worshipping the anomalies, dissecting mutants theyre trying to understand a god no human mind should grasp.

They say the Mercenaries arent just in it for the rubles. Some are here for something darker, thrill-seeking, maybe.|Zone attracts all kinds. Some just want to watch the world burn, and get paid for it.
Some anomalies pulse with a faint hum, a vibration you can almost feel in your bones.|Zones heartbeat? Or a warning sign before it unleashes something worse?
Did you know some stalkers believe the Zone is trying to communicate, in its own twisted way?|Through anomalies, through mutants, through artifacts a language were not meant to understand, maybe.
They say the underground labs are deeper and more extensive than anyone on the surface realizes.|Hidden layers beneath hidden layers. Zones got secrets buried deeper than radiation.
Some claim the Zone changes people, not just physically, but spiritually. Morally.|Zone strips you bare, forces you to confront your own darkness, or become part of its own.

Did you know some areas are dead zones even within the Zone, places utterly devoid of life, even mutants avoid them?|Places the Zone itself rejects. Thats when you know youve wandered too far, gone too deep.

They say the guides aren't just experienced stalkers, but have a connection to the Zone, an instinct for its paths.|They listen to the Zone, feel its currents. More than just skill, its almost a gift, or a curse.
Some stalkers whisper of artifact storms, sudden bursts of energy that rain down artifacts, but also worse.|Zones bounty is never free. Every gift comes with a greater risk.
Did you know some anomalies are drawn to light, like moths to a flame, or something hungrier?|Dont shine your flashlight too long in the dark. You might attract more than mutants.
They say the Zone expands and contracts, areas changing, disappearing, reappearing over time.|Landscape itself is fluid, unreliable. Ground shifts beneath your feet, literally and figuratively.
Some believe the Zone is testing humanity, a harsh trial, a judgment.|And were failing spectacularly, one mutated stalker at a time.
Did you know some artifacts are chimeric, combinations of different properties, unpredictable and unstable?|Zone loves to mix and match. Creates things even it doesn't understand, maybe.
They say the Zone whispers to you, if you spend too long alone, listen too closely.|Whispers promises, whispers madness. Best to keep your radio chatter loud, drown out the Zones voice.
Some stalkers carry Zone talismans, trinkets they believe offer protection beyond armor and bullets.|Superstition or survival tool? In the Zone, sometimes belief is all youve got left.

Did you know the emission warnings aren't always reliable, sometimes the Zone skips a cycle, or throws in a surprise?|Never trust the Zone to be predictable. It thrives on chaos, on breaking expectations.
They say the rarest artifacts aren't just powerful, but sentient, in a way. Aware of their own existence.|Artifacts with minds of their own. Whos hunting whom then, stalker or stone?
Some believe the Zone is a form of karma, a reflection of humanitys sins, manifested in reality.|Chernobyl was just the start. Zones the consequence, the price we pay for our mistakes, amplified.
Did you know some anomalies are dormant during the day, only activating at night, or during certain weather?|Zones got its own rhythms, its own cycles of danger. Learn them, or die by surprise.

They say the deepest parts of the Zone are not just radioactive, but psychoactive, warping reality itself.|Realitys thin here. Zone bleeds into your mind, and your mind bleeds into the Zone. Gets messy, fast.

Some stalkers believe the Zone chooses who it lets live, and who it consumes. No rhyme or reason, just fate.|Fate in the Zone is a bullet, a trap, an anomaly. Make your own luck, or die waiting for it.
Did you know some the Zone whispers secrets to those who listen closely?|Yeah, mostly whispers about how fucked you are. Real helpful, that Zone.
They say artifacts can boost your abilities, make you faster, stronger.|Faster to die if you grab the wrong one, stronger mutant you become. Pick your poison.
Did you know some rookies actually think the Zones romantic?|Romantic like a gunshot to the gut is romantic. Come back after a week in Garbage, then tell me about romance.
There's a rumor the Military knows how to control the Zone, but they're keeping it secret.|Control the Zone? They cant even control their own damn checkpoints. Bullshit rumors.
Did you know some anomalies are attracted to metal? Your gear might be a walking trap.|Great, just what I needed. Another thing in this shithole trying to kill me for my rusty bolts.
They say the Wish Granter actually works, but twists your wish into a nightmare.|Wish for rubles, wake up a Bloodsuckers chew toy. Zones got a sick sense of humor, dont it?
Did you know some stalkers use artifacts as lucky charms?|Lucky charms in a place where luck runs out faster than ammo. Placebo effect, maybe, keeps em from shitting their pants.
Theres a story about a stalker who tried to sell his soul to the Zone for riches.|Guess the Zone doesnt take rubles. Hes a zombie now, wandering Garbage. Lesson learned, maybe.
Did you know some say the emissions are the Zone clearing its throat before something big?|Big like what? Bigger mutants? More anomalies? Zone, youre a real comedian, you bastard.

They say the scientists actually *enjoy* being in the Zone. Studying anomalies, mutants.|Yeah, studying from a safe bunker. Try doing *their* research balls deep in Red Forest. See how much they enjoy it then.

Did you know some anomalies are named after scientists who discovered them and died in them?|Zones got a real memorial system going on. Here lies Professor So-and-so, vaporized by his own curiosity. Touching.
Theres a rumor about a stash of pre-Zone booze hidden somewhere deep in Pripyat.|Pre-Zone booze? Probably tastes like piss and radiation by now. But desperate times, eh?
Did you know some say the Zone gets stronger in winter? Mutants get meaner in the cold.|Winter in the Zone? Sounds like a fucking delight. Just add zombies on ice skates.
They say some areas of the Zone are quiet zones, almost peaceful.|Peaceful in the Zone means the monsters are just hiding, waiting for you to relax. Don't fall for it.
Did you know some artifacts are said to be addictive? Stalkers crave their energy.|Addictive like getting shot in the leg is addictive. Zones got plenty of better addictions, like breathing.
There's a legend of a stash of gold hidden by bandits, buried somewhere in Dark Valley.|Bandit gold? Probably cursed, mutated, and guarded by a Chimera. Worth your life for some shiny metal?
Did you know some anomalies actually sing? Faint humming sounds, they say.|Singing anomalies? Zones got a fucked up choir going on. Just hope it ain't a death dirge.

They say the Zone punishes greed, stalkers who get too obsessed with artifacts always end up dead.|Greed gets you killed anywhere, but the Zone? Zone just speeds up the process with anomalies and fangs.
Did you know some stalkers believe the Zone is a giant garbage dump for human sins?|Explains the mutants, the anomalies, the whole damn mess. We fucked up, and Zones our punishment landfill.
There's a rumor about a stash of working vehicles, pre-Zone, hidden somewhere in Zaton.|Working vehicles in the Zone? Lasted longer than most stalkers, then. Probably rusted husks by now.
Did you know some anomalies only appear after emissions, the Zone rearranging itself?|Zones like a fucked up apartment, always redecorating with new death traps. Never a dull moment, eh?
They say the Monolith are just brainwashed fanatics, not even human anymore.|Brainwashed, crazy, or just saw something we haven't and went fuck this? Hard to tell with those bastards.
Did you know some stalkers claim to have found safe zones within anomalies themselves?|Safe zones *inside* anomalies? Sounds like a fast ticket to mutant heaven. Or hell, Zones picky like that.

Theres a legend of a stalker who became one with the Zone, vanished into an anomaly and reappeared different.|Reappeared different, or just got replaced by a Zone mimic? Don't trust anyone who claims to be 'one with the Zone'.
Did you know some say the Zone is expanding, slowly creeping outwards?|Expanding misery, thats the Zones real artifact. Spreading the love, one anomaly at a time.
They say the Clear Sky faction tried to control the Zone, stop the emissions.|Control the Zone? Like trying to herd cats with radiation poisoning. Good luck with that, Clear Sky. Oh wait
Did you know some artifacts are actually living organisms, Zone-born lifeforms?|Living artifacts? Explains why theyre so damn unpredictable. Zones biology is fucked, ain't it?
Theres a rumor of a hidden passage from the Zone to another Zone? Some parallel reality bullshit.|Another Zone? Like this one wasnt enough of a clusterfuck? Zone-ception, maybe?

Did you know some anomalies are actually failed experiments from pre-Zone labs, leaking into reality?|Explains the weird shit. Scientists fucked up, Zones the hangover. And were cleaning their mess, for rubles.
They say the Duty faction wants to destroy the Zone, wipe it off the map.|Destroy the Zone? Wishful thinking. Zonell destroy us all first, bet your ass on that.
Did you know some stalkers believe the Zone is a sentient being, testing our worthiness?|Worthy of what? More pain? Zones tests are all pass-fail, and pass means you just survive another day, maybe.

Theres a legend of an artifact that can cure mutations, reverse the Zone's effects.|Cure mutations? If that was true, wed all be fighting over it, not radishes and rusty bolts. Another fairytale, stalker bullshit.

Did you know some say the emissions are the Zones way of resetting itself, purging old dangers for new ones?|Resetting to more dangerous is the Zones idea of progress. Thanks, Zone, youre too kind, you prick.

They say the Freedom faction are just anarchists, wanting to unleash the Zone on the world.|Unleash the Zone? Idiots. Zone doesn't need help being unleashed, it's doing just fine fucking us all over on its own.
Did you know some anomalies mimic sounds? Lure you in with voices, calls for help.|Zones got a twisted sense of hospitality. Inviting you in for a quick death, maybe a slow one if you're lucky.
There's a rumor about a hidden stash of NATO weapons somewhere in Army Warehouses.|NATO weapons? Probably jammed, rusted, and useless by now. But hey, hope dies last, right? Even in this shithole.

Did you know some stalkers believe artifacts are tears of the Zone? Crystalline sorrow, they call it.|Tears of the Zone? Sounds poetic. Mostly just sharp, radioactive tears thatll bleed you dry if you aint careful.
They say the Zones center is not just dangerous, but conscious. Watching, judging.|Judging us all failures, probably. Zones a harsh critic, ain't it?
Did you know some anomalies are actually portals, gateways to somewhere else?|Gateways to another pile of Zone bullshit, most likely. Don't expect a vacation to the Bahamas, stalker.

There's a legend of a stalker who found a map to the Zone's origins, the real source of its power.|Map to the Zones origins? Probably leads to a Vortex anomaly and a pack of Snorks. Zone maps are all death sentences anyway.

Did you know some believe the Zone is a prison, trapping something ancient and powerful?|Prison for us, maybe. Or maybe *were* the prisoners keeping something *in*. Zones got layers of fucked up, don't it?
They say the scientists are trying to understand the Zone. Control it.|Understand the Zone? Like understanding why a dog pisses on your leg. Pointless, and just pisses you off more.

Did you know some artifacts are said to sing to specific people, call out to them?|Artifacts singing? Probably just radiation poisoning and voices in your head. Zone messes with your brain, remember that, stalker.

Theres a rumor of a stash of pristine medical supplies, untouched since before the Zone, hidden in a hospital.|Pristine meds from before the Zone? Like finding a unicorn shitting gold bricks. Nice dream, stalker. Wake up.

Did you know some stalkers believe the Zone is a test, a trial by fire for humanity?|Test were failing miserably, if you ask me. Guess the Zones grading on a curve, and the curve is a flat line of dead stalkers.

They say the Zone is always changing, even when youre not looking, landscape rearranging itself.|Zones a goddamn kaleidoscope of death and anomalies. Stand still too long, youll get swallowed by the scenery shift.

Did you know some anomalies are sentient? Almost like theyre aware of you, reacting to your presence?|Sentient anomalies? Great. Now the death traps are judging us too. Zones a real judgmental bitch, ain't it?

Theres a legend of a stalker who found a way to leave the Zone, truly escape its grasp.|Escape the Zone? Only way out is in a body bag, or a brain-fried zombie. Dont believe that escape fairytale, rookie.

Did you know some believe the Zone is a punishment, a divine retribution for our sins at Chernobyl?|Punishment fitting the crime, then. We fucked up, Zones the hangover. And were all paying the goddamn price for it.

They say the deepest parts of the Zone they whisper promises of power, riches, if you dare to go there.|Promises and lies. Deep Zone just promises you a quicker, nastier death. Don't be a damn fool chasing whispers, stalker.
Did you know they got a new drug in the Zone called 'Zone Dust'? Said it's stronger than anything outside.|Zone Dust? Sounds like a fast ticket to an early grave, dusted and forgotten.

Heard some rookies are getting hooked on 'Breather' stims just to cope with the Zone's atmosphere.|Breather stims for Cordon air? Wait till they hit Red Forest, they'll be mainlining pure radiation to feel 'normal'.

They say if you mix certain artifacts with cheap vodka, you get a 'Zone Cocktail'.|Zone Cocktail? Sounds like a guaranteed trip to the morgue. Stick to plain vodka, less chance of glowing in the dark.

Did you know some mutants are rumored to secrete psychoactive fluids? Stalkers licking mutant goo now, great.|Mutant goo? Stalkersll try anything once, especially if it promises to numb the Zones misery. Idiots.

Military patrols are cracking down on artifact-derived narcotics smuggling, they say.|Military cracking down? They can't even crack down on bandits, let alone Zone junkies with glowing rocks. PR stunt, probably.
There's whispers of old pre-Zone labs still having stashes of experimental psychotropics.|Experimental psychotropics? Sounds like a recipe for brain scrambler, Zone edition. Hard pass from me.
Did you know some anomalies are said to enhance the effects of drugs, make trips wilder?|Anomalies amplifying drugs? Zone's turning into a goddamn rave for suicidal idiots. Avoid both, I say.
Rookies using 'Courage Pills' to face mutants now. Think it'll make 'em brave?|'Courage Pills' and a rusty peashooter against a Bloodsucker? Yeah, brave and very, very dead.
They say long-term Zone exposure itself is like a drug, addictive and mind-altering.|Zone addiction? Sounds about right. We're all junkies for this radioactive hellhole, one way or another.
Black market in Pripyat is flooded with cheap, knock-off stims and 'Zone uppers'.|Knock-off stims in Pripyat? Guaranteed to be cut with radiation and regret. Avoid like a Plague anomaly.

Did you know some say the Ecologists are experimenting with synthesized 'artifact extracts' for recreational use?|Ecologists getting high on their own supply? Explains a lot about their research. Mad scientists and Zone-trips, lovely combo.
Heard Monolith patrols are sometimes 'chemically enhanced' before big pushes.|Explains why they charge headfirst into machine gun fire. Zone-crazed *and* drugged up? Fanatics on overdrive.
Artifact detectors sometimes go haywire near stashes of certain Zone narcotics, they say.|Drugs messing with artifact detectors? Zone's got its own twisted logic, even for getting high. Figures.

Vodka's considered a 'gateway drug' in the Zone now, rookies start with that, then move to harder stuff.|Vodka's baby food out here. Zone chews you up, spits you out needing something stronger to forget it all.

There's a rumor of a stash of pure, uncut 'Zone Cocaine' nicknamed 'White Bloom' hidden in Limansk.|'White Bloom' in Limansk? Sounds like a Bandit trap laced with more traps. High ain't worth a head full of lead.

Did you know some stalkers trade rare artifacts specifically for access to high-grade 'Fentanyl Patches', smuggled in from outside?|Fentanyl in the Zone? Overkill much? Guess Zone misery needs Zone-strength numbing. Desperate times.

They say long-term use of Zone drugs can cause minor mutations, skin rashes, glowing veins, that kinda thing.|Glowing veins? Stalker chic, Zone edition. Just add radiation sickness and you're peak Zone fashion.

Heard some particularly desperate stalkers are trying to synthesize their own drugs from Zone flora and fauna.|DIY Zone drugs? Darwin Award speedrun category, right there. Guaranteed to turn you into something interesting.

Military checkpoints are supposedly scanning for drug use now, tighter controls.|Military scanning for drugs? They gonna scan for radiation poisoning next? Pointless busywork while the Zone's eating us all.
Last words of a Zone junkie they found near Jupiter? 'Just one more artifact high '|'Just one more hit' Zones favorite last words. They all chase that dragon, and the dragon always wins in the end.
Heard some rookie stalkers are trying to use drones to scout the Zone.|Drones? Probably end up as mutant snacks or stuck in an anomaly. Zone's got a way of grounding even the fanciest toys.
Did you know some say the Brain Scorcher is actually a giant psychic mutant?|Giant psychic mutant? Explains the headaches. Just another reason to avoid that place like the plague.
They say artifacts are actually living things, feeding off the Zones energy.|Living things? Explains why theyre so damn temperamental. Try feeding one lead, see what happens.
There's a rumor about a hidden lab where scientists created super mutants.|Super mutants? Like we didn't have enough trouble with the regular ones. Zone's always upping the ante, ain't it?
Did you know some stalkers believe the Zone is punishing humanity for its sins?|Punishing us? More like playing with us like lab rats. Zone's a cruel god, if you ask me.
They say the Wish Granter grants your deepest desire, but at a terrible price.|Deepest desire? Probably something stupid like a lifetime supply of sausage. And the price? Your soul, naturally.
Did you know some anomalies are sentient? They learn, they adapt.|Sentient anomalies? Explains why theyre always in the damn way. Zones got a mind of its own, and it hates us.
There's a legend of a stalker who found a way to leave the Zone.|Leave the Zone? Why would anyone want to do that? Nowhere's safe, not really.
Did you know some believe the Zone is a gateway to hell?|Gateway to hell? Seems about right. Just needs a few more fire and brimstone anomalies.
They say the Zone changes people. Makes them stronger, faster, more different.|Different how? More likely to sprout extra limbs and crave human flesh. Zone's a sculptor of nightmares.

Did you know some stalkers try to communicate with the Zone, using rituals and chants?|Communicating with the Zone? Might as well try chatting with a brick wall. At least the wall won't try to kill you.
Heard some crazy stalkers are trying to breed mutant pets.|Mutant pets? Like a dog with three heads and a taste for blood? Zone's got enough monsters already, thanks.
Did you know some artifacts are said to grant immortality?|Immortality? Sounds like a long, painful existence in this hellhole. I'd rather take my chances with a quick death.
They say the Zone is expanding slowly consuming the world.|Consuming the world? One radioactive bite at a time. We're all Zone chow, sooner or later.
Did you know some stalkers believe the Zone is a dream?|A dream? More like a nightmare I can't wake up from. Someone pinch me, please.

There's a rumor about a hidden vault containing the secrets of the Zone.|Secrets of the Zone? Probably just a bunch of old scientific journals and a bottle of vodka. And maybe a few Monolith fanatics guarding it.
Did you know some anomalies are addictive? Stalkers get hooked on the energy they emit.|Addictive anomalies? Zone's got its own brand of drugs, doesn't it? Just as deadly.
They say the Zone is alive. Breathing, growing, changing.|Alive? More like a festering wound on the world. And we're the maggots crawling in it.
Did you know some stalkers believe the Zone is a test?|A test? One we're all failing miserably. Zone's the ultimate exam, and the only grade is dead.
There's a story about a stalker who made a deal with the Zone and won.|Won? Probably won a one-way ticket to mutantville. Zone doesn't make deals, it makes corpses.
Did you know some stalkers believe the Zone is a reflection of our own souls?|Reflection of our souls? Explains why it's so messed up. We're all walking around with a little bit of Zone inside us.

Heard some rookies are trying to use exoskeletons to carry more artifacts.|Exoskeletons? Just makes you a bigger target for mutants. Zone doesn't care how much you can carry, it cares how dead you are.

Did you know some say the Controllers are actually failed experiments, driven mad by the Zone?|Failed experiments? Explains their charming personality. Zone's got a real talent for creating monsters, doesn't it?
They say artifacts can predict the future.|Predict the future? Probably predicts a gruesome death for anyone who relies on them. Zone's future is always bleak.
There's a rumor about a hidden oasis within the Zone, untouched by radiation.|Untouched by radiation? Probably a mirage. Zone's a master of illusion, especially when you're thirsty.
Did you know some stalkers believe the Zone is a living organism?|A living organism? A parasitic one, feeding off our fear and desperation. Zone's a real leech.
They say the Wish Granter can grant any wish, but the consequences are unforeseen.|Unforeseen consequences? Like wishing for wealth and waking up as a Bloodsucker's dinner? Zone's a real trickster.
Did you know some anomalies are contagious? They can spread to other areas.|Contagious anomalies? Zone's like a disease, infecting everything it touches. And we're all catching it.
There's a legend of a stalker who found a way to control the mutants.|Control the mutants? Good luck with that. Zone's mutants have a mind of their own, and that mind wants to eat you.
Did you know some believe the Zone is a punishment from the gods?|Punishment from the gods? More like a cosmic joke. And we're the punchline.
They say the Zone amplifies your emotions. Makes you more aggressive, more paranoid.|Amplifies your emotions? Explains why everyone's so trigger-happy. Zone's a breeding ground for madness.
Did you know some stalkers try to domesticate mutants?|Domesticate mutants? Like keeping a Snork as a pet? Zone's got a way of humbling even the most arrogant.
Heard some traders are selling mutant meat as rations.|Mutant meat? Probably glows in the dark. Zone's got a unique culinary scene, doesn't it?
Did you know some artifacts are said to heal any wound?|Heal any wound? Except the ones caused by radiation, of course. Zone's got a twisted sense of irony.
They say the Zone is a mirror, reflecting our darkest fears.|Reflecting our darkest fears? Explains why it's so terrifying. We're all afraid of something, and the Zone knows it.
There's a rumor about a hidden bunker containing a cure for the Zone.|A cure for the Zone? More likely a one-way ticket to oblivion. Zone's got no cure, only victims.
Did you know some anomalies can manipulate time?|Manipulate time? Explains why some days feel like weeks in the Zone. Zone's got its own time zone, and it's a real killer.
They say the Zone is a test of character. Only the strong survive.|A test of character? Most fail. Zone's a harsh grader, and the only passing grade is dead.
Did you know some stalkers believe the Zone is a gateway to another dimension?|Another dimension? Probably just as messed up as this one. Zone's got a way of making everywhere feel like hell.
There's a story about a stalker who mastered the Zone.|Mastered the Zone? Nobody masters the Zone. The Zone masters you, one way or another.
Did you know some stalkers try to predict the emissions?|Predict the emissions? Might as well try predicting the weather in hell. Zone's emissions are as unpredictable as everything else here.
Heard some scientists are trying to harness the Zone's energy.|Harness the Zone's energy? Sounds like a great way to blow up the world. Zone's energy is best left alone.
Did you know some artifacts are said to grant wishes, but only to those who are worthy?|Worthy? Nobody's worthy in the Zone. We're all just scavengers, desperate for a little luck in this hellhole.
They say the Zone is a living, breathing nightmare.|A living nightmare? Couldn't have said it better myself. And we're all trapped inside it.
There's a rumor about a hidden city within the Zone, populated by mutants who can talk.|Talking mutants? Probably just want to tell you how delicious you look. Zone's got a twisted sense of humor.
Did you know some stalkers believe the Zone is a place of transformation?|Transformation? Yeah, transforming into something monstrous. Zone's a real makeover artist.
Heard some stalkers are trying to breed mutant dogs for hunting.|Mutant dogs? Probably more dangerous than the mutants they're supposed to hunt. Zone's got a way of turning everything against you.

Did you know some say the Bloodsuckers are actually failed attempts at creating super-soldiers?|Failed super-soldiers? Explains their thirst for blood. Zone's got a real knack for creating failures, doesn't it?
They say artifacts can control the weather.|Control the weather? Probably controls it into a radioactive storm. Zone's weather forecast is always grim.
There's a rumor about a hidden village inhabited by people who have adapted to the Zone.|Adapted to the Zone? Probably means they've grown an extra eye or two. Zone's a real evolutionary playground.
Did you know some stalkers believe the Zone is a test of faith?|A test of faith? My faith in humanity is pretty much gone after being in here. Zone's a real faith-breaker.
They say the Wish Granter can grant your deepest desire, but the price is your sanity.|Your sanity? That's already hanging by a thread in the Zone. Zone's a real sanity-snatcher.
Did you know some anomalies are sentient and can communicate with each other?|Sentient anomalies communicating? Probably gossiping about how stupid we are. Zone's got a real network of weirdness.

There's a legend of a stalker who found a way to harness the power of the Brain Scorcher.|Harness the Brain Scorcher? Sounds like a headache waiting to happen. Zone's got a real talent for frying brains.
Did you know some believe the Zone is a gateway to paradise?|Paradise? Yeah, a paradise for mutants and anomalies. Zone's got a twisted definition of paradise.
They say the Zone feeds on fear.|Feeds on fear? Explains why it's so powerful. We're all walking fear factories in here. Zone's a real fear-monger.
Did you know some stalkers try to train mutants as guards?|Train mutants as guards? Good luck getting a Snork to sit still. Zone's mutants are about as trainable as wild bears.
Heard some traders are selling artifacts as lucky charms.|Lucky charms? Probably just radioactive trinkets. Zone's got a real market for useless crap.
Did you know some artifacts are said to grant invisibility?|Invisibility? Probably makes you invisible to everything except mutants. Zone's got a way of seeing through your tricks.
They say the Zone is a reflection of our inner darkness.|Our inner darkness? Explains why it's so messed up. We're all a little bit Zone inside.
There's a rumor about a hidden research facility where scientists are trying to create new mutants.|Creating new mutants? Like we needed more. Zone's got a real mutant assembly line.
Did you know some anomalies can absorb your life force?|Absorb your life force? Explains why I feel so drained all the time. Zone's a real life-sucker.
They say the Zone is a living entity, with a consciousness of its own.|A living entity? A malevolent one, if you ask me. Zone's got a mind of its own, and it hates us.
Did you know some stalkers believe the Zone is a place of spiritual enlightenment?|Spiritual enlightenment? More like spiritual damnation. Zone's got a way of crushing your spirit.
There's a story about a stalker who escaped the Zone and never looked back.|Escaped the Zone? Smart move. Zone's a place you want to leave behind as quickly as possible.

Did you know some stalkers try to predict the next emission using ancient rituals?|Predicting emissions with rituals? Might as well try reading tea leaves. Zone's emissions are as random as everything else.
Heard some scientists are trying to create artificial anomalies.|Artificial anomalies? Sounds like a recipe for disaster. Zone's got enough real ones, thanks.
Did you know some artifacts are said to grant eternal youth?|Eternal youth? Sounds like an eternity of suffering in the Zone. Zone's got a twisted sense of humor.
They say the Zone is a place where dreams and nightmares become reality.|Dreams and nightmares? Mostly nightmares, if you ask me. Zone's a real dream-killer.
There's a rumor about a hidden portal within the Zone leading to another world.|Another world? Probably just as messed up as this one. Zone's got a way of making everywhere feel like a wasteland.
Did you know some stalkers believe the Zone is a place of second chances?|Second chances? More like second deaths. Zone's got a way of ending things permanently.
Heard some stalkers are trying to use trained rats to find artifacts.|Trained rats? Probably end up getting eaten by a Snork. Zone's got a way of humbling even the most innovative ideas.
Did you know some say the Poltergeists are actually the spirits of dead stalkers?|Spirits of dead stalkers? Explains why they're so pissed off. Zone's a real ghost town, literally.
They say artifacts can bring back the dead.|Bring back the dead? Probably as zombies. Zone's got a twisted sense of resurrection.

There's a rumor about a hidden complex where the Military is experimenting on humans.|Experimenting on humans? Like we didn't have enough mutants already. Zone's always upping the ante in the horror department.
Did you know some stalkers believe the Zone is a gateway to heaven?|A gateway to heaven? More like a gateway to a world of pain. Zone's got a twisted sense of humor.
They say the Wish Granter can grant any wish, but it requires a sacrifice.|A sacrifice? Probably your soul, your sanity, or your left kidney. Zone's a real demanding genie.
Did you know some anomalies are intelligent and can communicate telepathically?|Intelligent anomalies communicating telepathically? Probably plotting our demise. Zone's got a real network of evil.

There's a legend of a stalker who found a way to control the Zone's power.|Control the Zone's power? Sounds like a good way to get yourself turned into a mutant. Zone's power is not to be trifled with.
Did you know some believe the Zone is a creation of the devil?|A creation of the devil? Seems about right. Zone's a real hell on earth.
They say the Zone tests your limits. Pushes you to the edge.|Tests your limits? More like pushes you over the edge. Zone's a real stress test.
Did you know some stalkers try to capture live mutants for research?|Capture live mutants? Good luck with that. Zone's mutants are about as cooperative as rabid dogs.
Heard some traders are selling mutant body parts as souvenirs.|Mutant body parts as souvenirs? Zone's got a real macabre gift shop.
Did you know some artifacts are said to grant superhuman strength?|Superhuman strength? Probably comes with a side of radiation poisoning. Zone's got a way of giving and taking away.
They say the Zone is a reflection of humanity's darkest desires.|Humanity's darkest desires? Explains why it's so messed up. We're all a little bit Zone inside.

There's a rumor about a hidden lab where scientists are trying to merge humans and mutants.|Merging humans and mutants? Sounds like a nightmare waiting to happen. Zone's a real genetic playground for horrors.
Did you know some anomalies can drain your emotions?|Drain your emotions? Explains why everyone's so numb here. Zone's a real emotional vacuum.
They say the Zone is a living, breathing entity, with a will of its own.|A living entity with a will of its own? And that will wants us dead. Zone's a real force of nature, a destructive one.
Did you know some stalkers believe the Zone is a place of spiritual awakening?|Spiritual awakening? More like spiritual annihilation. Zone's got a way of crushing your soul.

There's a story about a stalker who found a way to leave the Zone and thrive in the outside world.|Left the Zone and thrived? Probably a fairy tale. Zone's got a way of clinging to you, even after you leave.

Did you know some stalkers try to predict the mutant migrations?|Predict mutant migrations? Might as well try predicting the lottery numbers. Zone's mutants are as unpredictable as everything else here.
Heard some scientists are trying to create a weapon using Zone energy.|A weapon using Zone energy? Sounds like a great way to destroy the planet. Zone's energy is not to be played with.
Did you know some artifacts are said to grant telekinesis?|Telekinesis? Probably makes it easier for mutants to throw you around. Zone's got a twisted sense of empowerment.
They say the Zone is a place where your deepest fears manifest.|Deepest fears manifest? Explains why it's so terrifying. Zone's a real fear factory.
There's a rumor about a hidden community of intelligent mutants living deep within the Zone.|Intelligent mutants? Probably plotting our extinction. Zone's got a real melting pot of monstrosities.
Did you know some stalkers believe the Zone is a place of second chances?|Second chances? More like a second chance to die a horrible death. Zone's got a way of evening the score.
Heard some stalkers are using trained ferrets to sniff out anomalies.|Trained ferrets? Probably just end up as a furry little snack for a Pseudodog. Zone's got a way of ruining even the cutest plans.

Did you know some say the Burer are actually humans who have been completely transformed by the Zone?|Completely transformed humans? Explains their charming disposition. Zone's a real sculptor of nightmares.
They say artifacts can control minds.|Control minds? Probably controls them to want to kill you. Zone's got a way of turning your own mind against you.
There's a rumor about a hidden sanctuary where stalkers live in peace with mutants.|Peace with mutants? Sounds like a suicide pact. Zone's got a way of shattering any illusions of peace.
Did you know some stalkers believe the Zone is a place where dreams come true?|Dreams come true? More like nightmares come true. Zone's a real dream weaver, a twisted one.
They say the Wish Granter can grant any wish, but the price is your memories.|Your memories? Might as well be a blank slate for the Zone to rewrite. Zone's got a way of erasing your past.
Did you know some anomalies are mimetic and can copy the abilities of mutants?|Mimetic anomalies? Just what we needed, more mutants with even more powers. Zone's got a real talent for escalation.
There's a legend of a stalker who found a way to become one with the Zone.|Become one with the Zone? Sounds like a good way to lose your humanity. Zone's got a way of consuming everything.

Did you know some believe the Zone is a portal to another dimension, a darker one?|A darker dimension? Hard to imagine it being darker than this one. Zone's got a way of making everywhere feel like the abyss.
They say the Zone tests your courage. Shows you what you're truly made of.|Tests your courage? Most people's courage breaks pretty quickly in here. Zone's a real fear inducer.
Did you know some stalkers try to train mutants to carry their gear?|Train mutants to carry gear? Sounds like a recipe for a mutiny. Zone's mutants are about as reliable as a broken compass.
Heard some traders are selling mutant organs as aphrodisiacs.|Mutant organs as aphrodisiacs? Zone's got a real bizarre pharmacy.

Did you know some artifacts are said to grant immortality, but only to those who are pure of heart?|Pure of heart? Ain't nobody pure of heart in the Zone. Zone's got a way of corrupting even the best of us.
They say the Zone is a reflection of our collective unconscious.|Our collective unconscious? Explains why it's so chaotic and terrifying. We're all a little bit Zone inside.
There's a rumor about a hidden society of humans who have learned to control the Zone's power.|Control the Zone's power? Sounds like a dangerous game. Zone's power is not to be tampered with.
Did you know some anomalies can alter your perception of reality?|Alter your perception of reality? Explains why everything looks so messed up. Zone's got a way of warping your mind.
They say the Zone is a living, breathing entity, with a purpose we can't understand.|A purpose we can't understand? Probably something sinister. Zone's got a way of keeping its secrets.
Did you know some stalkers believe the Zone is a place of judgment?|A place of judgment? We've all been judged and found wanting, I reckon. Zone's a harsh judge.

There's a story about a stalker who found a way to leave the Zone and become rich and famous.|Left the Zone and became rich and famous? Probably a tall tale. Zone's got a way of keeping you trapped, even after you leave.
Did you know some stalkers try to communicate with the Zone using music?|Communicating with the Zone using music? Might as well try serenading a Bloodsucker. Zone's got a tin ear.
Heard some scientists are trying to create a shield against the Zone's effects.|A shield against the Zone? Sounds like a pipe dream. Zone's got a way of penetrating everything.
Did you know some artifacts are said to grant the power of healing?|The power of healing? Except for radiation sickness, of course. Zone's got a twisted sense of medicine.
They say the Zone is a place where the veil between worlds is thin.|Thin veil between worlds? Explains all the ghosts and monsters. Zone's got a real knack for blurring the lines between realities.

There's a rumor about a hidden library containing all the knowledge of the Zone.|All the knowledge of the Zone? Probably just a bunch of dusty old books and a few cryptic messages. Zone's secrets are hard to come by.

Did you know some stalkers believe the Zone is a place of transformation, where you become your true self?|Become your true self? More likely a mutated version of yourself. Zone's got a way of stripping away the facade.

Heard some stalkers are trying to train chickens as mutant detectors.|Trained chickens? Probably just end up as a feathery snack for a pack of rats. Zone's got a way of making your best-laid plans go awry.

They say artifacts can grant you the ability to fly.|Grant you the ability to fly? Probably only for a few seconds before you crash into a Gravi anomaly. Zone's got a way of clipping your wings.

Got a bunch of mutant parts to sell.|Heard the Butcher pays a good price over at Garbage..

Heard some stalkers are trying to use homing pigeons to deliver messages.|Homing pigeons? Probably end up as mutant food before they even leave the Zone. Zone's got a way of intercepting even the most low-tech communications.

They say artifacts can grant you the ability to teleport.|Teleport? Probably teleports you right into a Gravi anomaly. Zone's got a twisted sense of travel arrangements.
There's a rumor about a hidden oasis where the water can heal any ailment.|Heal any ailment? Except radiation poisoning, of course. Zone's got a way of offering false hope.

Did you know some stalkers believe the Zone is a place where time doesn't exist?|Time doesn't exist? Explains why some days feel like weeks and some weeks feel like days. Zone's got a way of messing with your perception of time.

They say the Wish Granter can grant any wish, but the catch is you lose your shadow.|Lose your shadow? Sounds like a good way to become a ghost yourself. Zone's got a way of taking more than you bargained for.

Heard some traders are selling mutant brains as a delicacy.|Mutant brains as a delicacy? Zone's got a real gourmet cuisine.

Did you know some stalkers believe the Zone is a place where anything is possible?|Anything is possible? Yeah, like dying in a thousand different ways. Zone's got a way of making your worst fears a reality.
They say the Wish Granter can grant any wish, but the price is your soul.|Your soul? Seems a bit steep, even for a wish. Zone's a real soul collector.

Did you know some anomalies are mimetic and can adapt to any environment?|Adapt to any environment? Just what we needed, even more resilient anomalies. Zone's got a way of making things harder and harder.

There's a legend of a stalker who found a way to leave the Zone and become a powerful mutant.|Left the Zone and became a mutant? Sounds like a pyrrhic victory. Zone's got a way of twisting your desires.
Did you know some believe the Zone is a test from a higher power?|A test from a higher power? I'm failing miserably. Zone's a tough grader.
They say the Zone feeds on hope.|Feeds on hope? Explains why there's so little of it left. Zone's a real hope-killer.
Did you know some stalkers try to breed mutant rats as a food source?|Breed mutant rats? Sounds appetizing. Zone's got a real knack for creating culinary nightmares.
Heard some traders are selling Zone-grown vegetables.|Zone-grown vegetables? Probably glow in the dark and give you extra limbs. Zone's got a unique approach to agriculture.
Did you know some artifacts are said to grant you the power of persuasion?|Persuasion? Probably only persuades mutants to eat you first. Zone's got a way of making everyone hungry.
They say the Zone is a place where your inner demons come to life.|Inner demons come to life? Explains why it's so full of monsters. We're all a little bit Zone inside.

There's a rumor about a hidden facility where scientists are trying to control the emissions.|Control the emissions? Sounds like a good way to trigger a cataclysm. Zone's emissions are not to be trifled with.
Did you know some anomalies can absorb your memories and use them against you?|Absorb your memories and use them against you? Zone's got a real talent for psychological warfare.
They say the Zone is a living, breathing ecosystem, albeit a messed-up one.|A messed-up ecosystem? Couldn't agree more. Zone's a real environmental disaster.
Did you know some stalkers believe the Zone is a place where you can find true enlightenment?|True enlightenment? More like true madness. Zone's got a way of twisting your mind.

There's a story about a stalker who found a way to leave the Zone and become a legend.|Left the Zone and became a legend? Probably a myth. Zone's got a way of keeping you trapped in its grasp, even after you escape.

Did you know some stalkers try to predict the mutant attacks by studying the phases of the moon?|Predict mutant attacks by the moon? Might as well try astrology. Zone's mutants are as unpredictable as the tides.

Heard some scientists are trying to create a weapon that can destroy the Zone.|Destroy the Zone? Sounds like a good way to destroy the world. Zone's got a way of making its problems everyone's problems.
Did you know some artifacts are said to grant you the power of resurrection?|Resurrection? Probably resurrects you as a zombie. Zone's got a twisted sense of second chances.
They say the Zone is a place where your deepest fears manifest in physical form.|Deepest fears manifest? Explains all the monsters. We're all a little bit Zone inside.

There's a rumor about a hidden vault containing the secrets of the Zone's creation.|Secrets of the Zone's creation? Probably just a bunch of scientific mumbo-jumbo and a few conspiracy theories. Zone's origins are shrouded in mystery.
Did you know some stalkers believe the Zone is a living being, with a consciousness of its own?|A living being? A malevolent one, if you ask me. Zone's got a mind of its own, and it hates us.
They say the Zone tests your loyalty. Shows you who your real friends are.|Tests your loyalty? Most "friends" here would sell you for a rusty AK. Zone's a real test of character, and most fail.
Did you know some stalkers try to train mutant cats as scouts?|Mutant cats? Probably just end up as a snack for a Bloodsucker. Zone's got a way of humbling even the most ambitious pet trainers.
Heard some traders are selling mutant fur as clothing.|Mutant fur clothing? Probably glows in the dark and gives you rashes. Zone's got a unique fashion sense.
Did you know some artifacts are said to grant you the power of precognition?|Precognition? Probably only lets you see your own gruesome death. Zone's got a twisted sense of foresight.
They say the Zone is a place where the line between reality and illusion is blurred.|Blurred lines? Explains why it's so hard to tell what's real and what's not. Zone's a master of deception.

There's a rumor about a hidden garden where the plants are sentient and can communicate with each other.|Sentient plants? Probably gossiping about how tasty we look. Zone's got a real botanical network of weirdness.
Did you know some stalkers believe the Zone is a place of purification?|Purification? More like a place of corruption. Zone's got a way of twisting even the purest souls.
Heard some stalkers are trying to create mutant hybrids.|Mutant hybrids? Sounds like a recipe for disaster. Zone's got enough unique monstrosities already.
Did you know some say the Controllers can control the minds of animals?|Control animal minds? Explains why the mutants are so coordinated. Zone's got a real army of the damned.
They say artifacts can amplify psychic abilities.|Amplify psychic abilities? Probably amplifies your fear and paranoia too. Zone's got a way of turning your strengths into weaknesses.

There's a rumor about a hidden bunker where the government is developing psychic weapons.|Psychic weapons? Sounds like a recipe for global mind control. Zone's got a way of inspiring some truly terrifying ideas.

Did you know some stalkers believe the Zone is a place where the dead can return to life?|Dead returning to life? More like undead returning to haunt the living. Zone's got a twisted sense of reincarnation.
They say the Wish Granter can grant any wish, but the price is your sanity.|Your sanity? That's already hanging by a thread in here. Zone's a real mind-breaker.
Did you know some anomalies are connected to other dimensions?|Connected to other dimensions? Explains why things get so weird around here. Zone's a real interdimensional hub.

There's a legend of a stalker who found a way to travel through time within the Zone.|Travel through time? Probably ends up stuck in a time loop or erased from existence. Zone's got a way of messing with time.
Did you know some believe the Zone is a place where reality is fluid and can be manipulated?|Fluid reality? Explains all the weird anomalies and shifting landscapes. Zone's a real reality bender.
They say the Zone tests your willpower. Breaks you down and builds you back up.|Breaks you down and builds you back up? More like breaks you down and leaves you broken. Zone's a real soul crusher.

Did you know some stalkers try to communicate with the Zone's consciousness?|Communicate with the Zone's consciousness? Might as well try reasoning with a hurricane. Zone's got a mind of its own, and it doesn't care about us.

Heard some scientists are trying to create a device that can translate the Zone's language.|Translate the Zone's language? Probably just a bunch of screams and static. Zone's got a way of making itself understood without words.

Did you know some artifacts are said to grant you the power of teleportation, but only within the Zone?|Teleportation within the Zone? Still sounds dangerous. Zone's got a way of making even the most convenient abilities a liability.
They say the Zone is a place where your thoughts can manifest into reality.|Thoughts become reality? Explains why it's so messed up. We're all a little bit Zone inside.

There's a rumor about a hidden community of psionics who have learned to harness the Zone's power.|Harness the Zone's power? Sounds like a recipe for disaster. Zone's power is not to be underestimated.
Did you know some anomalies can amplify your emotions?|Amplify emotions? Explains why everyone's so on edge. Zone's a real emotional pressure cooker.
They say the Zone is a living, breathing entity, with a will of its own.|A will of its own? And that will is to mess with us. Zone's a real prankster, a cruel one.

Did you know some stalkers believe the Zone is a place where you can achieve immortality?|Achieve immortality? Probably just means you're condemned to wander this wasteland forever. Zone's got a twisted sense of eternity.

There's a story about a stalker who merged with the Zone's consciousness and became a god-like being.|Merged with the Zone's consciousness? Sounds like a good way to lose your humanity. Zone's got a way of corrupting even the most powerful beings.

Did you know some stalkers try to predict the emissions by studying the patterns of the stars?|Predict emissions by the stars? Might as well consult your horoscope. Zone's emissions are as unpredictable as the cosmos.
Heard some scientists are trying to create a device that can control the Zone's anomalies.|Control the anomalies? Sounds like a recipe for chaos. Zone's anomalies are best left alone.
Did you know some artifacts are said to grant you the power of telekinesis?|Telekinesis? Probably only works on empty vodka bottles. Zone's got a twisted sense of humor.

They say the Zone is a place where your deepest desires manifest into reality.|Deepest desires manifest? Be careful what you wish for in the Zone. Zone's got a way of twisting your desires against you.

There's a rumor about a hidden library containing the history of the Zone.|The history of the Zone? Probably just a bunch of horror stories and cautionary tales. Zone's history is written in blood and suffering.
Did you know some stalkers believe the Zone is a place of redemption?|Redemption? More like a place of damnation. Zone's got a way of making you pay for your sins.
Heard some stalkers are trying to create a map of the Zone's anomalies.|A map of the anomalies? Sounds like a good way to get yourself killed. Zone's anomalies are constantly shifting and changing.

Did you know some say the Bloodsuckers can control the minds of other mutants?|Control other mutants? Explains why they're always surrounded by hordes of flesh-eating monsters. Zone's got a real knack for creating nightmares.
